loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia  pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta y compra de artesanía, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de chompas entre otros.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the Illary III communal bank and continues to work at her business selling handicrafts. She is grateful for this loan and promises to make repayments. This borrower is responsible and persevering. She continues selling merchandise to customers who ask for it. Through this work, she is able to help her family to move forward.

The borrower is applying for a loan in order to buy sweaters and other items.

loans.use: to buy sweaters and other items.

loans.name: Delia Fortunata

texts.es:
La socia Delia Fortunata pertenece al banco comunal ILLARY III, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de ropa para bebes, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le soliciten,  siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar polos, interiores entre otros.
texts.en:
Delia Fortunata is a member of the Illary III communal bank and continues to work at her business selling clothing for babies. Delia is grateful for this loan and promises to make repayments. Delia is responsible and persevering. She continues to sell merchandise to customers who ask for it. Through this work, Delia is able to help her family to move forward.

Delia is applying for this loan in order to buy t-shirts, underwear and more.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, underwear and more.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, de 61 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, por razones de pobreza y la guerra civil que sufrió el país no pudo seguir estudiando, creció con sus padres y sus hermanos cultivando granos básicos (maíz y frijoles) y en diferentes trabajos.- Se caso cuando tenía 18 años de edad, ahora es padre de seis hijos, dos de los cuales estudian en la escuela de la comunidad segundo y séptimo grado, mientras su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Jorge, tiene mucha experiencia en trabajar con hortalizas y en la siembra de maíz y frijoles, todo lo que sabe se lo enseño su padre cuando era un joven, además trabaja en estructuras metálicas y en la carpintería, este trabajo se lo enseño un amigo desde hace quince años y la carpintería se la enseño su suegro desde hace 25 años.- Ahora trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las 5:30 de la mañana hasta las 4 o 5 de la tarde.

Jorge, necesita el préstamo para comprar un compresor para tener más equipo de trabajo, para trabajar en otras comunidades aledañas, de esa manera generará más fuentes de ingresos para su familia. El resto del dinero lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes, pues tiene un cultivo de pepino y de huisquil en la comunidad y necesita darle un buen mantenimiento para obtener buenas cosechas.

Jorge, sueña con tener bien equipado su taller y además quiere seguir apoyando a sus dos últimos hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando en la escuela y que sigan adelante con sus estudios para que sean personas profesionales y tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 61 years old and has a sixth-grade education. Owing to poverty and civil war, Jorge could not continue with his education. He was raised with his parents and siblings, growing basic grains (corn and beans) and working in different jobs. Jorge married when he was 18 years old. He is father to six children, two of whom attend the community school; they are in seventh and second grade. Jorge's wife looks after the household chores.

Jorge has a lot of experience in working with vegetables and growing corn and beans. Everything he knows he learned from his father when he was a young man. Jorge also works making metal structures, and in carpentry. Jorge learned metalwork from a friend 15 years ago, while he learned carpentry 25 years ago from his father-in-law. Jorge now works every day from 5.30am until 4 or 5pm.

Jorge needs this loan in order to buy a compressor and have more equipment for his work. He can then work in neighbouring communities and earn a higher income for his family. Jorge will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilisers as he is growing cucumbers and other vegetables in the community and needs to look after these well in order to have a good harvest.

Jorge dreams of his workshop being well-equipped. He also wants to continue supporting his two youngest children so that they may continue to attend school. He wants them to progress with their studies so that they can be professionals and enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, and to buy a compressor and have more equipment for his work.

loans.name: Jenny Jilma

texts.es:
Jenny es una mujer de 31 años, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijas de 6 y 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de pollo a la broaster.
Ella es buena madre, decidida y muy emprendedora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Santiago II’ área residencial de calles de piedra y casas de adobe, de clima frío.
Jenny es morena de físico robusto y baja estura. Su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja en construcción y con sus hijas que estudian en la escuela, viven en casa familiar construida de adobe que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de pollo a la broaster, que es un riquísimo almuerzo, que se acompaña con arroz, quinoa o batata, “el pollo es una muy buena fuente de proteína, esencial para el periodo de gestación y lactancia de la mujer…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina espiadera de pollo. Su sueño es tener una casa propia, ella desea comprar una máquina espiadera de pollo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jenny solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina espiadera de pollo para cocinar pollo al espiedo.
texts.en:
Jenny is a 31 year old woman, she lives with her spouse, and has 2 children who are 6 and 9 years old. Her business is selling broiled chicken.
She is a good mother, dedicated, and very entrepreneurial. She has her business in the area ‘Santiago II,’ a residential area with cobblestoned streets and houses made of adobe, which has a cold climate.
Jenny is darks-skinned, with a robust physique and short height. Her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish. She lives her life together with her husband, who works in construction, and with her daughters who attend school. They live in a house made of adobe that has all basic services.
Her business is selling broiled chicken, which is a delicious lunch, eaten with rice, quinoa, or sweet potatoes. “Chicken is a good source of protein, essential for the period of pregnancy and breastfeeding for women,” she says. The advantage of her business is that she has regular clients. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy a broiling machine. Her dream is to have her own house, and she wishes to have her own broiling machine.
This is the first sequence of loans with this institution in the 16 years that she has had this occupation.
It is for these reasons that Jenny asks for a loan, to purchase a broiling machine to cook broiled chicken.

loans.use: to buy a broiling machine to cook broiled chicken.

loans.name: Dora Nelly

texts.es:
Dora, de 48 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos, dos de ellos estudian el nivel básico en la comunidad, ella se acompaño hace 15 años, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y en diferentes oficios en la comunidad, ella no estudio debido a que sus padres no le dieron el apoyo.

Dora, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas como pepino, pipian y ayote, aprendió a sembrar este tipo de cultivo, gracias a un programa que hubo en la comunidad hace varios años, también junto con su pareja y sus hijos se dedican a la siembra de maíz y de frijoles, lo hacen para el sustento de la familia.- Antes, tenia una pequeña tienda la cual administraba y dejo de vender debido a que se enfermo un tiempo y tuvo que realizar varios gastos imprevistos.

Dora, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes como abono foliares y otros productos para sus cultivos, además colocará la tienda nuevamente porque en la zona no hay tiendas muy cerca y tienen que ir en su mayoría a comprar hasta el centro del pueblo y tienen que caminar más de 30 minutos. 

Dora, sueña con ir creciendo poco a apoco con su tienda; además desea que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Dora, who is 48 years old, is the mother of 6 children. Two of them study at the elementary level in the community. She got married 15 years ago, her partner works in agriculture and in different occupations in the community. She did not study due to the fact that her parents did not give her support.
Dora works farming green vegetables such as cucumber, squash, and pumpkin. She learned to farm this type of crop thanks to a program that was held in her community a few years ago. She also works farming corn and beans together with her husband and children. They do it to support their family. Before, she also had a small store which she managed, but she had to stop sales because she was sick for a while and had to make unexpected expenses.
Dora needs the loan to buy fertilizers, such as foliate manure and other products for her crops. She will also reopen a store, because in the area there are no nearby stores, and the majority of people have to go shopping in the town center, and have to walk for more than 30 minutes.
Dora dreams of growing little by little with her shop. She also hopes her children can keep studying and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, such as foliage manure, and other products for her crops. She will also reopen a store.

loans.name: Dolores De La Cruz

texts.es:
Dolores, de 38 años de edad, no pudo estudiar, está acompañada, es madre de cinco hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos estudian, mientras su pareja trabaja de vendedor en las ferias que hacen en los pueblos y comunidades, él vende bebidas, golosinas y dulces.

Dolores, anteriormente trabajó como empleada doméstica, donde estuvo por mucho tiempo para apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios, actualmente también trabaja cuidando a una anciana en la ciudad y es de ahí de donde obtiene ingresos para su familia, ella trabaja de 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 del mediodía y por las tardes se dedica a la agricultura, pues junto a su pareja ha sembrado maíz y frijoles.

Dolorea, necesita el préstamo para comprar fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y de frijoles y para invertir en colocar una tienda junto con su pareja, pues se aproximan las ferias del pueblo y de unas comunidades aledañas.

Dolores, sueña con apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios para que sean personas de bien a la sociedad, además pretende obtener buenas cosechas para darle la alimentación.
texts.en:
Dolores is 38-years old. She was not able to go to school. She is married and the mother of five children, of which two are studying. Her husband works as a merchant in the fairs held in the towns and communities. He sells drinks, candy, and sweets.

Dolores previously worked as a housekeeper for a long time to support her children in school. Now, she works taking care of an elderly woman in the city and that is how she gets an income for her family. She works from 6 AM to 12 PM, and in the afternoons she works in agriculture. With her husband, she plants corn and beans.

Dolores needs the loan to buy fertilizers to grow corn and beans, and to invest in setting up a store with her husband because the town and nearby community fairs are coming up. Dolores dreams of supporting her children in school so that they are good people in society. She also intends to have a good harvest to get food.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow corn and beans, and to invest in setting up a store.

loans.name: Bertilda Esther

texts.es: Bertilda de 55 años es una confeccionista residente en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla ubicado en el Departamento del Atlántico y en esta misma localidad se consolidan sus principales clientes a quienes ha logrado cautivar con su talento. Su idea de negoció surgió al encontrarse en una situación difícil tras haber enviudado, necesitaba continuar sustentando a sus hijos, ella decidió realizar cursos de costura y recibió apoyo de sus familiares para comprar sus primeros activos y poder iniciar su microempresa. En la actualidad cuenta con 17 años de funcionamiento y una clientela fidelizada a quienes todos los días de la semana atiende a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 4 p.m., ofreciendo todo tipo de prenda de vestir para damas y caballeros: camisas, pantalones, vestidos, uniformes de colegios, entre otros y realiza todas las operaciones de la confección, diseño, corte, preparación, ensamble y acabado de piezas.  Alterno a su actividad principal también comercializa sandalias femeninas y en la temporada que se aproxima es de suma importancia contar con el capital necesario para ajustarse al incremento en la demanda por las festividades de amor y amistad, es por ello que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en insumos para su taller entre ellos telas, hilos, apliques, botones, cremalleras y demás.  Esta inversión permitirá acortar los tiempos de producción y tener más prontamente el recaudo de sus servicios.  Su meta a futuro es mejorar las condiciones de habitabilidad.
texts.en:
Bertilda is a 55-year old garment manufacturer based in the suburb of the city of Barranquilla, located in the department of Atlántico. In this same place, she consolidates her major customers who she has managed to captivate with her talent. Her business idea came about when she found herself in a difficult situation after being widowed. She needed to continue supporting her children, so she decided to take sewing classes and received support from her family members to buy her first assets and be able to start her small business.

Now she has 17 years of operation and a devoted clientele who she attends to every day from 8 AM to 4 PM. She offers all types of clothing pieces for women and men, such as: shirts, pants, dresses, school uniforms, and others. She does all of the sewing, design, cutting, preparation, assembling and finishing of the parts.

Aside from her main job, she also sells women's sandals and in the upcoming season it is hugely important to have the necessary money to accommodate the increase of demand for the festivities of love and friendship.

For that reason, she is applying for a Credikiva. This is the first funding that she has asked for through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will invest in supplies for her workshop, including fabric, thread, appliqués, buttons, zippers, and others. This investment will allow her to shorten the production time and have a more prompt collection of services. Her future goal is to improve the conditions of her house.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her workshop, including fabric, thread, appliqués, buttons, zippers, and others.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa, de 52 años de edad, no pudo estudiar durante su infancia, está casada desde que tenía 17 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en la agricultura sembrando granos básicos como maíz y frijoles, pero además trabaja elaborando hamacas, es madre de seis hijos, pero de ella solo dependen dos hijos y un nieto.

Felipa, se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas de seda y de poliseda, además hace manteles los cuales vende en la comunidad, el trabajo se lo enseño su esposo cuando se casaron, trabaja todos los días de la semana, desde las 10:00 de la mañana. 

Felipa, necesita el préstamo para comprar 100 libras de seda, que necesita para la elaboración de las hamacas de seda, las cuales vende en la ciudad o por encargos, el resto del dinero lo necesita para la compra de insumos agrícolas para fertilizar el cultivo de maíz y de frijoles. Con ello pretende garantizar la alimentación de su familia y también vender más hamacas pues conoce muy bien el negocio y le es rentable.

Felipa, sueña con ir poco a poco aumentando la producción de hamacas, para generar mucho más ingresos para la familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felipa is 52-years old and was not able to attend school when she was young. She has been married since she was 17-years old. Her husband works in agriculture, growing basic grains such as corn and beans, and he also works making hammocks. Felipa is the mother of six children, but only two children and one grandchild still depend on her.

Felipa works making silk and faux silk fibre hammocks. She also makes tablecloths which she sells in the community. Her husband taught her the job when they got married. She works every day from 10 AM.

Felipa needs the loan to by 100 pounds of silk which she needs to make silk hammocks. She sells these in the city or by orders. She needs the rest of the money to buy agricultural supplies to fertilize the corn and bean crops. With this, she intends to guarantee food for her family and to also sell more hammocks because she knows the business very well and it is profitable. Felipa dreams of increasing the production of hammocks little-by-little to get much more income for her family and to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 100 pounds of silk which she needs to make silk hammocks.

loans.name: Marlys Patricia

texts.es: Marlys de 35 años se encuentra domiciliada en Barranquilla, un municipio ubicado en el Departamento del Atlántico en donde empezó su vida laboral antes de cumplir su mayoría de edad, laboró en distintos oficios; operaria de confecciones y auxiliar de servicios generales, y aprovecho la oportunidad para ofertar a sus compañeros productos de uso personal.  En la actualidad cuenta con este ingreso extra con el cual ha logrado ofrecer bienestar a sus cuatro hijos de los cuales tres son aún menores de edad.  Promueve productos por intermedio de catálogos especializados y continua con su rutina laboral como de costumbre, sin embargo su capital le es insuficiente para responder a las solicitudes de sus compañeros de trabajo  y para mitigar esta situación está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en prendas de vestir y productos de belleza de la oferta del catálogo. Esta inversión es muy significativa para lograr sus metas a futuro; tener un local y su casa propia.
texts.en:
Marlys is 35-years old and lives in Barranquilla, a town located in the department of Atlántico where she began her working life before she was an adult. She worked in different trades like clothing worker and general service assistant, and she took advantage of the opportunity to offer her friends personal use products.

Now, she has this extra income with which she has managed to offer her four children wellbeing, with three of them being minors still. She promotes products through specialized catalogs and continues with her work routine like usual. However, the money is not enough to meet the requests of her work colleagues, and to relieve this situation she is applying for a Credikiva. This is the first funding that she has asked for through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will invest in buying articles of clothing and beauty products from a supply catalog. This investment means a lot to achieve her future goals, which are to have a store and her own home.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing and beauty products from a supply catalog.

loans.name: Vilma Haydee

texts.es:
Vilma, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, creció con sus padres trabajando en las artesanías de hilo elaborando hamacas y manteles, se acompañó hace 12 años, su pareja trabaja de mesero en un restaurante de la comunidad todos los días y tienen 3 hijos.

Vilma, se dedica a la crianza de especies menores como pollos de engorde desde hace varios años, pero también tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas en la ciudad, por las tardes su padre le ayuda a cuidar los niños para que ella pueda estar en la ciudad vendiendo las tortillas.

Vilma, solicita el préstamo para comprar 8 sacos de maíz, porque es su materia prima para poder elaborar las tortillas, también invertirá en concentrado pues también tiene el negocio de los pollos de engorde y necesita 
tener ingresos económicos a diario para sustentar su familia. 

El sueño de Vilma, es construir su vivienda para poder darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma is 26-years old. She went to school through high school. She grew up with her parents working with thread crafts, making hammocks and tablecloths. She got married 12 years ago and her husband works as a waiter in a restaurant in the community every day, and they have 3 children.

Vilma has worked raising small animals like broiler chickens for several years, but she also has a business selling tortillas in the city. In the afternoons, her father helps her to mind the children so that she can be in the city selling the tortillas.

Vilma is asking for a loan to buy 8 sacks of corn because it is the main ingredient to be able to make the tortillas. She will also buy chicken food because she has the broiler chicken business and she needs to have a daily income to support her family. Vilma's dream is to build her own home to be able to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Jesus Heraldo

texts.es:
Jesús, de 36 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad que no están estudiando; Él estudió hasta noveno grado y se retiró por no tener suficientes recursos económicos para seguir estudiando, su pareja es ama de casa.

Jesús, es albañil desde hace 16 años, aprendió trabajando como ayudante para un amigo, antes era agricultor pero no tenía los ingresos que tiene hoy, porque ahora trabaja por contrato y a veces tiene que ir a otro departamento a trabajar.- Pero Jesús quiere empezar a criar ganado, porque eso da muy buenos ingresos. 

El crédito que solicita es para comprar dos novillas que le venden a buen precio, porque con el crédito anterior compró dos vacas.

Los sueños de Jesús, es que un día poder tener bastante ganado y más que todo vacas para que la leche le vaya generando más ganancias y así darle el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Jesús, 36 years old, is partnered and has 2 children, ages 9 and 6, who are not in school. He went to school up to the ninth grade and dropped out because he didn't have sufficient economic resources to continue studying. His partner is a homemaker.

Jesús has been a bricklayer for 16 years. He learned it by working as an assistant for a friend. Before, he was a farmer but he didn't have the income that he has today because now he works by contract and sometimes he has to go to another department to work. But,
Jesús wants to begin to raise cattle because this give a very good income.

The loan he requests is to purchase two heifers that are being sold to him at a good price, because with the previous loan he purchased two cows.

Jesús's dream is to one day be able to have enough cattle, and above all cows, so that the milk he produces will generate more income and, so, give sustenance to his family.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers.

loans.name: Elba Argentina

texts.es:
Elba, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada desde hace 29 años, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, juntos tuvieron 4 hijos.

Elba, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 30 años, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres quienes desde muy pequeña le enseñaron, pues era la única forma en que pudo trabajar.- Pero además de la agricultura se encarga de los oficios domésticos del hogar y para desempeñar su trabajo recorre un aproximado de 1 kilómetro al día para llegar al lugar de trabajo y su horario es de 5 horas al día. 

Elba, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas entre otros.- Esto le ayudara a tener un mejor ingreso con la producción que obtendrá. 

Ella sueña con seguir trabaja y esforzándose y además desea que sus dos últimos hijos que están estudiando logren graduarse de bachillerato y luego puedan optar por una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Elba, 49 years old, went to school up to the third grade. She has been married for 29 years, her husband works in agriculture and together they had 4 children.

Elba has worked in agriculture for 30 years. She learned this work from her parents who taught her from when she was very young, since it was the only way in which she could work. But, in addition to agriculture, she takes care of the household chores and to carry out her work, she goes approximately 1 kilometer daily to get to the work place and her schedule is 5 hours daily.

Elba needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and more. This will help her to have a better income with the production that she will get.

She dreams of continuing to work and make efforts and, also, she wants her last two children who are going to school to manage to graduate from secondary school and then be able to choose a university major.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and more.

loans.name: Veronica Guadalupe

texts.es:
Verónica, de 28 años de edad, estudio noveno grado, está soltera,  se dedica a la agricultura y también es capacitadora comunitaria, en su casa sus padres y una hermana.

Verónica, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 12 años, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres quienes desde muy pequeña le enseñaron todo lo relacionado al campo.- Para desempeñar su trabajo tiene que caminar a diario un aproximado de 22 kilómetros para desempeñarlo. 

Verónica, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono y herbicidas, para cultivar maíz, esto permitirá que tenga mejores ingresos con la venta  que haga porque cosechará más. 

Ella sueña con seguir trabajando y hacer su propia casa y tener su propio terreno donde pueda trabajar.
texts.en:
Verónica, 28 years old, went to school up to the ninth grade. She is single and works in agriculture and is also a community trainer. She lives with her parents and one sister.

Verónica has worked in agriculture for 12 years. She learned this work from her parents who taught her everything about the countryside from when she was very little. To carry out her work, she has to walk approximately 22 kilometers daily to do it.

Verónica needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure and herbicides to grow corn. This will allow her to have better income with the sales which she makes because she will harvest more.

She dreams of continuing to work and having her own house and her own land where she can work.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies such as manure and herbicides to grow corn.

loans.name: Odile

texts.fr: Célibataire et sans enfant, Odile est une femme âgée de 27 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Odile est une couturière qui vend aussi des amuse-gueules dans son atelier de couture. Odile s’approvisionne deux fois par mois marché et nécessite ce crédit pour commander des rouleaux de doublures, des triplets de fermetures et des cartons de biscuits en vue de gagner un gain et pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens éprouvée.
texts.en: Single and with no children, Odile is a 27-year old woman living in Tokoin. She is a seamstress who also sells snacks in her sewing workshop. Odile gets her supplies twice a month at the market and needs this loan to order rolls of interlining, three-packs of closures and boxes of biscuits in order to earn an profit and provide for her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy three rolls of lining, twenty three-packs of closures and one box of biscuits.

loans.name: Thai's Group

texts.en:
Thai’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Thai makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Thai and her other group member to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yern's Group

texts.en:
Yern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yern works as farmer and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Yern and the other group members to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Vy's Group

texts.en:
Vy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vy works as farmer and he also does extra work as factory laborer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est femme âgée de 30 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mariée et mère de quatre enfants, Afi est une marchande de poissons frit qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et dans les quartiers les plus proches. Afi désire ce crédit pour financer son achat des paniers de poissons frais et des litres d’huile en vue de tirer profit et gagner plus de revenus afin de mieux contribuer aux charges éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a 30-year old woman living in Tokoin. Married and mother to four children, Afi is a fried fish seller who gets her supplies twice a month at the market and resells in front of her home and in the closest neighbourhoods.

Afi would like this loan to finance her purchase of baskets of fresh fish and litres of oil in order to make a profit and earn more income so as to better contribute to the expenses incurred by the family.

loans.use: to buy six baskets of fresh fish and twenty litres of oil.

loans.name: Tomaziana

texts.en:
Tomaziana has been in business activities since 2014. She started with her own working capital of $100.

She has a kiosk in front of her house and she is taking a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use the loan to buy additional supplies including hand and body lotion, baby oils, perfume, soaps, hair oils, detergents, shampoo, eggs, candles, biscuits, soft drinks and other things to sell.

She is taking this loan because she wants to open a big store in the future. She was very happy when the Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan to her, because she can use this loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy hand and body lotion, baby oils, perfume, soaps, hair oils, detergents, shampoo, eggs, candles, biscuits, soft drinks and other things to sell.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help Sophal and the other group member to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Tayyibenur

texts.en:
Tayyibenur is 28 years old, married and a mother of two. Before she got married worked in a hair saloon and she took courses both on apprentice and headworker and also gained money. She quit her job after marriage. After having two children she started the same job at home to make a contribution to the family budget. With the help of the loan from Maya she is planning to buy hairdressing materials in bulk.



Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Tayyibenur 28 yaşında evli ve 2 çocuk annesi. Tayyibenur Hanım evlenmeden önce kuaför yanında hem çıraklık ve kalfalık eğitimi almış hem de para kazanmış. Evlendikten sonra bu işi bırakmış. Çocukları olduktan sonra ev bütçesinde eşine destek olmak amacıyla kuaförlük işlerini evinden yapmaya başlamış. Maya dan aldığı kredi ile toptan kuaför malzemesi aldı.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing materials

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en: Vergenia is a 62-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with six adult children. Her husband is a farmer while Vergenia is engaged in raising pigs business to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Vergenia and her husband works together for the future. They wish to succeed in their life to have better ways of living in the future. Thus, Vergenia is asking a loan to buy piglets and feed.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
As a farmer from Phnum Sruoch District, Kampong Speu Province, Mao, 35 years old, is working very hard on the rice field near her house. Mao has four children. Her husband also is a farmer in the same field. This couple can earn approximately USD 3 a day. Being a farmer is the main task that she has done for more than ten years.

In this farming season she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming Mao is borrowing some money from KIVA now to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and other related materials. Mao thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds and insecticides.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is 55 years old, married woman. She is been in business of beauty parlor for many years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her good services, she has become very famous in her street.

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. That is why she has applied a loan of 60000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers for gaining profits to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and hair rollers to treat more customers for gaining profits to build her own house

loans.name: Sarum's Group

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. loans.name: Savan's Group

texts.en:
Aged 55 years, Savan is married with three dependent children and lives in the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she needs to support these three children and one of whom is still in school. She earns a living through growing rice which she has been involved in for ages. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Her rice was destroyed by insects, so she did not get good yield.
For Savan, this is her first time with VisionFund and she is a group leader which consists of three members. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support on her farmland to get more yields for her family and she also use her loan to buy medicine to support her health. She hopes that her rice grows well and earns her with good income, so she can save for health care service of her beloved children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to grow her crop well and increase her income to save for health care service of her beloved children.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ddc Group

texts.en:
Sara, who is in her early 30s, is single with one kid who is in school. She has been running a retail shop for three years now. She works from 8am to 4pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Sara’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the shop's stock which is now serving more people. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is so grateful with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment, bought a TV set, a radio and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the items in the shop inventory. She dreams of expanding her business.

Sara will share this loan with her loan group DDC which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the  out of stock items in the shop inventory.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es: Reinaldo es un microempresario residente de Barranquilla, un municipio ubicado en el Departamento del Atlántico y cuya inspiración de negocio nace del Carnaval, un acontecimiento cultural que se celebra en Barranquilla, en el que se expresan todas las variedades culturales y el folclor de la Costa Caribe colombiana, así como las más variadas manifestaciones culturales locales, la música popular y el baile.  Él aprendió a elaborar disfraces típicos con ayuda de un familiar quién lleva años en esta labor y hoy en día deslumbra con el colorido y la fantasía que impregna en cada una de sus creaciones. Él cuenta con una amplia experiencia de 10 años distribuyendo a municipios de la Costa Caribe en donde prevalece el folclor entre ellos está Valledupar y Ciénaga, a quienes provee de los disfraces más tradicionales;  Marimonda, Garabato, el Congo, el Monocuco, las Cumbiambrera, zapatos chicharrones, correas y accesorios de los disfraces.  Reinaldo es muy comprometido con su trabajo y de lunes a sábado atiende su negocio a partir de a las 8 a.m. a 6 p.m., sin embargo su capital le es insuficiente para responder a los requerimientos de sus clientes y para vencer esta limitante está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en materias primas tales como telas de fantasía, hilos, elásticos, y demás.  A raíz de esta inversión su negocio será más productivo y le apuntará a la meta de ampliar su taller.  Reinaldo se encuentra separado de su cónyuge sin embargo es responsable del bienestar de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is a small-business entrepreneur who lives in Barranquilla, a city located in the Atlántico Department. The inspiration for his business sprang from the Carnival, a cultural event celebrated in Barranquilla that expresses all the cultural variety and the folklore of Columbia's Caribbean coast with an assortment of performances that display local culture, popular music, and dancing.

Reinaldo learned to make traditional costumes with the help of a relative who spent many years in this work. Today, Reinaldo dazzles with the color and the fantasy that he imbues into each of his creations. He has ten years of extensive experience, delivering his costumes to the cities along the Caribbean coast where the customs of the Carnival thrive. These include Valledupar and Ciénaga, where he provides the more traditional costumes such as the Marimonda, Garabato, Congo, Monocuco, and Cumbiambera. He also delivers chicharrones (special costume shoes), belts, and other costume accessories.

Reinaldo is very committed to his work. He tends his business from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m., every Monday through Saturday. Nevertheless, he has insufficient capital to fill all of his customers' orders. To overcome this limitation, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first that he has requested from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, that he will invest in supplies like costume fabric, thread, elastic, and other things. With this investment, his business will be more productive, which will help him achieve his goal of expanding his workshop. Reinaldo is separated from his spouse, but nevertheless he is responsible for the well-being of his two children.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as costume fabric, thread, elastic, and other things.

loans.name: Xenia Margarita

texts.es:
Xenia, tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 6,7 y 8 años de edad, su esposo la abandonó con sus hijos; ella solo estudio hasta quinto grado.

Xenia, se dedica al comercio de ropa para hombre, mujer y niños, este oficio lo aprendió de su madre, ella comercializar la ropa de forma ambulante en el lugar donde reside y en los cantones aledaños.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar más ropa para hombre, mujeres y niños; con el objetivo de surtir el negocio, porque lo que invierte no es suficiente y de los ingresos que genere podrá darle el sustento a su familia.

Los sueños de Xenia son, un día tener su propio almacén de ropa y que sus hijos se superen.
texts.en:
Xenia is 31 years old, and a single mother of three children who are 6, 7, and 8 years old. Her husband abandoned her and the children. She only attended school through the 5th grade.

Xenia makes a living selling clothing for men, women, and children. This is work she learned from her mother. She sells the clothing as a street vendor in the area where she lives and in the surrounding cantons.

The loan she is requesting is for purchasing more clothing for men, women, and children, with the goal of stocking up her business, since what she invests is not sufficient. From the income she generates she will be able to provide for her family.

Xenia's dreams are to one day have her own clothing store and for her children to excel.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for men, women, and children.

loans.name: Maa Chotirai Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Koushalya is a 50-year-old divorcee standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Odisha, India. Life was never easy for her after her husband left her. All the burdens of her family came to her shoulders. But she never broke; she was always rock strong in order to move on and lead a happy life with her only daughter.

Koushalya is currently engaged in cultivating green leafy vegetables and works hard in order to meet the household needs. However, due to a lack of financial resources, Koushalya is unable to provide a higher education to her only daughter.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Koushalya will use her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees for her daughter's banking course. The loan amount will help her daughter to pursue her higher education smoothly and efficiently and make her become a successful banker.

Koushalya is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for her daughter's banking course

loans.name: Joe

texts.en:
Joe, who is 48, is from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Digna, who is self-employed and with whom he has three children, two in high school and the other elementary school. The couple help each other make a living and want to give the best for their children.

Joe has been operating his small general store for seven years. His earnings have greatly helped cover their daily living requirements. He sells dry and packaged commodities directly to consumers. All products are essential food and household items. He earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. 

To help him sustain his business he is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan to fill his store with rice, canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, soda, toiletries, etc. Although there are times that his sales are low, he perseveres and believes that sales will pick up as he puts his trust in God. His store means a lot to him as it is the main source of income to send his children to school. He believes that education is their hope and the path to a better life for his children.

Joe, like any other loving father, dreams to see his children finish college and become successful professionals. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Dilbir

texts.en: Dilbir is a 40-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband (also pictured) to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Dilbir is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would allow her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Kulmira

texts.ru: Кульмира погасила свой кредит, она успешно инвестировала в свой бизнес и очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Кульмира вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку обуви и вещей для реализации. Доходы от кредита Кульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса. Она не оставляет свою мечту открыть собственный оптовый обувной магазин.
texts.en:
Kulmira paid off her previous loan and successfully invested in her business. She is very thankful to Kiva and to everyone who helped her financially.

She has again approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase footwear and other items for sale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further building up her business, and won't let go of her dream to open her own wholesale shoe store.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes for resale in order to increase the selection in her shop and be more competitive

loans.name: Maa Chotirai Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Manjulata is a 38-year-old, humble lady standing to the left-hand side in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Salepur, Odisha, India.

Manjulata is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

Therefore, she along with her fellow group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. Manjulata will use her portion of the loan amount to buy more stock of ingredients like flour, dough, sugar, oil, honey, vanilla essence, cocoa powder, etc., for preparing food.

Her business goal is to have more business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients like flour, dough, sugar, oil, honey, vanilla essence, cocoa powder, etc., for preparing food.

loans.name: Renacer 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Renacer 2 está integrado por 15 mujeres, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una luchando por mejorar sus vidas a través de este programa.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Norma  quien ayuda a su familia a través de este programa, ella es una mujer muy luchadora que está esforzándose para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta tarde en las noches.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder surtir su despensa, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando para seguir dando lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Renacer 2 group is comprised of 15 women. They are in the poverty elimination program. Each one is struggling to improve their lives through this program.

Norma is one of the members who helps her family through this program. She is a tenacious woman who is putting forth great effort to be able to improve her living conditions and those of her loved ones.

She has a well-stocked grocery store. She works there every day starting in the very early hours of the day until late in the evenings.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy supplies to stock her grocery store. This way she will be able to continue with her sales and struggling to continue giving the best to her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies in order to be able to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Laboriosas De Ybytymi Group

texts.es:
El grupo Laboriosas de Ybytymi es un grupo nuevo, las integrantes se pusieron como meta crecer no solo en lo económico, sino también como personas. El grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, todas luchando y esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Benigna quien se dedica a la cría de animales, y posterior venta de leche y quesos. Ella es una mujer muy luchadora ya que se esfuerza para poder crecer y dar a su familia y seres queridos una vida digna.
La señora solicita de este préstamo para la compra de Animales  para su posterior venta de productos que son la leche y el queso, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Laboriosas de Ybytymi group is a new group. The members set their goal as growing, not only financially, but also personally. The group is in the elimination of poverty program. All of them are struggling and putting forth great effort to improve their living conditions.

Benigna is one of the members. She raises animals and then sells milk and cheeses. She is a very tenacious woman because she puts forth a lot of effort in order to be able to grow and to give her family and loved ones a decent life.

She is requesting this loan to buy animals for the later sale of milk and cheese. This will help her to have to firm up her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Maa Chotirai Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Usharani is 32 years old. She is standing to the left-hand side of the photograph. A divorced woman, she lives with her parents and siblings in a small village of Salepur, Odisha. She got separated from her husband before one year for personal reasons.

Now she owns a grocery shop and earns 3,000 INR per month for her livelihood. She sells cereals, biscuits, sugar, spices, chocolates, soaps, detergents and other general items used in households. Her father helps in this business.

She wants to renovate her grocery shop and also wants to add more products in her shop so she can cater to the needs of her customers. She, along with her fellow group member, has requested a loan of 30,000 INR to buy grocery items in bulk to resell, and she will also use a part of this loan for the renovation of her shop.

She is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for the opportunity she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy grocery items in bulk to resell and renovate her shop.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma, se ha decido por un nuevo crédito por el buen servicio que recibe de la institución y los beneficios que le traen en su economía familiar, en esta oportunidad comprara loza, barro, nacazcol y arenilla, para fabricar ollas, sartenes, cantaros, etc., así como también harina, quesillo, chicharrón y aceite, para elaborar la venta de pupusas, espera mantener su fuente de ingresos con vida.
Ella comenta que su negocio está más fuerte, tiene clientes satisfechos, su familia se mantiene y gozan de óptima salud.
texts.en:
Zulma has decided upon a new loan because of the good service she gets from the institution and the benefits it brings to the family finances. This time she will buy earthenware, clay, dye, and fine sand to make pots, pans, and pitchers. She will also buy flour, soft cheese, pork rinds, and cooking oil to make 'pupusas' [stuffed tortillas] to sell.

This way she hopes to keep her source of income alive. She says that her business is stronger, she has satisfied customers, and her family continue to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy crockery, clay, 'nacazcol' [black dye used for making pottery], and fine sand in order to make pots, pans, and pitchers, etc.  She will also buy flour, soft cheese, pork rinds, and cooking oil to make 'pupusas' [stuffed tortillas] to sell.

loans.name: Maa Bramhanei Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Manasi is a 52-year-old single mother standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Salepur, Odisha, India.

Life was very tough for her after her husband left her alone. All the burdens of her family came to her shoulders. But she never broke; she was always rock strong in order to move on and lead a happy life with her only son.

Manasi is currently engaged in a poultry farming business and works hard in order to meet the household needs. However, due to a lack of financial resources, Manasi is unable to provide a higher education to her only son.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Manasi will use her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees for her son's ITI course. The loan amount will help her son to pursue his higher education smoothly and efficiently.

Manasi is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for her son's ITI course.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia, who is in her late 40s, is widowed with two kids, one of whom is in school and the other grown. She has been a food vendor for ten years now. She works from 5:30am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Rukia’s 19th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to improve her business through buying sacks of Irish potatoes, tins of cooking oil, and charcoal for cooking and has paid back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees and loan repayments, to buy a plot of land, to rent A-frames, and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal for cooking, rice, beans, meat, flours, etc., to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of expanding her business. Rukia will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, charcoal for cooking, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Maa Bramhanei Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Sumitra is a single mother who was abandoned by her partner five years ago, making her the sole guardian of her daughter. She has moved forward and wants to be a good person. Sumitra is a grocer by profession.

She was seized by illness, which impeded her regular work. She is looking for support to realize the operation that she needs. For the moment, she is only able to use painkillers, which bring her another kind of pain to the point to which she can no longer work normally. Her regular work activities and the care of her daughter are putting her in danger.

She, along with her group member, is asking for a loan amount of 30,000 INR to be able to undergo the operation, continue her normal activities, and be able to take care of her daughter, who wants to support her mother as much as possible. Sumitra feels that if her illness worsens, she will not be able to take care of her daughter, and she would not be able to find support from her family members, leaving her daughter all alone.

The lady standing to the left in a pink saree is Sumitra.

loans.use: to be able to undergo an operation.

loans.name: Adjo Juliette

texts.fr: Adjo est une femme célibataire qui vit à Tokoin. Agée de 24 ans, Adjo est une marchande des chaussures et des produits de beauté qui s’approvisionne cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend au bord de la route. Adjo désire ce prêt pour commander des unités de chaussures tapettes et chaussures à talons en vue de tirer un maximum de profit afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins et améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Adjo is a single woman who lives in Tokoin. She is 24 years old. Adjo sells shoes and beauty products that she purchases at the market five times a month and then resells along the roadside.

Adjo would like this loan to order units of flipflops and high heals. Her goal is to make a high profit in order to be able to meet her needs and improve her daily living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 13 units of flipflops and 10 units of high heals.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en: Saira is a 42-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. He needs to replace his van's tires. Saira has requested this Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR so her husband is able to buy new tires along with auto spare parts for the van and provide better facilities to his customers. Saira is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and auto spare parts for her husband's van.

loans.name: Isaac Antonio

texts.es: Don Isaac de 61 años de edad se dedica desde hace 24 años a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia para luego comercializar sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Isaac is 61 years old. For 24 years he has dedicated himself to farming, growing corn and beans. When his harvest is ready, he stores it in the granaries shown in the photograph, and he later sells his products in the various markets located near his home. He lives with his wife and his two children in a house that they own. He is applying for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control products, etc., so that he can continue his work and have a better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control products, etc.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Kabita is a 53-year-old widow standing in the middle in the photograph. She hails from a small village of Salepur, Odisha, India. Life was very tough for her after her husband's demise. All the burden of her family came to her shoulders. But she never broke; she was always rock strong in order to move on and lead a happy and peaceful life with her only son.

Kabita is currently engaged in cultivating wheat and works hard in order to meet the household needs. However, due to a lack of financial resources, Kabita is unable to provide a higher education to her only son.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. Kabita will use her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees for her son's ITI course. The loan amount will help her son to pursue his higher education smoothly and efficiently.

Kabita is in dire need of your kind help.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for her son's ITI course.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Riaz is a 47-year-old married woman; she is shown in the photo with her son.

She has been involved in the business of cloth trade. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells it in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Riaz has requested a Murabaha loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business, to get a boost in her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business, to get a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.name: Najwa

texts.en:
Najwa is a 47-year-old married mother of one. Three years ago, due to the low salary of her husband, she started selling linens to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children.

Najwa is a hard worker who succeeded throughout the years to gain her loyal customers. She is trying desperately to develop her business. Thus, today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of linens to satisfy her customers' special requests.

Najwa hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her family with a better income.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of linens to satisfy her customers' special requests.

loans.name: Dora Ilsa

texts.es: Dora de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda y venta de tortillas ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 24 años tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vecinos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dora, age 43, lives in her own house with her husband and her four children.  For 24 years, she has owned a small store and tortilla shop, located in her home.  She has a lot of customers, especially her neighbors.  With the money she gets from her sales, she manages to pay for some of her household expenses.  

She is asking for a loan to be able to buy more soup, eggs, basic grains, drinks, snacks, sweet breads, etc. and in this way, to be able to increase her income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, drinks, snacks, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and stocks of sugar, tea leaves, rice, soap, etc., for the shop.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 41 years old. He is married and has two children. His businesses are a motorcycle taxi and farming. He has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings.

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy another motorcycle.

He will use the profits from his expanded business to diversify business by opening a shop. His hope and dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Marie Sabrina Sophia

texts.fr: Marie Sabrina a 27 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a deux enfants. Ses enfants sont régulièrement scolarisés. Pour trouver de l’argent pour s’occuper des enfants, elle a ouvert une petite boutique où elle vend un peu de tout : produits cosmétiques, alimentaires, quincailles, etc. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour acheter un stock de serviettes hygiéniques et d’ampoules électriques.
texts.en: Marie Sabrina is 27 years old. She is in a common-law relationship and has two children. Her children regularly go to school. To find money to take care of the children, she opened a small shop where she sells a bit of everything: cosmetic products, food, hardware, etc. She needs a loan to buy a stock of sanitary napkins and electric bulbs.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sanitary napkins and electric bulbs.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Veuve, Afi est une femme avec trois enfants à charge. Afi est âgée de 50 ans et habite à Tokoin où elle prépare et vend de la pâte faite à base du maïs. Afi s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation trois fois par mois au marché et vend sa marchandise à domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Afi sollicite ce crédit pour commander des bols de maïs et des douzaines de poissons congelés en vue de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients afin de gagner plus de bénéfices et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et d’améliorer ses conditions de vie quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Widowed, Afi is a woman with three children in her care. She is 50 years old and lives in Tokoin where she prepares and sells mash made of corn. Afi gets her supplies to prepare it three times a month at the market and sells her goods at home and in the surrounding neighbourhoods.

Afi is requesting this loan to order bowls of corn and dozens of frozen fish so as to satisfy her clients' needs, in order to earn more profits and be able to provide for her children's needs and improve her daily living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 30 bowls of corn and five dozen frozen fish.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.fr: Rose Marie, 55 ans, est veuve. Elle a cinq enfants dont deux sont encore à sa charge et les autres sont mariés et autonomes. Elle vend des produits alimentaires et elle souhaite augmenter ses revenus afin de pouvoir payer les études universitaires de ses deux plus jeunes enfants. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock de riz et de farine. À l’avenir, elle espère attirer plus de clients.
texts.en: Rose Marie, 55 years old, is a widow. She has five children including two that she is still caring for and the others are married and self-sufficient. She sells food products and wishes to increase her income in order to be able to pay for the university studies of her two youngest children. She is requesting a micro loan to increase her stock of rice and flour. In the future, she hopes to attract more customers.

loans.use: to increase her stock of rice and flour.

loans.name: Anee

texts.en:
Anee is a single woman. She is shown in the photo with her brother.

Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at her home. Anee is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw material, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business.

Therefore, she has requested a Murabaha loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase a new stitching machine along with stitching material, such as threads, laces and buttons, to stitch up more dresses on time. She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine along with stitching materials, such as threads, laces and buttons, to stitch up more dresses on time.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Namita lives with her husband and 3-year-old daughter in Salepur, in rural Odisha. She is a daily wage labourer who manages the household expenses with her household monthly income of 7,000 INR. She has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity.

Namita's family is one of the millions affected by rural India's sanitation crisis. Joining hands with one other member whose family faces similar problems due to a lack of sanitation facilities, Namita has formed a group and is hoping to address this issue. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in the false privacy of dense bushes or isolated fields. Due to this lack of sanitation facilities, her family is at risk of infection and fall ill often, spending a significant portion of their savings on medical expenses each month. The women and daughters are exposed to the additional risk of molestation.

So, taking advantage of the awareness initiatives and opportunities offered, the group now seeks a loan of 30,000 INR to build toilets in their homes. Your loan will help these two industrious, rural Indian families to access basic sanitation, and consequently result in safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

Namita is standing to the right hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Swarnapai Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Nilendri is a 28-year-old, humble married lady. She is standing to the extreme right in a yellow saree. She hails from a village of Salepur, Odisha, India. Her problem is that she has no toilet at home or in the immediate vicinity. Without access to a toilet, her family has to walk long distances to relieve themselves in an open field, which makes the ladies and girls more vulnerable to diseases and crimes.

To address this issue, Nilendri, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR to build a new toilet and install the necessary sanitary fittings to it. Access to a toilet will be a big step towards a better standard of living for her family, and she will be able to safeguard her family's health.

loans.use: to build a new toilet and install the necessary sanitary fittings to it.

loans.name: Sainte Anne

texts.fr: Sainte-Anne, âgée de 51 ans est une femme mariée et la femme de trois enfants qui ont tous déjà leur propre foyer. Son activité consiste à vendre des boites de conserve à glace, qui sont très utilisées par les marchands de boissons dans la zone. Ces boites leur permettent de garder les boissons fraiches pendant toute la journée, avec de la glace. Sainte-Anne a déjà eu recours au crédit pour renforcer son commerce. Elle a bénéficié de dix prêts et a une très bonne historicité de crédits. Sainte-Anne cherche un nouveau prêt pour diversifier son stock en achetant de nouveaux modèles de conserve.
texts.en:
Sainte-Anne, aged 51 years old, is a married woman and the mother of three children who all already have their own home. Her activity consists of selling ice coolers, which are often used by the drinks sellers in the area. These coolers allow them to keep the drinks cool all day, using ice.

Sainte-Anne already used loans to build her trade. She benefitted from ten loans and has a very good credit history. Sainte-Anne is looking for a new loan to diversify her stock by buying new models of coolers.

loans.use: to diversify her stock by buying new models of coolers.

loans.name: Swarnapai Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Sasmita is 25 years old. She is standing to the left hand side in the photograph. She is a divorced and young lady entrepreneur who started her tailoring business at the age of 23 when she separated from her husband. She is now into her second year of business. She has one small daughter in her care. Her enterprise caters to part of the population of 500 at a small village in Salepur, Odisha, India.

Sasmita, along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR. She will utilize her portion of the loan amount to enable her to stock material, since the main market is not very accessible. She will use this loan to purchase cloth and thread in bulk to make dresses. This enables her to sustain her family in her own 1,000 sq. ft. home. An expansion in the business will enable her to better provide for her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase cloth and thread in bulk to make dresses.

loans.name: Swarnapai Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Champabati, 34, standing in the middle in the photograph, is a charismatic and hardworking lady from Salepur, Odisha, India. She has a family of four and is a blessed mother of two sons who are currently in school.

Champabati hails from a low-income household and has access to very limited resources. For this reason, she was never able to build a suitable toilet for her family. Without access to toilet, she faces a lot of problems as she has to travel a long distance to relieve herself. She no more finds it feasible enough to depend on an open field for defecation.

Therefore, Champabati, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 45,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to build a hygienic toilet and install a commode in it. Access to basic sanitation will consequently result in safety, improved health, medical savings, and improved productivity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic toilet and install a commode in it.

loans.name: Swarnapai Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Nirmala is a 33-year-old woman from Salepur, Odisha, India. She is standing to the right hand side in the photograph. She works for a daily wage on the agricultural farms.

In order to maximize her efforts, she is running a small-scale animal husbandry business, too. The family of four earns a monthly household income of 8,000 INR. Half of the income being utilized as expenses, they end up saving 4,000 INR per month.

Nirmala has bigger dreams. She wants to get rid of financial dependency and wants to become secure. This will require a lot of savings and a lot of hard work. Nirmala doesn't think twice to invest her best efforts. She wants to expand her animal husbandry business and increase her income.

She, along with her group member, is seeking a loan of 30,000 INR. Nirmala will use her portion of the loan amount to buy a buffalo, with which she expects to increase her monthly income by 3,000 INR.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en: Yousef is an 18-year-old, young man from Bethlehem City. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Yousef has a workshop for repairing electrical appliances in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income. Yousef took a loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him buy new tools for his workshop. He hopes that his new tools will enable him to increase his sales and customers and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his workshop .

loans.name: Orlando Ovidio

texts.es: Don Orlando de 50 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el se dedica desde hace 30 años al cultivo de maiz, frijol y yuca, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Orlando is 50 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and his four children.

He has been earning a living for 30 years growing corn, beans, and yucca. He is selling his produce on several markets that are located near his home.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, and so on, and to improve the land shown in the photograph to keep on working and improve his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, and so on, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is a 46-year-old working woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband in trying to improve their financial situation, so she started a business selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children, and help with their education.

Musarat is famous among her neighbors for her collections, and she has a good client list.

Currently she needs a Murabaha loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase good-quality clothes in different colors. This investment would earn her a substantial profit, and would help her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality clothes in different colors, which will earn her substantial profit.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia owns a motorcycle transportation business, and she also grows and sells rice. She is married with four children. She needs a loan to buy a sidecar for her transportation business and farm supplies like fertilizers and rice seedlings for her farm business. With these she will be able to expand her two sources of income to become sustainable, and she can continue to support the schooling of her children and provide healthy meals as well.

loans.use: to buy a sidecar for her transport business and farm supplies for her farm business.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 24 years old and she is a mother of two children and two dependents who are her relatives. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda and she is engaged in operating a salon as a hairdresser.

She is located on one of the busy streets in town. Her customer turnout is good and she is so far happy with the progress of her business, which she started in the year 2014.

Her hope for her family is that she can educate her children, and her business desire is to expand her salon and be able to make enough money to build a family house in the future.

Harriet is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics and items for use in her salon.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and items for use in her salon.

loans.name: Chrip

texts.en:
Chrip, a 47-year-old mother of five children, lives in a rural area of Khsach Kandal District, Kandal Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she works as a farmer on a small rice field near her house. It has been almost twenty years that she has been involved in this career, which allows her to make USD 5 per day.

Chrip would like to get loan from HKL to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of her family members. This is her fourth loan. Chrip thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than a general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is in her early 40s and is single, with three school-age children. She has been running a grocery store for six years now. She works from 4pm to midnight daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Sophia's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep increasing drinks in her grocery and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is doing great with her loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan, build her house, and cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy the fast-selling drinks in her grocery store. She dreams of owning a pub.

Sophia will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast-selling drinks in her grocery store.

loans.name: Señor De Qoyllority De Chinchero Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE QOYLLORITY DE CHINCHERO, él banco esta ubicado en la provincia de Cusco.
La socia Romania continua con su negocio  de tienda de abarrotes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua vendiendo lo que son arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, zucar entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Señor de Qoyllority de Chinchero", which is located in the province of Cusco.

Romania still owns her business of a grocery store. She is a responsible and dedicated person and keeps selling rice, sugar, milk, and so on, to all demanding customers.
