She wants to keep working to keep supporting her family this way.

She is requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, and so on.

She feels grateful for the granted loan and commits to comply with her set payment dates.

The person with the cut-out face is not part of the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and so on.

loans.name: Nabeela

texts.en: Nabeela is a 24-year-old, married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring to produce income for her household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a murabaha loan (a form of credit sale acceptable under Sharia) of 20,000 PKR to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles, and scissors for stitching more dresses on time to boost her earnings. She wishes to spend her increased income on providing quality life to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sumiyati

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Sumiyati, one of Ruma's agents. Sumiyati lives in North Bogor, located about one hour and thirty minutes from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her sons. Together with her husband, they own and manage a stall where they sell accessories, school stationery, toys, and frames. Their community can buy all of these things at very cheap prices. Right now, because Sumiyati has become a Ruma agent, she also provides a service that allows the community to buy mobile airtime credits. She wanted to join Ruma to manage another business opportunity, as well as contribute more to her community.

As the business grows, Sumiyati is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful to help Sumiyati to improve her business and, accordingly, to help her community that needs access to such services. As seen in the photo, Sumiyati is the one who is standing in her own stall. She will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph has asked for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for his transport business, which is his major economic activity and locally known as bodaboda. He gets additional income from cocoa farming. He is married with two children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He started the business five years back but with little progress due to inadequate capital. This limits his profits. However, he dreams of expanding his transport business and being able to buy land and build a permanent house for the family. He is very hardworking and believes that his job will help him to succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 45 years old. She is married and has six children. Her business is a retail shop and tailoring. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 4,000 KES.

This is her third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase a sewing machine. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 38 years old, married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family.

He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Nasreen has requested a loan from Murabaha for 30000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for the van.

Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her husband's taxi that will create less pollution and use less oil.

loans.name: Cesaltina

texts.en:
Cesaltina has completed building her house, only paint and ceramic tile on the veranda remains. She has plans to complete her house, but she doesn't have enough money to buy the rest of the materials.

So, she is requesting a loan of $1,000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete her house. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy materials such as tiles, tile cement, paint, a hand brush, roller brushes and other materials.

She is happy with the loan that offered from Tuba Rai Metin to her.

loans.use: to buy tiles, tile cement, paint, a hand brush, roller brushes and other materials.

loans.name: Arcely

texts.en:
Arcely is a married woman, 54 years old with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a buy-and-sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines.

Arcely has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more bottles of herbal medicine to sell. Arcely has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bottles of herbal medicine to sell.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Uzma is a 37-year-old lady who lives with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been driving a rickshaw for several years, but he has been generating insufficient income to feed his entire family. Now he has to maintain the rickshaw but he does not have sufficient capital to fix the problem.

Therefore Uzma has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to enable her husband to repair his rickshaw.

She thanks Kiva and the field partner for this honorable support.

loans.use: to enable her husband to repair his rickshaw.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 40 years old and single.

Aileen runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products.

Aileen has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Aileen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
He is 26 years old. He is self-employed and works as a plumber. He finished his training in plumbing in 2012 at a Technical Training Institute in Nairobi and since then has been working as a plumber. He also works as a contractor in solar water heater installation.

His aim is to become a contractor in plumbing and solar installation. Through this he will also have the capacity to employ fellow youths from his community and expand his business.

His greatest challenge, however, has been the lack of tools and equipment for his trade which has become a hindrance to him working efficiently.

He requests financial assistance from Kiva to purchase a plumbing tool kit. This will assist him in realizing his goals.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for plumbing

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
Sitha’s Group lives in a rural village in Kandal province, in Cambodia.

Sitha works as a farmer and he also does extra work as a factory laborer to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean, drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 53 years old. She is married and has five children. Her business is farming and selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in the business for six years. She earns a monthly income of fourteen thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of kale, cabbage, potatoes, tomatoes, bananas, avocados and onions to sell.

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy stock of kale, cabbage, potatoes, tomatoes, bananas, avocados and onions to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Chona

texts.en:
Ma. Chona thanks Kiva and its supporters for previously granting her a loan which helped finance her direct selling business. Her income helped fund their daily needs and the schooling of her child. Being a single parent is a challenge but she faces it with courage and perseverance to secure her child's future.

She trusts that she can again avail herself of a loan of PHP 19,000 to buy more quantities of "Life" health supplement products to meet the advanced and increasing orders of her customers. Her pleasant disposition has earned her regular customers, and most of her clients have come through recommendation. Her neighbors, friends, family, and the local community are her base clients.

Her earnings cover their daily sustenance and help fund her child's high school education. Ma. Chona trusts that she will reap the fruits of her labor and gain more customers. She wants her child to finish her studies.

She faithfully meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for several bottles of "Life" products (health supplements) to sell.

loans.name: Maa Chotirai Shg-A Group

texts.en: Bharati is a mother of a teenaged child. She is a grocer by profession and is the one standing on the extreme right in the photograph. Her family is dependent on agriculture for a living. Bharati and her family do not have a toilet in their home. They have to walk long distances to answer nature's call in private: in dense bushes or isolated fields. They often resort to waking up before sunrise to relieve themselves in private. She and her family are subsequently at risk of infection, molestation, and even insect or animal bites.Bharati understands the importance of having a toilet at home and is a concerned woman. She leads a group of three women who have come together to apply for a loan of 45,000 INR. They need the loan to build toilets in their respective homes. Access to a toilet will mean privacy and peace of mind for these families. It will also mean they no longer need to walk long distances, especially when they are sick. Your loan will provide these three families the privacy of using their own toilet, which will be a big step towards a better standard of living for them. Higher standards of hygiene will also lead to reduced medical expenses, and hence, more savings in the long run.

loans.use: to build a toilet

loans.name: Flora Lupe

texts.es:
Flora es una señora de 45 años vive junto a dos de sus hijos en el Recinto Cristóbal Colon, sector perteneciente a la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una zona muy productiva en ganadería y en cacao, palmito y otros.
Flora vive en casa propia, cuenta con su pequeña finca que gracias al esfuerzo diario pudo ir mejorándola poco a poco.
Flora comenta que su vida no ha sido fácil, tuvo que sacar adelante sola a sus tres hijos, trabajó muy duro para poderles dar un hogar y los estudios, ahora uno de ellos ya estudia la universidad y pronto será un profesional; se siente muy orgullosa por que sus hijos son  buenos estudiantes y la han apoyado mucho.
Flora trabaja todos los días, cuenta con una producción de palmito y cacao, además cría animales; se levanta desde muy temprano hacer la limpieza y mantenimiento, ya en días de cosecha contrata a empleados para poder sacar el producto. Flora con este crédito podrá comprar abonos y fertilizantes para poder seguir mejorando su producción, se siente feliz porque instituciones como Kiva apoyan al pequeño microempresario a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Flora is a 45 year old woman who lives with her two children in the Cristobal Colon community, an area belonging to the city of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. It is an area with high production of livestock, cacao, palmito and others.

Flora lives in her own house and has a small farm that thanks to her daily efforts is improving day by day. Flora comments that her life has not been easy, having to raise three children by herself and work hard to be able to provide them a home and their education. Now one of them is studying at university and soon will become a professional. She is very proud that her children are good students and supports them a lot.

Flora works every day. She has her palmito and cocoa crops and she also raises animals. She gets up very early to do the cleaning and maintenance and for harvest she hires employees to harvest the product. Flors will buy manure and fertilizer with the loan to continue to improve her production. She feels happy that institutions like Kiva support small micro entrepreneurs to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers to continue improving production.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a 35-year-old married woman. Her husband provides transportation services using an auto rickshaw. He has been driving it over rough roads, which has caused a lot of depreciation. His rickshaw had become fully depreciated, so he sold his old auto rickshaw. Now he wants to buy a new one. But the amount he received from selling the old one does not fully cover the purchase price of a new rickshaw.

This is the reason Ishrat has requested a loan. She will use the loan money for her husband so he can buy a new auto rickshaw and can drive it smoothly. Ishrat thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband's transportation services

loans.name: Ayaba

texts.fr: Ayaba est une veuve femme résidant à Baguida et âgée de 69 avec deux enfants à charge. Ayaba est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile. Pour financer son achat, Ayaba nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et venir en aide aux diverses charges de sa famille.
texts.en: Ayaba is a 69-year old widow who lives in Baguida. She has two children in her care. She retails charcoal, which she stocks up on three times a month at the market and resells at home. In order to fund her purchase, Ayaba needs this loan so she can order sacks of charcoal and make more profit. She will thereby be able to help out with the family's various expenses.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Conforte

texts.fr: Conforte est une veuve femme résidant à Baguida avec trois enfants à charge. Conforte est une marchande de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Conforte sollicite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin de gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir soutenir ses enfants à bien étudier et atteindre leurs objectifs.
texts.en: Conforte is a widow who lives in Baguida with three children in her care. She buys and sells charcoal which she stocks up on twice a month at the market and resells in front of her home. Conforte is requesting this loan so she can order sacks of charcoal and make more profit. She will thereby be able to help her children to complete their studies and achieve their objectives.

loans.use: to buy five sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Dora Emilia

texts.es: Maria de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de utililez escolares, venta de tortillas y cultivo de granos basicos desde hace 10 años su esposo le ayuda con el trabajo, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda contruyemdo un muro de contencion pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de materiales de contruccion y asi poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en: Maria is 62 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. She has worked selling school supplies, selling tortillas and growing basic grains for ten years. Her husband helps her with the work. She wants to improve her house by building a retaining wall. As she does not have sufficient capital she is requesting a loan to buy construction materials. In this way she will be able to make her house more secure.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 57 years old. She is married and has eight children. Her business is selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of kale, cabbages, potatoes, tomatoes, bananas and onions for sale.

She will use the profits from expanded business to open a shop. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy stock of kale, cabbages, potatoes, tomatoes, bananas and onions for sale.

loans.name: Luthfi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s clients, Luthfi. Luthfi lives in North Bogor, located about one hour and thirty minutes from Jakarta, the capital city. Luthfi is a young man who has a dream to become an entrepreneur. He owns a stall where he sells mobile airtime credits to his community. He also feels happy he joined Ruma because he says that Ruma's staff are really helpful and informative.

As his business grows, Luthfi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community, especially on weekends. Your loan will be very useful to help Luthfi improves his business and in turn, his community who needs access to such services.

He is thankful for your support

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication service by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Archee

texts.en:
Archee is 22 years old and single with one child.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Archee is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

Archee has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from weaving.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr: Jocelyne est âgée de 51 ans. Elle vit en union libre et a trois enfants à sa charge. Elle vend des produits alimentaires pour pouvoir gagner des revenus pour prendre soin de sa famille. Pour éviter des ruptures de stock, elle demande un microcrédit pour commander plus de stock que d’habitude.
texts.en: Jocelyne is 54 years old and lives together with her partner and has three children in her care. She sells groceries so she can make an income to take care of her family. In order to avoid running out of stock, she is requesting a microloan to order more goods than usual.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap’s group live in a rural village in Battamabang province in Cambodia. Sopheap works as seller and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is a 41-year-old, married mother of three children, who works hard to support her family. She is a teacher and her husband works in agriculture. Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of their son's education. This loan of $1,000 USD will allow Cristina to help her son to graduate from senior high school until university. She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies. Cristina loves her son very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en: Sopheap’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sopheap makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and credit officer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
Sokheng’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokheng makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and tailor to support her family. She is using her portion of the loan to buy a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rum's Group

texts.en:
Rum’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Rum makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor and credit officer to support his family. He is using his portion of the loan to buy a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip and regularly suffers from power outages 12-16 hours a day. He lives with his family in a small house. As an employee in the public sector, he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. Because he is not able to save enough money, Imad took a USD loan from FATEN. With this loan, he will buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. Palestinians use water boilers that use either gas or gasoline to heat the water before a shower, which can be dangerous, expensive and inefficient. This will help him to provide hot water without using electricity, which is much more expensive.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Khalifa

texts.en:
Khalifa, who is in his mid 50’s, is married with six children; two of them are in school and the other four are grown up. He has been selling charcoal and operating construction activities for 25 years now. He works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Khalifa's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to sell and to buy cement, sand, and pipes for his construction business. Khalifa will make sure he pays back his loan within the scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell and to buy cement, sand and pipes for his construction business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a widowed woman. She has three children. She describes herself as faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.

Susan will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children and have a stable business. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feeds for her fish.

loans.name: Cherry May

texts.en:
Cherry May is 22 years old and single with one child. Cherry May works very hard to provide for them.

Cherry May runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products.

Cherry May has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future Cherry May would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Jenerous

texts.en: Jenerous is a new client and a small-scale farmer who has applied for a loan of UGX 600,000. She is a parish chief of Itojo Ntungamo. She is married to Paddy and has two children aged 17 and 12. She needs the money to pay tuition for her son who is sitting for his senior exams this term. She is grateful that UGAFODE is willing to fund her son's tuition.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Vibol

texts.en: Vibol, aged 49, is a rice farmer living in a small wooden house located in Kandal province where she has been doing rice farming for ten years. This married mother has three dependent children to take care of, one of whom is still in school. To earn additional income, Vibol and her husband raise animals and sell some sweets and snacks in their community. They can save approximately 7 USD per day. Lack of working capital is the main obstacle to her farming business, thus Vibol is applying for a loan from VisionFund, which will be her first cycle. The entire loan will be used to buy cows to help in rice farming. She hopes that the crop will return for her good yields so that she can meet the family’s needs on time, especially to buy school materials for her school-aged child.

loans.use: to buy cows for her farm

loans.name: Olandina

texts.en:
Olandina lives in Liquiça. She is a tailor and she is happy to do her activities. She said, "living in a town is very competitive in earning money unless we do some activity which is profitable in order to survive."

Looking for ways to earn money, Olandina came up with an idea to open a sewing service for all people. She started her sewing service in 2010 with her own working capital of $500.

She is applying for a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy more materials like cotton, linen, meters,sewing needle, scissors, rope yards, sewing fabrics, and other materials to use.

loans.use: to buy cotton, linen, meters,sewing needle, scissors, rope yards, sewing fabrics, and other materials to use.

loans.name: Sayeeda

texts.en:
Sayeeda is 40 years old and a mother of five children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business four years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Sayeeda buys materials such as hand-embroidery kits, ribbons, needles and an embroidery machine from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in the embroidery business. Saeeda requested this loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

Sayeeda will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for her business

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sreymom makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. Her portion of the loan will be used to purchase a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Yern's Group

texts.en:
Yern’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Yern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. Her portion of this loan will be used to purchase a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Samnang's Group

texts.en:
Samnang’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Narin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and tailor to support her family. Her portion of the loan will be used to buy a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Khimhoung's Group

texts.en:
Khimhoung’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Khimhoung makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. She is using her portion of the loan to buy a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rany's Group

texts.en:
Rany’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Rany makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. She is using her portion of the loan to buy a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rouba

texts.en:
Rouba is a 39-year-old married woman who started tailoring curtains seven years ago to help her husband in covering their needs and expenses. She is a very talented woman who is well-known among her region for her good taste.

Rouba is trying hard to develop her business, therefore she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy fashionable textiles which will increase her production and satisfy her customers' special needs.

Rouba hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fashionable textiles which will increase her production

loans.name: Grisell Angie

texts.es: Grisell. es una joven universitaria de diecinueve años de edad estudia la carrera de Cosmética Dermatológica,estudia esta carrera por que le apasiona el mundo de la belleza,lleva estudiando dos años y medio le falta un ciclo para terminar la carrera gracias a Dios le va muy bien ya que no ha desaprobado ningun curso y ha pasado con buenas calificaciones,en sus ratos libres y fines de semana ayuda a su mamá en su salon de belleza. el prestamo que solicitó lo invertirá para el pago de las mensualidades que son muy costosas se siente feliz de estar logrando sus sueños de ser profesional y algun dia tener su propia empresa y seguir capacitandose,Grisell dice: "Que bueno que existan gente como Kiva que ayudan a muchos jovenes a salir adelante y cumplir con sus sueños de ser profesionales,Muchisimas Gracias.
texts.en:
Grisell is a young university student. She is 19 years old and is studying dermatology. She chose this degree because she is passionate about the world of beauty. She has been studying for two and a half years and has one semester left. Thanks to God, Grisell's studies are going very well. She has failed no modules but passed with good grades.

In her spare time and at the weekend, Grisell helps her mother at her beauty salon.

Grisell is applying for this loan in order to pay monthly tuition fees, which are expensive.

Grisell is happy to be achieving her dreams of being a professional, of one day owning her own business, and of continuing training in her field.

Grisell says, "It's so good that people like those at Kiva are helping many young people to move forward and achieve their dreams of becoming professionals. Thank you very much."

loans.use: to pay monthly tuition fees, which are expensive.

loans.name: Ilaha

texts.en:
Ilaha was born in 1983. She is married and lives with her family in the Fuzuli region. She has a child and the child is 6 years old and she studies in pre-school.

Ilaha is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fuzuli city. She is in the sales business. She needs her first loan of an amount of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan she wants to buy foodstuffs to sell in order to increase her income.

She is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization and lenders for the help.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell in order to increase her income.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 43 years old. She is married and has six children. She is a farmer, mostly of mangoes, maize and cow peas. She has been in the business for 11 years. She earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand Kenya shillings.


This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a water pump. She will use the profits from expanded business to reinvest in the business to boost it.


Her hopes and dreams are to expand her agriculture business to be able to fully support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for her farming business.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. Her primary customers are locals.

Mercy describes her family's challenge to be lack of clean water. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a 5,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a 5,000 litre water tank.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells beauty products, . She has been involved in this business for 3 years and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products.

She hopes that in the future, she will expand business.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Being an operator of one motorized tricycle unit (one of the common means of public transportation in the Philippines), Tessie wants to thank Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and lenders for their consideration of her previous loan application. Without the amount, she would not know how to survive in the business every time there is something that needs to be fixed on the vehicle, since she lacks supplementary capital. The amount that she applied for previously was used for the maintenance of her tricycle unit.

Now, she is planning to buy another tricycle unit and hire one driver. That is why she applied for another loan of PHP 20,000 as added capital. She is praying that God will touch the hearts of people who have the capability to help and return abundant blessings to them.

Despite being busy managing the business, Tessie finds time to attend CCT group fellowship which consists of 10-15 individuals. Here she can gain strength spiritually, hear testimonies from other CCT partners and be able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase another tricycle unit.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is encouraged that she has received loans twice which has helped sustain direct selling of personal products. She is able to send her children to school and meet the family's daily living expenses.

Now that it is school time in the Philippines, there are more orders of her personal products. In this regard she needs funds to pay for products such as footwear, underwear, body powder, soap, cosmetics, and towels. Although there were times that she couldn't collect from some customers, she is thankful that she has some new good customers. She thanks Kiva and its supporters for supporting her in her livelihood.

Jenalyn prays to have more customers and for all her children to finish school. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy a stock of products like clothing, footwear, underwear, and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Genevie

texts.en:
Genevie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business such as net, gasoline, wood, etc.

Genevie has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Genevie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her fishing business such as net, gasoline, wood, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This nice and beautiful lady’s name is Emma, and she lives with her parents in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region.

Emma is a designer but unfortunately has been unable to find a job in that profession. Now she works as an administrator for a private company.

Emma is happy but is facing a great deal of stress because she is planning to get married to her beloved boyfriend. Emma, like many girls, has dreamed of her wedding day, which she hopes will be very nice, cheerful and unforgettable. This loan in the amount of 400,000 Armenian drams would help Emma pay certain costs for her wedding party, and she sincerely hopes that Kiva lenders will support her during this important and significant period of her life.

loans.use: to pay for the costs of her wedding party

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
Cecile is 41 years old and has six children. Cecile is married and her six children are presently in school.

Cecile is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cecile requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Cecile has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed six times from NWTF in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Cecile would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vacccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sarum's Group

texts.en:
Sarum’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sarum makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. She is using her portion of the loan to purchase a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Saret’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Saret makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor seller and teacher to support his family. He is using his portion of the loan to purchase a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Arn's Group

texts.en:
Arn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Arn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and seller to support her family. She is using her portion of the loan to purchase a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kyae Chan Su Village Group

texts.en:
Than (pictured in the middle), from Kyae Chan Su Village, is married and farms at his 6-acre paddy farm. His wife takes cares of house chores and also does tailoring in the village. Both of them look after their raised ducks turn by turn.

This loan will help the couple purchase high quality feeds and other farming necessities. They have many years of duck-raising experiences, and hope to have high production rates in the future so that it helps them invest in upcoming rounds.

Pictured above are members from Kyae Chan Su Village Group, named Than, Myo, Zaw, Win and Aye. This loan will help 26 of these group members purchase ducks and the vaccines that will make ducks be healthy and more productive.

This village is located in Kyae Chan Su Village in Myanmar Ayeyarwaddy River, Delta Region. Besides duck farming, for businesses, villagers do fishing, tailoring and agricultural productions.

loans.use: to purchase high quality feeds

loans.name: Alcira Del Carmen

texts.es: Alcira de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos y su abuela, ella se dedica a la venta de tostaditas de papas, yuca, platanitos su negocio lo tiene ubicado en un lugar muy transitado cerca de su lugar de residencia, por esa razón posee mucha clientela, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas tostaditas de papas, yuca, platanitos todo por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Alcira is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her 3 children and her grandmother. She makes a living selling tostaditas [a traditional snack] made with potato, yucca, and bananas. Her business is located in a heavily trafficked area near her home, so she has many customers. She is applying for a loan to buy more tostaditas made with potato, yucca, and banana in bulk so that she can make sales and earn better profits in order to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more tostaditas [a traditional snack] made with potato, yucca, and banana in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in: galvanized metal, wood, nails, and wire to put a roof at the front of his home.

loans.name: Alvah Mae

texts.en:
Alvah Mae is a dealer of a personal products. She sells items like tooth paste, powdered soap, toilet bowl cleaner perfume and other household wares. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a married woman with a two year old son. In addition to that business, she also raises and sells hogs.

She is asking for a loan to purchase additional personal products like powdered soap and also to buy piglets and feed. These will help ensure that the supplies will be delivered on time and attract more clients to order. It will also improve her hog raising business and enable her to improve her capital.

In the future, she is hoping that both ventures will become successful.

loans.use: to purchase personal products like powdered soap and also to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Thảo

texts.en:
Mrs Thảo is an ethnic minority. She is 44 years old, and she is married. 
Thảo has been working in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. 
She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. 
Her family is a low-income household in her village. The income from this business is unstable because when some disease of poultry happens, they could die, which would leave her with nothing to sell and cause trouble with finances.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Thảo is that her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.
In 2005, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Thảo has successfully repaid 10 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.
With her business profit, Thảo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself as honest.

He operates a retail business where he sells water. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to finance digging another bore hole. This will enable him have more water for sell.

loans.use: to finance digging another bore hole to sell more water.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
JUAN CARLOS TIENE 33 AÑOS, CONVIVIENTE CON 01 HIJA LA CUAL ESTUDIA EN UN COLEGIO PARTICULAR DE LA ZONA., CONOCIDO EN EL MEDIO POR SU LABOR DE OBRERO EN COSTRUCCION, VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD UBICADA HABITADA POR GENTE AMABLE DEDICADA A LA AGRICULTURA , COMERCIO Y GANADERIA, CONOCIDA COMO EX COOPERATIVA CAYALTI, DE LA PROVINCIA CHICLAYO, REGIÓN LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU.

JUAN CARLOS SE DEDICA A PRESTAR SERVICIO COMO OBRERO EN COSTRUCCION DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS POR ZONA DE RESIDENCIA Y ALREDEDORES.CON EL CRÉDITO COMPRARA ANIMALES MENORES PARA DEDICARSE A LA CRIANZA Y VENTA.EL CREDITO A OTORGARLE LE FACILITARA OBTENER INGRESOS ADICIONALES PARA SU UNIDAD FAMILIAR Y ASI PODRÁ MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 33 years old and lives with one daughter who studies at a private school in the area. He is known for his work as a construction worker. He lives in a community known as the Ex Cooperative Cayalti, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru. The community is inhabited by friendly people who work in agriculture, sales, and cattle ranching.

Juan Carlos has made a living as a construction worker for several years in and around the residential zone. With the loan he will buy young animals in order to make a living raising and selling them. The loan will help him to get additional income for his family so that he can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy young animals in order to make a living raising and selling them.

loans.name: Ramrose

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Ramrose works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from farming rice.

Ramrose is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Claire Marchy

texts.en:
Claire Marchy is a single woman, 19 years old and she has one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Claire Marchy has a vegetable business in the Philippines. Claire Marchy requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of onions and garlic to sell to her local market.

Claire Marchy has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of onions and garlic to sell to her local market

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 54 year old, hardworking woman who has 6 children. One of her sons is also shown in the photo. She has been providing services sewing clothes in her locality. Zakia’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele. She is quite popular for her skills in sewing.

Zakia has requested a Murabaha loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine, spools of thread and lace for meeting the demands of her customers consistently. She aspires to save money for a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine, spools of thread and lace for meeting the demands of her customers consistently

loans.name: Damiao

texts.en: Damiao is a 32-year-old married father of two children who works hard to support his family. He is a teacher. Although the family works very hard, it is difficult for them to afford the cost of his sister's education. This loan of $1000 will allow Damiao to send his sister to university. He will use the loan to pay for registration and buy all the materials. Damiao loves his sister very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future. Now his sister studies in the capital, far from the family.

loans.use: to pay for school registration and buy materials.

loans.name: Naeed

texts.en:
Naeed is a 50 year old, married woman with 3 children. She is shown in the photo with her husband. She is a vigorous lady and, for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now, she has requested a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Naeed expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 23 year old married woman. Her husband is also shown in the photo with her. He has been running a small shop for many years where he sells various items such as calling cards, mobile accessories, chargers, etc. He earns a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Currently Maria has applied for a Murabaha loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile batteries. With the help of this loan, her husband can meet the increasing demands of his clients and generate more revenue.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as calling cards, memory cards, and mobile batteries

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is aged 30. She is a mother of three children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits etc. He manages his household necessities from his own store, as well his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with an even tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town, and that is the reason his business runs well.

Due to good relations his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Parveen requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc. Parveen hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way, this amount will help him to cope with the demands of her family.

Parveen thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a businesswoman who uses her three-wheel vendor’s cart to earn an income. She states that she does not want to be overly dependent on her husband in supporting the household. In 2013 Regina entered into business with 500 USD, her own working capital. She has applied for a 1000 USD loan through Kiva's field partner Tuba Rai Metin to bolster her business by stocking her cart with salt, cooking oil, tea, biscuits, cigarettes, eggs, soy sauce, ketchup, lighters, beer, soft drinks, fruit and other things to sell.

loans.use: to bolster her business by stocking up her cart with additional products.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Vanny’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Vanny makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and seller to support her family. She is using her portion of the loan to purchase a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Shim's Group

texts.en: Shim’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Shim makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses. They will also save time by not having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
A senhora  Amélia de 59 anos de idade é pensionista militar, casada e mãe solteira de 5 filhos sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela na sua casa.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo  pretende comprar  cimento, barrotes, portas, areia, pedra, varões, para dar continuidade a sua obra.
O seu sonho é  terminar a obra, adquirir bens para seu o bem estar  e fazer um muro de vedacao do seu quintal.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e para superá-los  conta com ajuda de seu esposo também pensionista militar  e que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para para concretizar os seus planos. Com o empréstimo anterior iniciou a obra.
texts.en:
Amélia, 59, is retired from the military. She is married and the mother of five children. She also sustains two grandchildren that live with her.

She says that with the requested amount, she is planning to buy cement, bars, doors, sand, stones, and beams to continue with the construction works.

Her dreams are to finish the construction works, buy some goods for her own well-being, and build a separation wall around her yard.

She says that her biggest challenge is the lack of funding. Her husband, who is also retired from the military, helps her to overcome it. She also says that she will apply for more loans to realize her plans. With the previous loan, she started the construction works.

loans.use: to buy cement, bars, doors, sand, stones, and beams.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 40 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is selling poultry and vegetables. She is in her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to buy poultry and vegetables for sale. She will use the profits from the expanded business to save towards buying a piece of land. Her hopes and dreams are to build rental houses and educate her children to the highest level.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and poultry for sale.

loans.name: Sav's Group

texts.en:
Sav’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sav makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mrs Lai is 63 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall, selling fish for more than ten years.

Lai lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her household was recognized by local government as poor. In addition, the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

In 2008, Lai joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution Limited Liability to improve her business. Lai has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

In the future, Lai hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Rabishe

texts.en:
Rabishe wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan. She has used the loan to make some small renovations and to purchase a deep frying machine for the French fries and other fried foods.

She is very satisfied for the help of the loan and her business and again requests a loan, this time to renovate to improve the environment, have a pleasant and cleaner restaurant and give people a better place to sit and enjoy their food. The improvements should also attract new customers.

She is very grateful for the second opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support(Picture shows Rabishe and her husband.)

loans.use: to renovate to improve the environment, have a pleasant and cleaner restaurant and give people a better place to sit and enjoy their food.

loans.name: Carmina Pilar

texts.es: La Sra. Carmiña Pilar de 41 años de edad vive actualmente en domicilio propio, tiene dos hijos que depende de ella, los cuales se encuentran estudiando uno en la universidad y el otro en el nivel primeria, tiene su esposo  el cual trabaja como docente en la universidad salesiana, vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio Monteagudo. Su principal actividad de la solicitante, es la transcripción ya que cuenta con capacitación en el instituto de enseñanza comercial computacional ING DATA. Es por eso que requiere el préstamo que será destinado para la compra  de equipo de computación y materiales para transcribir, con la compra de la misma la solicitante emprenderá esta actividad por lo tanto podrá generar buenos ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida en su hogar y su diario vivir con su esposo brindando de esta manera una mejor educación para sus hijos, ya que esta actividad requiere de menor inversión una vez establecida la actividad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmiña Pilar is 41 years old and currently lives in her own home. She has two children that depend on her, both of whom are studying. One is in the university and the other in primary school. Her husband works as a teacher in the Salesiana University and lives in the Chuquisaca department in the town of Monteagudo.  

The applicant's main activity is transcription. She was trained at the commercial computational teaching institute ING DATA. This is why she needs a loan to buy computer equipment and transcription materials. With this purchase the applicant will begin this activity and will generate good income and improve the living conditions in her home and her day to day life. She will live with her husband, which requires less investment and this way she can provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy computer equipment and transcription materials so that she can generate income that will help her family financially.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Good day, lenders!

This is one of Ruma's agents, Ahmad. Ahmad lives in North Bogor, located about one hour and thirty minutes drive from Jakarta, the capital city. Ahmad lives there with his wife and his only daughter.

He sells mobile airtime credits for his community. He also feels happy that he joined Ruma because for him, Ruma’s services are the best. He learnt a lot about how to manage his business from Ruma, as well as how to manage his income and savings.

As the business grows, Ahmad is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile payment services to his community, especially on weekends. Knowing the importance of this, your loan will be very useful in helping Ahmad to improve his business and hence his community, who need access to such services.

Ahmad is standing here in the photo, and he will be thankful for your support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Nimol's Group

texts.en:
Nimol’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nimol makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor and construction worker to support her family. She is using her portion of the loan to purchase a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Phat's Group

texts.en:
Phat’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and seller to support her family. She is using her portion of the loan to purchase a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sophea's Group

texts.en:
Sophea’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sophea works as factory laborer and she also does extra work as driver to support her family. She is using her portion of the loan to purchase a water filter.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Marady's Group

texts.en:
Marady’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Marady makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and officer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ser's Group

texts.en:
Ser’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ser makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as construction worker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Socheat is a 23-year-old single student who resides in the Banteay Meanchey Province of Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in marketing at a university in the province.

Now Socheat is requesting a loan because he is short of the finances to cover his fourth-year tuition fees. This loan will help him have enough finances to cover his tuition fees and complete the fourth year at university successfully.

In the future, Socheat dreams of having a good job with a decent salary, thereby improving his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to cover his fourth-year tuition fees.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 32 years old. He is married and has one child. His business is farming and electronics repairs. He has been in this business for 13 years. He earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings. 


This is his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and spare parts for electronics. He will use the profits from expanded business to expand the business and educate his child. 


His hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and a stable business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and spare parts for electronics.

loans.name: Maima

texts.en:
Maima is a 31-year-old mother with seven children.

Maima runs a business selling fish in her village and at the market to earn a living.

Maima requested a loan to buy a fishing net, an ice bag, torch, and container to help her run the business.

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business. Maima joined SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, fishing gear, an ice bag, torch, and container

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory is 76 years old. He is married and has 11 children. His business is farming and livestock keeping. He has been in this business for 20 years. He earns a monthly income of eight thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his 4th loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy a water pump. He will use the profits from expanded business to buy cattle and goats.

His hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy a water pump

loans.name: Derly

texts.en:
Derly is 62 years old and widowed with eight children.

She is in agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. Derly is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, corn seed and other farm supplies.

Derly has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, corn seed and other farm supplies

loans.name: Diosita

texts.en:
Diosita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Diosita is 46 years old and has one child still in school.

Diosita has a general store business in the Philippines. Diosita requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products.

Diosita has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, soap, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Siham

texts.en: Siham is a 60-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She and her husband cooperate together to be able to pay the high costs of living. Fifteen years ago, she opened a store which sells wedding dresses to supplement her income and live in better conditions. Today, she is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a new collection of wedding dresses and accessories with the aim of enhancing her income and thus her way of living, which makes her very happy.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of wedding dresses and accessories.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 46 years old, married and has six children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase a water pump to spray water on her crops.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump to spray water on her crops.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 53 years old; she's married and has 1 child to provide. She owns and manages her vegetables garden in their backyard. She plants different kinds of vegetables just to earn for a living. Her husband is a vendor, so with the help of her husband in selling the vegetables that she has been harvested, they were able to support and sustain the needs of the family. She wants to increase their income and recently decided to borrowed loan from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer for her vegetables that she is going to sell in the market and be able to produce good quality of product in her customers.

Vicenta's plan for the future is to save money out from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her vegetables that she is going to sell at the market

location.town: Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Hana`a

texts.en:
Hana`a  is 40 years old and caring mother of four children she is working hard to provide good education  and good life for her children. 
Her husband is working with a very low income in one of the sewing shops, and because that  Hana`a helps him with his work because she believes that marriage, for better or worse, is a lifetime partnership.
She bought a tool for pressing the buttons and shapes on the clothes instead sewing it to save time and effort then she sells these clothes, and now she wants to expand and develop her business and buy more and new sewing machine and new tools to produce more product with high quality that's why she applied for a loan.
She needs your support to provide living for her children and to be able to help her husband more and more in the household expenses.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Sara Abigail

texts.es:
Sara, de 21 años de edad, es una joven inteligente, agradable y luchadora, ella vive con sus padres, quienes trabajan y atienden el hogar, ella terminó sus estudios de bachillerato, pero no continuo estudiando. 

Sara, es empleada en una tienda de artículos para el hogar, desempeña el cargo de vendedora, sus funciones son atender a los clientes y también reservar y tomar nota de pedidos. 

Sara, desea colocar su propio negocio, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para colocar una librería para vender artículos decorativos y útiles escolares, a ella siempre le ha gustado dedicarse a las ventas y de esa manera podrá ayudar a sus padres y trabajar en su propio negocio. 

Los planes de Sara, son poder continuar con sus estudios y graduarse de la universidad y salir adelante junto a su familia y tener éxito en la vida.
texts.en:
Sara, 21, is an intelligent youth who is friendly and tenacious.  She lives with her parents, who work and care for the home.  She finished her high school degree but did not continue with her education.

Sara is an employee in a store that sells household items.  She is in charge of selling products to customers and also reserving and writing down their orders.  

Sara wants to launch her own business, and so this is why she is requesting a loan to establish a bookstore where she can sell decorative items and school supplies.  She has always enjoyed sales, and this way she can help her parents and work in her own business.

Sara plans to continue with her studies and get a university degree so that she can get ahead with her family and have success in life.

loans.use: to start up a bookstore

loans.name: Intissar

texts.en: Intissar is a 48-year-old married woman living with her husband and two children. She has been selling clothing to help support her family. Intissar is talented and has been working in this business since 2005. She is well-known in her region and has a good reputation. To buy a new collection of clothes, Intissar is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l., which would help improve her business and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 30-year-old, single man from Jabalia City, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support.

Muhammad is a lawyer. It is a good job and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad. Because of the latest conflict, he lost his own office.

Muhammad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy new furniture, a printer and other things for his law firm. He hopes that these new assets will enable him to increase his clientele and that he will eventually be able save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy new furniture, a printer and other things for his law firm

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 66 years old and married with six children.

Ruben is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Ruben requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise his livestock.

Ruben has been raising livestock for 13 years now, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Ruben would like to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Villa

texts.en:
Villa is a 54-year-old married mother of six children, two in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Villa has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. Villa requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables like tomatoes, cabbage, garlic, onions, carrots, and spices to sell to her local market.

Villa has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables like tomatoes, cabbage, garlic, onions, carrots, and spices to sell to her local market.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 60 years old and married with seven children. For the past five years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling electronic phone mobile loads. Delia works hard to provide for her family.

Delia is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has borrowed and repaid seven previous loans from NWTF. Delia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Muhammad Niaz

texts.en: Muhammad Niaz is a 43-year-old married man. He lives in the rural area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan with his spouse and three children. He has been running a medical testing laboratory for many years. He learned all the techniques to operate laboratory instruments through a registered institution. His laboratory situated nearby a popular hospital. Due to his latest and new laboratory instruments, the results of almost all types of medical tests are accurate. That is the reason doctors of the nearest hospitals refer their patients to his laboratory for testing purpose. Muhammad Niaz deals with patience and humbly to his all clients. He speaks with politeness and that is why his number of clients increases day by day. This laboratory is the only source of income for his family; he has to devote his full time and energy for his laboratory alone. >Now he wants to purchase some new technology based laboratory instruments but the major issue is lump sum amount. Therefore Muhammad Niaz decided to take a Kiva loan so that he would be able to purchase the needful instruments. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance his own medical testing laboratory.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is the age of 40; she is the mother of three daughters and three sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly and he is unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Yasmeen has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Yasmeen is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the repair costs of her husband's rickshaw
