loans.name: Estephanee Odalis

texts.es:
Odalis, de 27 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene un bebe, ella tiene su propio negocio y su compañero de vida se dedica a trabajar como empleado y le ayuda con los cuidados del bebe y también le ayuda a atender el negocio.- Ella es una persona luchadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.  

Odalis, se dedica a la venta de comida rápida como tortas, hamburguesas, sándwiches y bebidas frías, ella tiene un puesto cerca de su casa, donde las prepara y las vende a sus clientes.- Tiene varios meses de estar en su negocio y asegura que hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien con sus ventas. 

Odalis, necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima para preparar sus productos y para comprar una cámara fría para poder vender bebidas. 

Odalis, planea en su futuro poder salir adelante con su hijo y tambien desea poder vivir en mejores condiciones, pero también sueña con casarse y tener una familia más unida.
texts.en:
Odalis is 27 years old. She has a partner and a baby. She also runs her own business. Her partner also works and helps her with the baby. He also helps her in her business. She is a hard working person who wants to get ahead.

Odalis makes fast food like sandwiches, hamburgers and cold drinks. She has a stand close to her house where she prepares and sells her food. She has several months of experience running her business and she says that her sales have been very good so far.

Odalis needs this loan to purchase supplies and a refrigerator so she can sell cold drinks.

Odalis plans to make a better life for her son and to be able improve their living conditions. She also wants to get married and have a more united family.

loans.use: purchase supplies and a refrigerator

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah is 47 years old. She is married and has five children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 13,000 KES (Kenya shillings).

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Imane

texts.en: Imane is a 49-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and three children who are still in school. She is a housewife taking care of her children. Her husband is the main income provider for the family and works hard for them to live in good conditions. Imane is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school. Imane and her husband want to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees and to register them at school.

loans.name: Kenga

texts.en:
Kenga is a 40-year-old livestock trader in Kilfi, Kenya. He is a married father of two and has been in this business for the last 10 years, doing well.

This is his fourth time borrowing after repaying his loan well. He will use the loan to purchase cows, goats and sheep for resale.

Kenga will use the anticipated profit to expand this business. He hopes to supply the animals to slaughter houses in large quantity in future.

loans.use: to purchase cows, goats and sheep for resale

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 34 years old, married and has four children.

His business is a motorcycle taxi service. He has been in this business for four years.

He earns a monthly income of 16,000 KES. This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the loan to buy another motorcycle.

He will use the profits from his expanded business to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
This is Merlyn, a sari-sari (variety) store owner in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. She's been running her store business for 35 years now. Managing a business for that long, she already experienced different circumstances that really tested her faith. There were times when her capital was almost drained due to huge collection debts. Some of her neighbors pay weeks or months later for the goods they get from her store. But Merlyn remains strong, because it’s her way of assisting her husband, Roberto, in providing for their children’s needs and education.

To augment her income, she ventured into mineral water distribution and raising of hogs. This time, she needs additional capital worth PHP 20,000 to sustain the feeds for her hogs, and obtain more supplies for her store. She’s hoping that you can lend her this amount, and praying that God will return more blessings to you.

She dreams for a better, healthy and long life for her whole family. She wants her children to finish college and have a stable job someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more supplies for her store

loans.name: Bennyfer

texts.en: Bennyfer  owned and operated her grocery store to earn a living. He has to support the needs of his family's daily expenditures. He also has to send his children to school. Recently, he took a new loan to buy more goods to sell such as coffee, sugar, canned goods and drinks. Bennyfer's  plans for his future is to save money for his children educational needs.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Analina

texts.en:
Analina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business farming rice in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries and buy farm supplies for her business farming rice.

Analina has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Analina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the 10 loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to pay for laborers' salaries and buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter, es una persona que trabaja con su taxi en horarios nocturnos, desde muy joven aprendió a desempañar está actividad con ayuda de sus familiares, de esta forma obtiene los ingresos para cubrir sus obligaciones; vive con su esposa y su madre, su pareja es totalmente dependiente de él, mientras que su madre tiene su propio negocio ubicado en el mercado municipal.
Necesita mejorar su negocio por lo que pide ayuda con un financiamiento para pagar el cambio de pintura de su vehículo, dará mejor presentación a su unidad de transporte para atraer nuevos clientes, pretende tener un negocio más rentable y respaldar el pago de su deuda.
Aspira a tener las posibilidades económicas para comprar otro taxi y contratar una persona para que lo conduzca, y de esta manera tener una flota de taxis.
texts.en: Walter works as a taxi driver at night. He learned the trade at an early age with the help of relatives and now makes a living from it. Walter lives with his wife and mother; his partner is completely dependent on him, while his mother has her own business at the municipal market. Walter needs to improve his business and is therefore requesting for a loan to pay for repainting his car, which would improve the presentation of his service and attract more customers. He intends is to increase his profits and pay his debt. Walter would like to one day have enough money to purchase another taxi and hire someone to drive it, in order to own a taxi fleet.

loans.use: to pay for repainting his car.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is in her early 40s and is married with three children. One of them is in school and the other two are grown up. She has been running a beauty salon for five years now. She works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hadija's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her inventory of salon products and has been able to pay back all her loans successfully.

She used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan, continue building her house, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products that meet her customers' requirements and to start selling clothes. She dreams of being a designer.

Hadija will be accountable for paying back her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products that meet her customers' requirements and to start selling clothes.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: José es un hombre trabajador de 44 años de edad que se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de prendas de vestir de forma ambulante, actividad que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar y llevar lo necesario a su familia. José hace 25 años ogro construir su vivienda en la que vive junto a su esposa, muy feliz, ya que él se siente feliz de vivir en la zona rural de su municipio. Como se observa en la fotografía el lavadero y pila de la vivienda de José se encuentran expuestos a la lluvia y el sol, porque carecen de un techo, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para instalar techo en el área de lavadero y pila y de esta manera protegerlos de las inclemencias del tiempo.
texts.en:
José, age 44, is a hardworking man who has been selling clothes as a street vendor for 15 years. This business allows him to sustain his household finances and provide for his family’s needs. Twenty five years ago, José was able to build the house where he and his wife live. They are very happy and he is pleased to reside in the rural section of the municipality.

As shown in the photo, the washroom and basin of his home is exposed to the rain and the sun. Since this area lacks a roof, José is requesting a loan from FUSAI so that he can invested in galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails, and wire so that he can install a roof over the washroom and basin so that this area is protected during inclement weather.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails, and wire in order to build a roof over the washroom and basin area.

loans.name: Oriana Cristina

texts.es: Oriana es una joven de 23 años licenciada en pedagogía infantil, reside en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla y encontró una alternativa para generar ingresos a través de la comercialización de productos para la nutrición y la salud; aprovechó sus dotes de maestra para promover productos de alimentación complementaria; malteadas, multivitamínicos, té, proteínas vegetales, bebidas energizantes, productos de aseo personal y del hogar. Ella comercializa a sus compañeros de trabajo esta amplia gama de productos a través de la oferta del catálogo y una vez cuenta con la meta de ventas establecida realiza su pedido.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en productos de belleza como tratamientos faciales, capilares, maquillajes, vitaminas y proteínas.  Con esta inversión sus ganancias se incrementaran y contara con el capital adecuado para ampliar su red de mercado, así mismo se acercará a su meta de realizar una maestría.
texts.en: Oriana is a 23 year-old young woman with a degree in child education. She lives in a neighborhood located in the municipality of Barranquilla and has found a way to generate some income by selling nutritional and health products. She has taken advantage of her teaching skills to sell food supplements, shakes, multivitamins, teas, vegetable proteins, energy drinks, personal hygiene products and household products. She sells this broad range of products to her coworkers through catalogs and once she meets her target sales, she places her orders. Currently, she is requesting her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will invest in beauty products such as facial and hair treatments, makeup, vitamins, and proteins. This investment will improve her profits and give her the necessary capital to expand her marketing network, as well as reach her goal of completing a master's degree.

loans.use: to invest in beauty products such as facial and hair treatments, makeup, vitamins, and proteins.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 27-year-old married lady. She has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Asia makes enough to provide for her family.

To fully stock her store, she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR, which she will use to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil, and flour from the market. She will pay lower prices at the market and then maker the items available for her customers. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. Asia wishes to utilize part of her revenues to provide a good quality of life to her family members.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour to sell in her store.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
At the age of 32 years old, Mao is working very hard as a garment worker in a location that is far from her house in Phnum Sruoch District of Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. The daily profit for her house is USD $10 a day. So far, Mao has been a worker for about 10 years.

Currently, Mao would like to request her first loan through Kiva to buy a motorbike to ride to her work place. Mao thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to ride to her work place

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 25-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and five siblings.

She has spent three years working as a female hairdresser and beautician at her domicile where she greets her customers with a great smile. She started her career at a young age with the intention of increasing her revenues.

Currently, she wants to get a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l so as to purchase cosmetic tools and makeup. She feels like she is meant to work in such a business and states that she is very happy and looks forward to opening her own beauty salon the soonest.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic tools and makeup.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 52 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a repair shop business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her repair shop.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her repair shop.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 41 years old and married with three children. All three children are attending school. Mary Grace works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, sugar, shampoo and other groceries.

In the future Mary Grace would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Alfonso

texts.es:
Carlos, de 46 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, ellos estudian y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar.

Carlos, se dedica a la albañilería, ese ha sido su oficio desde que era un muchacho, pues siempre ha trabajado para él y su familia, sus hijos también le ayudan en su tiempo libre.- Carlos, sabe mucho a cerca de la elaboración de tejas artesanales para los techos de las casas, pues tiene mucho tiempo dedicándose a eso y tiene su propio horno y sus herramientas. 

Carlos, necesita el préstamo para comprar heno, barro, leña y para pagar la mano de obra que le ayudará a elaborar las tejas.

Carlos, sueña con poder arreglar su casita para vivir cómodo con su familia, pero también quiere que sus hijos estudien y sean personas exitosas en el futuro.
texts.en:
Carlos is 46 years old. He lives with his wife and their three children. The children are in school and his wife takes care of the household chores.

Carlos earns his living in masonry. This has been his trade since he was a boy, as he has always worked for himself and his family. His children also help him in their free time. Carlos knows a lot with regard to the fabrication of handcrafted clay roof tiles for houses, as he has done that work for a long time. He has his own oven and tools.

Carlos needs the loan to buy straw, clay, and firewood and to pay for manual labor to help him make the clay tiles.

Carlos dreams of being able to repair his little house in order to live more comfortably with his family, but he also wants his children to study and be successful people in the future.

loans.use: to buy straw, clay, and firewood and to pay for manual labor to help him make clay tiles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a 52-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and one child attending school. She cooperates with her husband in order to fulfill their needs. She works from home in producing home-cooked food. As for her husband, he is an employee in a local company.

Today, given that her child will enter school very soon, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay the school fees. The parents’ only wish is to provide him with a respectable educational path until graduation.

loans.use: to pay her child's school fees

loans.name: Hala

texts.en:
Hala is a 45-year-old married woman with three children. Her husband represents the main income source for the family in order to fulfill their family needs and always be ready to meet their demands.

Today, in order to pay her children's study fees, she is applying for a new loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She said that she is very happy and satisfied as she is able to help her children and ensure them a suitable educational path.

loans.use: to pay her children's study fees

loans.name: Vilma Adela

texts.es:
Vilma, de 58 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta tercer grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y sus hijos ya no viven con ella.

Vilma, desde que se casó con su esposo ha trabajado y ha sido una mujer muy luchadora, siempre apoyando a su esposo en los trabajos agrícolas, pero desde hace 6 años cría aves de corral.

El dinero del préstamo lo necesita para comprar pollos de engorde y concentrado para alimentar a estas aves.

El sueño de Vilma, es mejorar su granja y tener muchos más animales y poder tener un mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
Vilma is 58 years old, studied until the third grade and is married. Her husband works in agriculture and her children no longer live with her.

Vilma, ever since she married her husband, has worked and has been a hardworking woman. She always supported her husband in the agricultural jobs. For the last six years she has been raising poultry.


She needs the money from the loan to purchase the chickens as well as to purchase the food for them.


Vilma's dream is to improve her farm and to have many more animals, thereby earning a better income.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to fatten up as well as their food.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, su esposo trabaja como seguridad en una empresa privada y sus dos hijos estudian en la universidad.

Ana, desde hace más de 16 años tiene su propio negocio, el cual consiste en un pequeño comedor  de comida a la vista, el cual ha sostenido grandemente a su familia y también a sus hijos a superarse académicamente. 

Ana, necesita el préstamo para comprar equipo de cocina y para comprar una plancha industrial y hacer pupusas y tortillas.

El sueña con mejorar su negocio y que sus ingresos mejoren para seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ana is 51 years old and studied through the third grade. Her husband works security for a private company and her two children study in the university.

For the last 16 years, Ana has had her own business, which consists in a small dining room serving food. This has supported her family quite well and aided in her childrens' ability to improve academically.

Ana needs the loan to purchase kitchen equipment and to purchase an industrial griddle to make pupusas and tortillas.

She dreams of improving her business so that her income increases and she can continue to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to purchase cooking equipment and an industrial griddle to make pupusas and tortillas.

loans.name: Morena Guadalupe

texts.es:
Morena, de 22 años de edad, no posee ningún nivel académico, actualmente está acompañada  y tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, su pareja trabaja en un agro-servicio en el área de ventas. 

Morena, desde que se acompaño tenía el deseo de superarse y tratar de ser independiente y no depender de los ingresos de su pareja y con el apoyo de él logro colocar una pequeña tienda, la cual le ha dado buenos resultados en la parte económica.

El dinero de este préstamo será para comprar productos de la canasta básica como aceite, granos básicos, condimentos, productos de higiene, etc.

El sueño de Morena es, mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo más.
texts.en:
Morena is 22 years old. She has no academic background. She has a spouse and a two year old son. Her husband works in sales for an agricultural service.


Ever since Morena married, she had the desire to improve herself. She wanted to be independent and not depend on the income of her husband. With his support she managed to open a small store, which has had good economic results.


The money from this loan will be used to purchase common grocery items such as oil, basic grains, condiments, hygienic products, etc. Morena's dream is to improve her business and grow it even more.

El sueño de Morena es, mejorar su negocio y ampliarlo más.

loans.use: to purchase basic grocery items such as oil, basic grains, condiments, hygienic products, etc.

loans.name: Edwin Rene

texts.es:
Edwin, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, no pudo continuar sus estudios porque no podía cubrir los gastos de la universidad, está casado, su esposa es licenciada en laboratorio clínico y tiene su propio local de atención al cliente. 

Edwin, tiene un cafetín de comida mexicana este negocio tiene 5 años de funcionar, por lo que ya es muy conocido por sus clientes, la necesidad de tener un ingreso para el hogar lo llevó a tomar la iniciativa de emprender con una nueva línea de comida, porque a sus alrededores solo venden pupusas.- Edwin, no recorre ninguna distancia porque el negocio lo tiene en su casa y paga a una empleada quien le ayuda con el negocio y el horario de atención es de las 6:00 p.m. a 10:00 p.m.

Edwin, necesita el préstamo para comprar una plancha de gas para hacer pupusas, porque los clientes se lo exigen que tenga un servicio más completo, el préstamo le ayudará para poder ampliar más su negocio.

Edwin, sueña con ver a sus hijos graduarse de una carrera universitaria y que sean profesionales.
texts.en: Edwin is 40 years old. He studied until high school but was unable to continue studying because he could not pay for university. He is married. His wife has an undergraduate degree in clinical laboratory and has her own office. Edwin has a snack stand where he sells Mexican food. He has had the business for five years and is hence very well known to her customers. The need to generate a household income drove him to begin a new food line because only pupusas (a traditional Salvadorean dish of stuffed tortillas) are sold in the vicinity of his business. Edwin runs his business from his home and has an assistant. His business hours are from 6:00 pm to 10:00 pm. He is requesting a loan to purchase a gas griddle to make pupusas because his customers have requested a more complete service. The loan will help him expand his business. Edwin dreams of seeing his children graduate from university and become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase a gas griddle to cook pupusas.

loans.name: Meeran

texts.en:
Meeran is a 41-year-old married woman. She is the mother of eight children. Some years ago, she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She aspires to save money for providing a prosperous future to her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Agée de 50 ans, Cécile est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Cécile vit à Tokoin et vend du haricot préparé par elle-même à domicile afin de réaliser un revenu grâce à cette activité. Cécile s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs du haricot, le bidon d’huile et de la farine du manioc, Cécile demande ce prêt pour atteindre ses objectifs et gagner une bonne marge bénéficiaire afin d’aider son mari  à bien prendre soin de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Cécile, age 50, is married and the mother of two children. She lives in Tokoin and sells beans that she prepares at home to earn income through this business.

Cécile goes to the market twice per month for supplies. To order the bags of beans, the container of oil and the cassava flour, Cécile is requesting this loan to achieve her goals and reach a good profit margin to help her husband take care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of beans, one container of oil and one bag of cassava flour.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 22-year-old Lebanese married woman. She’s living with her husband and one school-aged child. She cooperates with her husband and has started to work very early, hoping she could bring added income to the family.

Fatmeh has been working as a hairdresser and beautician since 2012, and she has customers from all over the neighboring area. Today, she has the intention to take a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l, to buy additional beauty products. This will be her first loan, and it will help her boost her earnings and, therefore, improve her family’s way of living.

One of her greatest dreams is to better develop her business and gain the biggest number of clients she can.

loans.use: to buy additional beauty products

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a married woman and wants to support her husband financially. She been running a shoe-making business for many years and has a good client list.

Shahida needs to increase sales to fulfill the basic needs of the family. Currently, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as leather, plastic leather, polishes, etc. in order to increase production. In this way she would be able to increase her sales and earn more income.

She intends to utilize part of the profits for her family's betterment and well-being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as leather, plastic leather, polishes, etc. in order to increase production

loans.name: Occilien Islande

texts.fr: Islande, 48 ans, est mère de cinq enfants. Elle es divorcée. Elle vit dans la ville de Bon Repos avec ses enfants.  Femme dynamique et très laborieuse, elle travaille sans arrêt pour améliorer sa situation financière et offrir une meilleure condition de vie à ses enfants. Elle cherche du financement pour augmenter son stock de marchandises cosmétiques.
texts.en: Islande is 48 years old, divorced, and the mother of five children. She lives in the town of Ron Repos with her five children. She is a dynamic, hard-working woman and works non-stop to improve her financial situation and offer her children a better quality of life. She is seeking funding to increase her supply of cosmetic merchandise.

loans.use: to increase her supply of cosmetic merchandise.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura, who is in her late 30s, is married with four sons. One of them is at school, and the others are grown up.

She has been selling fruits and vegetables for ten years now. She works from 8 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Zuhura’s 12th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her genge (food shop) stock, which is now serving more people. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan, reinvest in her business, build her own house and cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to restock the fast-moving items in the genge business, like tomatoes, mangoes, onions, vegetables, etc.

She dreams of being an international business woman.

Zuhura will make sure she pays back her loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to replenish the fast-moving items in the genge business, like tomatoes, mangoes, onions, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Noha

texts.en:
Noha is a 32-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and two school-going children. Due to bad financial conditions, she cooperates with her husband to help her family to meet the needs of life.

Noha is a hard-working person. Since 2010 she has operated a clothing shop in her town, where she offers a great variety of kid’s clothes at good prices.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase a new collection of clothes so that she can improve her business operations to be able to increase her sales and, therefore, her income.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Vasana

texts.en:
As a farmer from Phnum Sruoch District, Kampong Speu Province, Vasana, 46 years old, is working very hard on the rice field near her house.

Vasana has three children. She can earn approximately 10 USD a day. Being a farmer is the main work that she has done for more than ten years.

In this farming season, she is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue her farming, Vasana is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and other related materials.

Vasana thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides

loans.name: Jenerusha

texts.en:
Jenerusha is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as being honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock.

Jenerusha will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of cereals. Her business goal is to have a big cereals store within five years.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of cereals.

loans.name: Francisco Fernando

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre luchador, de estado civil soltero, actualmente vive solo, tiene dos hijos que viven con su madre, él vive en el Recinto Pueblo Nuevo a quince minutos del Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos que está ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha.
Francisco viene de una familia de bajos recursos económicos motivo por el cual no ha podido culminar sus estudios a pesar de esto salió adelante trabajando como jornalero en construcción y en la actualidad sigue luchando día a día por salir adelante y darles a sus hijos lo necesario, es muy humilde y trabajador ya que eso lo heredó de sus Padres.
El negocio que tiene es la crianza de cerdos lo aprendió por iniciativa propia buscando generar otro ingreso para darles lo mejor a sus hijos, le ha ido muy bien ya que tiene varias cerdas madres preñadas y desea compra otras para aumentar su producción, le dedica un promedio de 4 horas diarias, tiene construidos los corrales. 
Francisco tiene muchos sueños por cumplir como lo es tener su gran negocio y dedicarse solo a eso y dejar de trabajar para otras personas. 
Este préstamo ayudara a Francisco a mejorar su calidad de vida, agradece a KIVA por el apoyo que están brindando a personas como él que por falta de oportunidades no han podido llevar a cabo sus sueños.
texts.en:
Francisco is a determined man. He is single and presently lives alone. He has two children that live with their mother. He lives in Recinto Pueblo Nuevo, fifteen minutes from Canton San Miguel de los Bancos which is located in the northeastern part of the Pichincha province.

Francisco comes from a low income family, which is why he has not been able to finish his studies. Despite this he succeeded working as a day laborer in construction. Presently he continues struggling day by day to make it and give his children what they need. He is very humble and hard working, characteristics he inherited from his parents.

The business that he has is raising pigs. He learned it on his own while looking to generate other income to give the best to his children. It has gone very well for him. He has several pregnant mothers and he would like to purchase more to increase his production. He spends an average of four hours a day on this. He has the extra corrals built. Francisco has many dreams to fulfill. He would like to increase this business and only work in this, instead of working for other people.

This loan will help Francisco to improve his quality of life. He thanks KIVA for the support that they are offering to people like him, who, due to lack of opportunities have not been able to fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more mother pigs as he has corral space.  That way he can increase his production and better his quality of life.

loans.name: Nelsa Miriam

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirian es una mujer luchadora que día a día se esfuerza para salir adelante, ella tiene 41 años, tiene dos hijos pero son mayores de edad e independientes, vive en un pequeño recinto llamado Amanecer Campesino el mismo que pertenece al Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos. 
Ella se dedica al negocio de la producción de pollos este negocio la aprendió por iniciativa propia, le dedica un promedio de 5 horas diarias. En el negocio de los pollos es necesario dedicarles mucho cuidado por las diferentes enfermedades que existen y que tienen que combatir para criarlos. Ha trabajado con más de dos créditos en los cuales ha tenido la oportunidad de crecer y es ahora que desea invertir en la construcción de más corrales para incrementar su producción.
La señora Mirian agradece a KIVA por las oportunidades brindadas y por el apoyo que este nuervo crédito representa para ella ya que podrá mejorar sus ingresos económicos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mirian is a determined woman who works hard day after day to get ahead. She is 41 years old and has two children who are already grown and independent. She lives in a small town called Amanecer Campesino [Country Dawn] which belongs to the canton of San Miguel de los Bancos.

Her business is chicken production. She learned this business on her own initiative, and she dedicates an average of five hours a day to it. In the chicken business, it is necessary to be extremely careful because of the various diseases that exist, which must be combated in order to raise the chickens. She has worked with more than two loans in the past which gave her the opportunity to grow, and now she would like to invest in constructing of more enclosures to increase her production.

Mirian is grateful to Kiva for the opportunities provided to her and for the support represented by this new loan, since she will be able to improve her income and her quality of life.

loans.use: to strengthen her chicken production business.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou est une femme mariée âgée de 33 ans résidante à Tokoin. Mère de trois enfants, Akou produit les gâteaux.  Akou s’approvisionne deux fois par mois du nécessaire au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et dans les quartiers environnant. Akou désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de farine de blé, des bidons d’huile et du charbon de bois.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Akou compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider son mari à prendre en charge les besoins des enfants à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
Akou is a married 33-year-old woman living in Tokoin. She is the mother of three children and makes cakes.

Akou goes to the market twice per month for supplies. She sells outside of her home and in the surrounding neighborhoods. Akou is requesting this loan to order bags of wheat flour, containers of oil and charcoal.

With her resulting profit margin, Akou plans to improve her sales offerings and help her husband take care of their children’s needs so they can flourish and have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase three bags of wheat flour, three containers of oil and one small bag of charcoal.

loans.name: Maira

texts.en:
Maira is 20 years old and married. She lives in Multan, Pakistan. She is a tailor, engaging in the cloth sewing center to earn an income. She started her cloth sewing center three years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses. She creates all types of articles of clothing.

Maira is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan for 25,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a sewing machine. With the sewing machine, she will be able to fulfill the requests of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Suon, 49, lives with family members in a rural village in Srey Snom district in Siem Reap province. She is a mother of five children, three of whom are in school and one is studying in university. She struggles to overcome her family’s hardship via rice cropping and raising cows to get extra income. Her rice farm was destroyed by a flood and this is her main challenge. She has been involved in her business for 31 years and she can save about 3.5 USD per day. This is her second loan with VisionFund and she fully repaid her past loan well. With the past loan, her living condition is getting better than before by having enough consumption and being able to send her children to school. She will spend this new loan portion to pay tuition fees for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in Tourism and Hospitality. She wishes that her son can get a good job after he has graduated.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in Tourism and Hospitality.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Najah

texts.en: Najah is a 31-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and two children. She states that she works resolutely to provide her family with the bare minimum needs of life. For the past four years, she has worked at her domicile working on cutting bread and selling it to neighboring restaurants. And now, she is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy a bread cutting machine. In the future, she plans to apply for additional Kiva loans to develop her business.

loans.use: to buy a bread cutting machine.

loans.name: Manuel Gabino

texts.es:
Manuel, de 76 años de edad, es muy responsable y trabajador, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, hortalizas y granos agroindustriales; en su casa vive solo, aunque esta pensando en buscar una compañera de vida para no estar solo, ya que sus hijos viven aparte y él quisiera tener a alguien a su lado para compartir la vejez.
  
Manuel, se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cosechando granos básicos, agroindustriales y hortalizas, este año ha cultivado 7,000 metros cuadrados de frijol, 14,000 de maíz y una tarea de arroz, los beneficios que tiene es que su cultivo lo tiene cerca, esto hace que se le facilite el manejo de todos ellos.
 
El préstamo que está solicitando es para pagar una parte de mano de obra, para el manejo de pos-cosecha de sus cultivos, porque se acerca la época de extraer los cultivos y hay que invertir en la cosecha y en guardar los granos, para poder vender una parte y sacar un poco de ganancia de todo su trabajo. 

Manuel, dice que el espera vivir más años, para poder seguir disfrutando de la vida y cumplir sus expectativas de trabajo y también ver a su familia ser feliz junto a el.
texts.en: Manuel is 76 years old, very responsible, and hard working. He makes a living growing basic grains, vegetables, and agroindustrial grains. He lives alone in his house, although he is thinking of looking for a life partner so that he doesn't have to continue living alone; his children moved away and he would like to have someone by his side with whom to share his golden years. Manuel has worked in agriculture, growing basic grains, agroindustrial grains, and vegetables. This year he has planted 7,000 square meters of beans, 14,000 of corn, and 69 (a "tarea") of corn. He has the advantage of having his crops nearby, which eases their management. He is requesting a loan to pay for some of the labor needed to handle the crops after the harvest, as the harvest is approaching, and investments must be made in the crops and grain storage in order to sell some of the grain and derive some profit from all his work. Manuel says he hopes to live many more years, to continue enjoying life, meet his work expectations, and see his family be happy next to him.

loans.use: to pay for some of the labor needed to handle the crops after the harvest.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en: Musa is 51 years old and married with three children. He runs a business of buying and selling livestock. He has been in this business for the last 10 years. His monthly income is Kes 15,000. He is borrowing a loan of Kes 20,000 to buy three cows, two for sale  and one for  milk production for family satisfaction. He would use  the anticipated profit to pay school fees for his children. This is his first loan from Visionfund. His hopes and dreams for the future  are to open a cereal store and do livestock farming.

loans.use: to buy  three  cows: two for sale and  one  for milk production  for  his  family.

loans.name: Afi Elise

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée âgée de 51 ans qui vit à Tokoin. Mère de deux enfants, Afi prépare et vend du riz mélangé du haricot et s’approvisionne du nécessaire pour la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour commander des sacs de riz, du haricot et des tas de condiments, Afi demande ce prêt pour en faire usage.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Afi compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et promouvoir l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi is a 51-year-old married woman living in Tokoin. She is the mother of two children and prepares and sells rice and beans.

She purchases supplies twice per month at the market and sells in front of her house. To order the bags of rice, beans and the bundles of condiments, Afi is requesting this loan to use it for these purchases. With the resulting profit margin, Afi plans to improve her sales offerings and improve her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of rice, half a bag of beans and two bundles of condiments.

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Maria, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años, y reside en el municipio de Villanueva, Cortés. Maria, actualmente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (pulpería) y a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Anteriormente se dedicaba a lavar ropa a sus vecinas y a la cría de gallinas y cerdos. La pulpería lleva 4 años de tenerla y vende granos básicos, manteca, huevos, azúcar, refrescos, churros, pan, productos de limpieza etc. Ella está solicitando un segundo préstamo en ODEF por la cantidad de 20,000 lempiras para la compra de abarrotes, como azúcar, manteca, harina de maíz, harina de trigo, pan, refrescos, churros, productos de aseo, embutidos etc. para surtir su pulpería y aumentar las ventas. Su deseo es desarrollarse como comerciante y seguir ayudando a sus hijos con una mejor educación y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is a 28-year-old single mother. She has two children, 7 and 3 years old, and she lives in the town of Villanueva, Cortés.

Maria currently makes a living selling groceries and making and selling tortillas. Before, she worked washing clothes for her neighbors and breeding hens and pigs. She has had the grocery store for 4 years and she sells basic grains, butter, eggs, sugar, sodas, churros, bread, cleaning products, etc.

She is asking for a second loan from ODEF in the amount of 20,000 lempiras in order to buy groceries, such as sugar, butter, corn flour, wheat flour, bread, sodas, churros, cleaning products, lunch meats, etc. in order to stop her store and increase her sales.

Her wish is to develop herself as a businessperson and continue helping her children to get a better education and improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, butter, corn flour, wheat flour, bread, sodas, churros, cleaning products, lunch meats, etc. to stock her store and increase her sales.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a 38-year-old cereals and retail shop dealer at Voi, Kenya. She is a married mother of two who has been in this business for the last four years and is doing well.

This is her first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the money to purchase dry maize, beans, green grams and rice for resale and the anticipated profit to repay her loan. She hopes to grow her business into wholesale cereals in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dry maize, beans, green grams and rice.

loans.name: Clemence

texts.en:
Clemence is a 42-year-old boutique proprietor at Voi, Kenya.

She is a mother of three whose spouse provides additional income and has been in this business for the last eight years doing great.

This is her third borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to purchase clothes for resale and the anticipated profit to expand her boutique.

She hopes to own a leading boutique store in Voi town in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 38-year-old retail shop proprietor in Voi, Kenya. She is a married mother of three who has been in this business for the last fifteen years and is doing well.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the loan to stock her shop with sugar, milk, tea leaves, maize and wheat flour, washing detergents. She will use the anticipated profit to repay her loan.

She hopes to grow her business into wholesale in future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, milk, tea leaves, maize and wheat flour, washing detergents.

loans.name: Musriah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Musriah, one of Ruma's agents. She lives in Depok, a suburban area located about a one hour drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her only daughter. She owns and manages a small stall where she sells small drinks and mobile airtime credits. She decided to join Ruma and become a Ruma agent because she wants to help her husband increase their income, as well as give more contribution to her community.

As the business grows, Musriah needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits for her community, so her community can connect with their loved ones no matter how far they are apart. Musriah's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to open an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Musriah is the one who is standing in her own small stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give her community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos un Cantón muy turístico, muchos turistas Nacionales y extranjeros visitan este Cantón por su maravillosas cascadas una de ella es la cascada del amor un lugar muy acogedor para disfrutarlo entre familia.
En este Cantón vive y tiene su negocio la señora Patricia una mujer muy trabajadora ella es madre soltera su hijito tiene 10 meses vive en la casa de un familiar tiene un negocio de costura arregla toda clase de prendas de vestir, trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias en su local pasa con su hijo tiene muchos sueños que quisiera realizar uno de ellos es ampliar su negocio le gustaría que sea uno de los más grandes del sector, este préstamo lo invertirá en el negocio en compra telas, hilos, cierres y demás materiales para la elaboración de las prendas y así mejorar la calidad de atención de los clientes ya que piensa que un cliente bien atendido es un cliente que regresa.
Doña Patricia agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad brindada para poder mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos is a very attractive canton where many tourists, both national and foreign, visit. This canton has marvelous waterfalls, one of which is called the Waterfall of Love, a very agreeable locale for families to enjoy.

In this canton Patricia resides and has her own business. Patricia is a very hard-working woman, a single mother with a little son, now ten months old. They live in the house of a family member. Her dressmaking business creates all classes of clothing items. She works in her shop on average eight hours a day, with her little son. Patricia has many dreams that she would like to realize, one of which is to expand her business. She wants it to become one of the biggest of its type.

The loan will be invested in her business, to purchase cloth, thread, zippers and other materials for creating items of clothing and thus attracting greater attention from her customers. Patricia believes that a customer well attended to is a customer that will return.

Patricia thanks Kiva for the help and for offering the opportunity to be able to improve her income.

loans.use: purchase cloth, thread and materials for making additional items of clothing, and thus better attracting customer attention.

loans.name: Alejandra Margarita

texts.es: Alejandra de 18 años es una joven que aprendió de su madre el oficio de la modistería y a pesar de su corta edad, hoy en día esta actividad es su fuente principal de ingresos. Ella reside en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla y en esta misma localidad está ubicada sus confecciones en la que diariamente recibe las visitas de sus clientes, quienes son atendidos a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m.  Sus prendas son diseñadas a la medida y con su toque de glamour y buen gusto, ofrece un servicio integro en el que según la anatomía del cliente le sugiere que prendas usar, por eso la prefieren. Alejandra ha tenido éxito en su negocio y pese a su escasa experiencia de dos años, cuenta con una amplia clientela y con la finalidad de ofrecer mejores acabados a sus prendas está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá una máquina fileteadora para no perder el toque de elegancia y prestigio de sus prendas.  Su meta a futuro es aportar para la remodelación de su vivienda y prosperar en su negocio.
texts.en:
Alejandra, age 18, is a young woman who learned dressmaking from her mother. Despite her young age, today this task is her main income. She lives in a neighborhood south of Barranquilla and in this same location is her shop where she sees clients. She is available from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm.

Her clothes are designed to the measurements of her clients and with her touch of glamour and good taste. She offers a complete service in which, according to the anatomy of the client, she suggests which garments to wear. For this reason she is a preferred seamstress.
Alejandra has had success in her business and despite her two short years of experience, she has a large clientele.

With the goal of offering a more polished final product, she is applying for a credikiva. This is the initial financing that the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo does. She will invest in a sewing machine in order to keep her elegant touches and the prestige of her garments. Her future goal is to contribute to the remodeling of her home and to prosper in her business.

loans.use: to invest in a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nancy Karina

texts.es:
El Recinto Mulaute está ubicado al noroccidente de la provincia de Pichincha en el Cantón San Miguel de los Bancos un lugar hermoso y tranquilo de clima cálido húmedo al que muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros les gusta pasar vacaciones o feriados disfrutando de sus maravillosas cascadas y hosterías. 
En este Recinto vive y trabaja la señora Karina una mujer luchadora de 20 años es madre soltera tiene un pequeño hijo de 11 meses, por el que día con día lucha y se esfuerza para salir adelante y darle todo lo necesario para su desarrollo y aprendizaje diario.
Doña Nancy tiene el negocio de crianza y engorde de pollos a esta actividad le dedica un promedio de 4 horas diarias tiene tres galpones y varios años de experiencia lo aprendió con su Padre quien también tiene este negocio; solicita el crédito para invertir en mejorar sus galpones para poder criar más aves ya que tiene mucha acogida en las tiendas y vecinos del sector.
La señora Karina  agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y la oportunidad que le están brindando para salir adelante y poder ofrecer a su hijo un buen futuro.
texts.en:
The Mulaute precinct is located to the Northwest of the province of Pichincha in the San Miguel de los Bancos quarter, a beautiful and tranquil place with a hot, rainy climate in which many domestic and international tourists like to take vacations or holidays enjoying the marvelous waterfalls and inns.

In this precinct lives and works Mrs. Karina, a determined 20-year-old woman who is a single mother and has a young 11-month-old son. She fights for him every day and strains to get ahead and give him everything necessary for his development and daily learning.

Mrs. Nancy has a business raising and fattening chickens to which she dedicates an average of 4 hours daily. She has three henhouses and several years of experience. She learned from her father who is also in this business.

She is asking for a loan to invest in improving her henhouses to be able to raise more birds since she has been well-received in the stores and neighborhoods of the area.

Mrs. Karina is thankful to Kiva for the support and the opportunity they are providing her to get ahead and to be able to offer her son a good future.

loans.use: to improve her henhouses to be able to breed more birds, since she has been very well-received in her area.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is 31 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. He is a driver and provides transportation services using his loading rickshaw, which he has been doing for 15 years.

Rabia’s husband wants to buy a new loading rickshaw for proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to do so. Rabia requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which her husband will use to purchase the loading rickshaw.

loans.use: to purchase a loading rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Enyovi

texts.fr: Agée de 31 ans, Enyovi est une femme mariée qui vit à Agoè avec trois enfants à charge. Enyovi est une revendeuse des fleurs et montres qu’elle expose dans un panier et circule dans les quartiers environnant. Enyovi s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois au marché. Enyovi désire ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de fleurs et des unités de montres afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et gagner une marge bénéficiaire pour pouvoir aider son mari à prendre en charge les frais scolaire de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Enyovi is a 31-year-old married woman living in Agoè with three children in her care. Enyovi re-sells flowers and clocks that she displays in a basket while circulating through the surrounding neighborhoods.

Enyovi purchases these goods twice per month at the market. She is requesting this loan to order the dozens of flowers and the clocks to meet her clients’ expectations and to earn a profit to help her husband pay their children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase three dozen flowers and 13 clocks.

loans.name: Fitri

texts.en:
Fitri is married and has one child.  She lives in North Bogor, Indonesia. She and her husband own and manage a stall where she sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to her community. She joined Ruma so she can help her husband improve their life and learn about how to manage another business opportunity, as well as make a contribution to her community. 

Fitri requested a loan, which she will use to provide more mobile payment services to her community, especially on weekends.

loans.use: to provide more mobile payment services to her community

loans.name: Toeur

texts.en:
Toeur, 34, who is a father of two children, lives in Memot District, Tboung Khmum Province, Cambodia. In the last ten years, he has been in the farming business by growing rice. He sells the products to local dealers and the customers in the market. This farming business allows him to make around USD 4 a day.

Toeur wants to provide himself with a convenient life by having latrine to use in his family. Now he is taking a loan from HKL to build hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members.

Toeur would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than general loan products.

loans.use: to build hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is aged 45 and is a mother of six children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income.

She started her embroidery business 10 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Zahida buys materials such as hand-embroidery kits, ribbons, needles and embroidery machines from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers.

She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in embroidery business. So Zahida demanded a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

Zahida will be thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for embroidery for herself.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en: Carlota is applying for a loan of 800 USD from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is married and has a kiosk. Her husband is very supportive of her running her business. She said, "If we want to open a business with our own money, then our efforts will not run properly, because we can't know to count the money coming in and money going out." So she has decided to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She will use the loan to buy additional inventory to keep in her kiosk, including glue, soaps, hand and body lotion, sugar, biscuits, noodles, coffee, scissors, lighters, soft drinks, and other things to sell.  She started her business in 2014 with working capital of 300 USD. She hopes to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to buy glue, soaps, hand and body lotion, sugar, biscuits, noodles, coffee, scissors, lighters, soft drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Ekrem

texts.en:
Ekrem is 46 years old and the father of 4 children. In order to earn a living he works as a taxi driver in the southern part of Kosovo, where he lives with his family. He has a lot of customers and is very well known in the area.

He has been in business for a long period of time and really enjoys his work even though he works early morning until late night. For the first time, he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a new vehicle because his current taxi is old and damaged.

Since he is the main source of income for his family, he has not been able to set aside any money to purchase a new taxi. He is hoping that in the near future, he will be able to have his own taxi company. He is very grateful to all of the lenders for helping continue his business.

loans.use: to purchase a new vehicle because his current taxi is old and damaged.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 35-year-old mother of five children, and she lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business 10 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Rukhsana buys materials such as hand-embroidery kits, ribbon, needles and an embroidery machine from the market. Another person handles her transactions with her customers. She has decided that she would like to sell her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn a better profit for her family. She has become an expert in the embroidery business. Rukhsana has requested a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market. She will be thankful to KIVA and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery material for herself.

loans.name: Kali Group

texts.en:
Kali Self Help Group started in the year 2015 in Kumbhepada village, Bolangir district, Odisha, India. There are 9 active self-dependent women, with an objective of developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood.

All the group members are from poor families. All the members of the concerned group have their own profession and business. Sukun is one of them who has taken on a great role for her development and their group members’ source of revenue improvement. She is the second person from the right hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is about 24 years old and living with her husband.

Sukun’s husband has been running a welding workshop in a nearby market for the last 6 years. He is a very good business man and running the business successfully. Through concerned business he earns a monthly income of about 6,500 INR which is just $100.

According to Sukun’s opinion, from this small income it is very difficult to maintain her family. After that to get sufficient surplus to reinvest in the business is practically impossible. So she formed a group for strengthening social relations and to avail herself of a loan for the expansion of her business.

She plans to support her husband by financing him for the expansion of the business. From the loan he will purchase iron materials and welding equipment. Sukun hopes it will definitely improve the business of her husband and she can save money for construction of her own house.

The other 8 members of the group are also smart at their professions and also actively engaged with different professional activities like a grocery shop, vegetable vending, furniture making, a hotel and tent house. With this loan they also hope to improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase iron materials and welding equipment.

loans.name: Radhakrushna Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015 ten self-reliant women of Tatopada, Titlagarh, Bolangir district, Odisha, India formed a group named Radhakrushna. All the group members are from poor families.

Their main objective is to expand their existing business and develop their social livelihood by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Bharati is the most active lady of the concerned village and has taken the lead to form a self help group. The lady is aged about 30 years and is the first person standing on the right hand side with a raised hand in the photo. She is a cheerful lady with high ambitions. Her family consists of her husband and one son.

For the last 8 years, Bharati has been engaged in a grocery business with the help and support of her husband. It shows that Bharati is very active and wants the overall improvement of her family. The monthly income of her family is about INR 6,000.

But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So she decided to expand her business through Loan. She will purchase all grocery items like rice, wheat, oil, sugar, tea, soap, washing powder, deodorant, biscuit, snacks etc. Bharati hopes that this will definitely generate a handsome of extra income. She has a dream to save enough for the better education of her son and construction of a Pucca house.

The other nine members of the group are also engaged themselves with different small businesses like a grocery shop, vegetable vending, dairy, carpentry and a cloth store.

loans.use: to purchase all grocery items like rice, wheat, oil, sugar, tea, soap, washing powder, deodorant, biscuits and snacks.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina a 36-year-old mother of four children, and she lives with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. He is a driver by profession and he provides transportation services using his auto rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for 6 years to meet the family’s expenses.
Now Rubina’s husband wants to buy new auto rickshaw to provide proper transportation services but due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to buy it. Therefore Rubina has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Rubina’s husband can purchase the auto rickshaw and provide the proper transportation services to earn an income. Rubina and her family will be thankful to the KIVA, lenders and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 18-year-old single young man from Rafah city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family's needs.

Mohammad is a student in the university where he studies mathematics. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family with a part of their expenses.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Dirleydis Elena

texts.es: Dirleydis de 20 años es una empresaria independiente residenciada en el municipio de Barranquilla que inició su negocio de comidas por iniciativa de una amigo, quien le sugió que desde su vivienda elaborara almuerzos corrientes.  En la actualidad ella deleita a sus comensales con deliciosos almuerzos caseros y es su principal medio de sostenimiento en su condición de mujer separada de su cónyuge y madre de 1 hijo de apenas dos años de edad. Sus principales clientes son amigos, vecinos, referidos y trabajadores de empresas a quienes les ofrece sus comidas por encargos, los cuales cancelan de inmediato o con facilidad de pago.  Dirleydis está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá  en la comprar de víveres; arroz, aceite, legumbres, carnes y demás, para así poder continuar con esta actividad sin contratiempos.  Con esta inversión podrá ejercer su labor y seguir ofreciendo bienestar a su familia. Su meta a futuro es expandirse y tener su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
20-year-old Dirleydis is an independent business owner living in the town of Barranquilla who started her food business at the suggestion of a friend, who suggested that she make common lunches from her house. Today she delights her diners with delicious homemade lunches and it is her main mode of support as a woman separated from her spouse and mother of 1 barely 2-year-old child.

Her main clients are friends, neighbors, referrals, and business workers to whom she offers meals to order, those who pay immediately or with ease of payment.

Dirleydis is applying for her first Kiva loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will invest in the purchase of groceries: rice, oil, vegetables, meat, and more, so she can continue this activity without setbacks. With this investment she will be able to do her work and continue offering wellbeing to her family.

Her goal for the future is to expand and to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies: rice, oil, vegetables, meat, and more.

loans.name: Yolanda Isabel

texts.es: Yolanda de 30 años es una microempresaria que a través de las redes sociales en internet encontró una oportunidad de negocio al comercializar calzado; un negocio que ha trascendido en su familia y al que desde muy joven estuvo vinculada, sin embargo potencializó al encontrar una cadena masiva que permitió incrementar su base de clientes. Todos los días recibe solicitudes de cotizaciones a las cuales responde y de inmediato agenda a su cliente para mostrarle en persona el calzado de su preferencia.  Ella oferta calzado masculino y femenino que compra en almacenes y talleres especializados, los cuales les brindan respaldo y calidad en sus productos y así mantener las garantías postventa.  Yolanda está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual piensa invertir en más surtido de calzado previendo que se aproximan festividades que incrementan su demanda. Su meta a futuro es posicionar su propia marca y comprar su propio apartamento.
texts.en:
Yolanda, age 30, is a microentrepreneur who found an opportunity through social networks on the Internet to sell shoes. This is a business which has been passed on in her family, and she has been involved in it since she was very young; however, she received a great boost after she found a mass network which allowed her to increase her customer base.

Every day, she receives requests for price quotes, and she responds to them immediately and makes an appointment to show the customer the shoes of his or her preference in person. She offers men's and women's shoes, which she buys from specialized stores and workshops. These provide her with good support and quality, so that she can maintain post-sales guarantees.

Yolanda is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she plans to invest in a greater variety of shoes, since holidays are approaching which increase the demand for her products. Her goals for the future are to launch her own brand and to buy her own apartment.

loans.use: to invest in a wider variety of shoes to sell.

loans.name: Maa Durga Group

texts.en:
This group is located in a village named Jayaramguda, Rayagada district of Odisha, India. Bishnuprabha is one of the members of this group. She is standing in the middle of the photo with a raised hand. She is a very active young lady of 38 years of age. She lives with her husband and three daughters. All the children are studying at different schools and colleges.

Bishnuprabha, along with her husband, has been doing vegetable cultivation and its business for the last 10 years. Bishnuprabha earns about 8,500 INR per month from this business which is insufficient to meet the day-to-day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses.

She wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. She will utilize the present loan to buy fruits and vegetables like apples, banana, coconut, tomato, cauliflower, capsicum, carrots, onions etc. She expects a good return from her business by expanding.

Bishnuprabha dreams of being a wholesaler of fruits and vegetables in the market. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work.

The other four members of this group are also involved in similar business and doing vegetable cultivation and its business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables like apples, bananas, coconut, tomato, cauliflower, capsicum, carrots and onions.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies such as vegetables, condiments, meat, ham, cheese and other items for making meals.

loans.name: Triunfo Group

texts.es:
En una peculiar comunidad del Estado de México se ubica un grupo llamado Triunfo el nombre proviene del deseo que tienen sus integrantes por superarse. Todos desean superarse para poder mejorar su calidad de vida. 
     Don Mario es un hombre muy trabajador quien siempre se muestra muy alegre tanto con las personas que conoce como con las que no.  Vive casado con la señora Emma desde hace 28 años y juntos formaron una familia con cuatro hijos quienes son totalmente independientes. Toda su vida se ha dedicado al comercio, en un inicio con la venta de plásticos y posteriormente con calzado dado que las ganancias resultaron mejores. La inversión inicial la pudo realizar gracias a los ahorros que juntó mientras trabajaba en la unión americana.
   Junto con su esposa vende la mercancía en plazas, tianguis, mercados, entre otros sitios dentro de su comunidad. Por ahora uno de sus deseos es lograr construir un local muy grande para que sus clientes puedan observar detalladamente su producto. Sin embargo ningún sueño se realiza sin esfuerzo y por ello desde hace 15 años inicio con la construcción de ocho locales; el hecho de comprar del terreno, conseguir los permisos y adquirir el material le ha costado mucho pero sabe que la recompensa valdrá la pena.
   Actualmente sus proyectos van viento en popa; "esto es gracias a los préstamos otorgados de VF México porque cada vez que recibimos el crédito nosotros podemos invertir en nuestro negocio y así con las ganancias podemos levantar nuestros locales" comentó muy entusiasmado. Con este nuevo apoyo comprará más calzado y material suficiente para terminar las construcciones que inició.
   *La fotografía fue tomada junto con su mercancía.
texts.en:
In a peculiar community in the State of Mexico, there is a group named Triunfo (Triumph). The name comes from the wish the members have to improve themselves. They all want to better themselves to be able to improve their quality of life.

Don Mario is a very hardworking man who always seems very happy, just as much with the people who know him as with the people who don't. He is married and has lived with Señora Emma for 28 years and together they made a family with four children who are totally independent. All his life he has dedicated to business, in the beginning with the sale of plastics and later with footwear given that the earnings were better. He was able to make the initial investment thanks to the savings he put together while working in the American union.

Together with his wife he sells merchandise in plazas, street markets, markets, among other sites in his community. For now one of his wishes is to be able to construct a very big store so that his clients would be able to observe his product in detail. Nevertheless no dream is realized without effort and because of this 15 years ago he started the construction of eight stores; having puchased land, obstained the permissions, and acquired the material which cost him a lot but he knows that the reward will be worth the effort.

Currently his projects are going extremely well; "This is thanks to the loans given by VF Mexico because each time we receive a loan we are able to invest in our business and in this way with the earnings we can elevate our stores," he said very enthusiastically. With this new support he will purchase more shoes and sufficient material to finish the construction he started.

*The photograph was taken together with his merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and material such as floor tiles and curtains for their stores.

loans.name: Arise And Shine Group

texts.en:
Mary is a thirty-two-year-old businesswoman and a member of the Arise and shine Group of four women. Mary sells fried plantain chips and underwear. She has been in this business for the past four years. She opens her business six days a week from 8 am to 5 pm at the market.

Mary is married and has four children with the ages of 9 and 13, all are school-going children. She established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials and provides food from the profits she earns from her business. Mary is standing on the left in the group picture.

Mary and her group members need a loan totaling GHS 5,200 of which Mary is entitled to GHS 1,800 which she will use to buy more underwear to sell to her customers.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family.

In the future, Mary plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

loans.use: to buy more underwear to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hortense

texts.fr: Hortense est une femme mariée dynamique qui vit à Agoè avec ses cinq enfants à charge. Hortense est âgée de 51 ans et  s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Hortense est une marchande de pagnes qui s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant les quartiers environnant. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Hortense demande ce prêt pour commander des pièces de pagnes afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Hortense is a dynamic married woman who lives in Agoè where she is in charge of her five children.  Hortense is 51 years old and works hard to have be in a good financial situation.  Hortense is a seller of traditional pagne fabric who gets her supplies three times per week at the market and then resells them by circulating the surrounding villages.  To reach her goals, Hortense requests this loan to order pieces of traditional pagne fabric so that she can respond sufficiently to the needs of her clients and have enough financial autonomy to help her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy 8 pieces of traditional pagne fabric

loans.name: Sokol

texts.en:
Sokol is married and the father of three children. In order to earn a living, Sokol works in agriculture. He plants legumes/white beans and also corn with the help of his wife. He is very hardworking, and does much so that he can provide for his family. In addition to working on his own land, he also uses his tractor to work on other people's land for a fee.
