He also has a regular job in a private company making doors and windows, but the salary is low. He is requesting a loan to fix his tractor so that he will be able to continue working in agriculture to supplement his income.

Sokol has not been able to continue his work for some time because of needing the repairs for the tractor, and he has had a decrease in his income because of it.

He is very grateful for this help, and he hopes in the future to have his own private company to make doors and windows.

loans.use: to fix his tractor so that he will be able to continue working in agriculture to supplement his income.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 30 years old and is a married woman. She has been doing a business purchasing and selling animals with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life.

She is a mother of 4 children; one of her children is also shown in the photo. She is working very hard provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

She has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater for more customers.

loans.name: Biswabharati Group

texts.en:
In this year 2015, a women entrepreneur named Mathua from J.K. Pur village of Rayagada district in Odisha, India formed a group with three other women of her locality named “Biswabharati” with the intervention of Mahashakti Foundation.

The lady standing second from left raising her hand in the photo is Mathua. She is 31 years old and is living with her husband and two children. She belongs to a Below Poverty Line family (BPL), a segment living on less than a dollar a day.

Mathua is doing a vegetable business with the support of her husband. Mathua is also collecting leaves and stretching them at home and selling them to contribute to the family income. Mathua herself started this enterprise seven years ago on a small scale and has been working hard to grow her business. Her family earns a monthly income of about 7,000 INR which makes it very hard to manage the family educational, domestic and business expenses. Due to lack of finance she is not able to complete the construction of her house.

So Mathua is planning to expand her business. From the present loan she will purchase a huge stock of vegetables like tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cabbage, carrots, cucumbers, cauliflowers, green chili, and leaves. Mathua dreams of completing the construction of her house and giving a better education to her children.

The other three members of the group are doing vegetable vending, seasonal business and leaf plate making.

loans.use: to purchase a huge stock of vegetables like tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cabbage, carrots, cucumbers, cauliflowers, green chili, and leaves.

loans.name: Wamugo

texts.en:
Wamugo is a single woman. She has 2 children and describes herself as loving.

She operates a farm where she grows crops and also keeps animals. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough funds.

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy seeds and pay farm labour costs. Her business goal is to do large scale farming within 5 years.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay farm labour costs.

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en:
In the village Tsovagyugh in Gegharkunik region lives Silvard, with her husband and their single daughter. Silvard, with her beloved husband, is engaged in farming and agricultural work. At her farm, she takes care of her cows, calves, heifers, a bull, sheep and chickens. From her farm’s milk, Silvard makes a good assortment of dairy-products to sell, including macun (national dairy-product), cheese, curd and she also sells her farm’s meat and eggs. Silvard’s plot of land is also rich with harvest; her land’s potato, cucumber, tomato, peppers and greens are sold at the city’s wholesale market. Silvard mentions that she likes her farming work and since it is the only source of income for her family, she has plans of developing it and making it bigger.

With her Kiva loan Silvard wants to buy two more calves and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two more calves and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is 38 years old and he lives with his big family in Tsovagyugh village in the Gegharkunik region. Vardan lives with his wife, three children and his retired mother.

Vardan used to work at a private workshop as a worker, but now he works full time in farming and agriculture. At his farm, Vardan takes care of cows, calves, a bull, a pig, sheep and also chickens. His vegetable garden is also rather rich and provides fresh vegetables for his family (potato, tomato, cucumber, greens and cabbage), and also it brings good income being sold at the city’s wholesale market.

Vardan will be very thankful if Kiva lenders help him with the loan amount which he wants to use for the purchase of one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: purchase one more cow and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Ayaovi est une femme mariée qui habite à Agoè avec deux enfants à charge. Agée de 31 ans, Ayaovi vend des bijoux pour subvenir à ses besoins. Pour s’approvisionner, Ayaovi se rend trois fois par mois au marché. Ayaovi sollicite ce prêt pour commander des douzaines de boucles d’oreilles en vue de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et d’aider son mari à bien prendre soin de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Ayaovi is a married woman who lives in Agoè and has two children.  Ayaovi is 31 years old and sells jewelry to fulfill her needs.  To get her supplies, Ayaovi returns to the market three times per month.  Ayaovi requests this loan so that she can get dozens of earrings with the hopes of earning profits in order to fulfill her daily needs and help her husband to take good care of their children.

loans.use: to buy five dozens of earrings

loans.name: Nebojsa

texts.en:
Nebojsa is married and has three older children between the ages of 14 and 20 years old. He is a policeman, and his wife stays home to care for the needs of the house and the family.

Although he works as a policeman, he is very hardworking, and after his day of his regular work is completed, he plants wheat on his land to sell. At this time, he is needing a loan to purchase artificial guano and seeds to produce a better and bigger harvest.

He expects to be able to generate even more income with the help of the loan, and is looking forward to improving life for his family. Knowing that it is a Kiva loan, he promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase artificial guano and seeds to produce a better and bigger harvest

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 27-year-old married man who  supports  four members of the family by operating a  motorcycle  services business  for years.  His  monthly  income is 27,000 KSH and he will borrow 101,482 KSH to purchase a new motorcycle  to transport  goods and customers.  He  would  to use  the profit  to buy  spare parts, pay his children's school fees, buy a motor vehicle,  and improve  the living  standards  of his  family.

loans.use: to purchase a new  motorcycle to transport  goods and customers.

loans.name: Mwauchi

texts.en:
Mwauchi is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself as ambitious.

He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rain season which affects business.

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more charcoal. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Selvije

texts.en:
Selvije is 48 years old and plants and sells wheat and is a beekeeper. She has a lot of honeybees and she sells the honey in her area. She is very well known and has a lot of clients and demand for her product.

Her husband is a policeman and earns a low salary. Selvije is able to help provide for the family with her business. She requests a loan to purchase food for the bees, seeds, and artificial guano for the land. She expects that this loan will help her to improve her business and allow her to continue to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase food for the bees, seeds, and artificial guano for the land.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is a widow with 4 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail shop to sell flour, cooking fat, soap, sugar, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are local people.

Her biggest business challenge is a lack of funds. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy sugar, flour, bread, soap, and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes to educate her children to the university level.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, bread, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
A sari-sari (variety) store is one of the most common businesses to acquire in the Philippines, but you cannot expect constant success here. Well, it’s a reality in every business that Evangeline would most probably agree.

For several years that she has been in the industry, she already faced all sorts of difficulties, mostly because of insufficient capital. But Evangeline did not lose heart and hope because she knows that God will always be willing to provide and meet the needs of her family; instead, she saw herself wanting to improve her business yet the problem is how.

Then, this question led her eventually to CCT group ministries where she drew strength and motivation to indeed make her life better by developing strategic ways and discipline for her business. And just recently, she was introduced here to Kiva and eventually had the chance to request loans that further helped her in flourishing her businesses.

Inspired by “loan that change lives,” she is motivated again to borrow now a loan worth PHP 10,000 in order to continue improving her variety store. With this she can already increase her merchandise products and for sure, people nearby their place would be glad to be her customers because of the many options among her products.

By now, she’s glad that her children are willing to help her to handle the business even early in the morning or late at night. She’s dedicated to do this because she really wants to help her husband in satisfying the family needs.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of products to be displayed in her store.

loans.name: Amro

texts.en:
Amro is a 21-years-old single young man from the city of Khan Younis. His father is an employee in the public sector and earns a low and unstable income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family needs.

Amro is a mathematics student in the university. He wants to earn a BA degree and find a job to help his family with their their expenses.

Amro will use the loan to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Amro will be able to do his homework and reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop.

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
Knarik, her son and daughter-in-law live in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. She is 59 years old, and for a long time, she worked at the city’s fabric shop as a tailor, and she was a worker at a private workshop.

Now, her only and beloved occupation is farming, where she takes care of her farm cattle. She has cows, calves, pigs, sheep and chickens in the farm. Knarik makes very tasty cheese and butter from her farm’s milk, and she also sells macun (a national dairy product), meat and eggs.

She has a lot of regular customers, and among them are her neighbors that buy her farm products daily. Knarik is happy that through her farming, she manages to help her son’s family, since her son is just married.

Now, she asks for this loan of 700,000 Armenian drams for the purchase of one more cow and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik lives in Khotanan village of Syunik region with his wife and two school-aged children. He runs a farm. He used to work as a fireman for several years, but now he is busy with his cattle and caring for the land.

He has cows, heifers, a horse, and chickens. He and his wife sell milk, meat, and eggs. He also cultivates beans and potato to sell. Garik needs to buy fodder and will use the Kiva loan to purchase it.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman who has operated a retail business for 2 years. She cooks food to sell and has regular customers.  She will use the 25,000 KES loan to buy materials to construct a business site. Her business goal is to own a hotel within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was  successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy materials to construct a business.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
From Batumi district, Tea is 36 years old, a very dedicated and hardworking woman as well as a cheerful and dynamic one. She is married to Kakha, who is unemployed at the moment. They are currently living with their son in the house they own. Tea works as a saleslady at a local shop and generates a monthly salary. 

Tea decided to open her own shop and so has requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3000 USD. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes for children and will open a shop. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions. Tea awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a children's clothing shop

loans.name: Dorette

texts.fr:
Dorette est une jeune femme exemple de courage et de force. C'est une femme active et dynamique de 25 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants de 9 mois, 5 et 6 ans. Ces deux derniers sont scolarisés dans une école privé et le plus petit suit actuellement un traitement assez cher à cause d'une maladie qu'il a eu depuis sa naissance.
Dorette dirige un magasin de quincaillerie il y a maintenant environ 7 ans, c'est à dire depuis son mariage. C'est son mari qui l'est depuis long temps et c'est lui qui l'apprenait le métier. Actuellement les deux époux  tiennent chacun un magasin, donc la famille en a deux au total.
Sa priorité actuelle est évidemment le traitement de son bébé  et ceci la motive à travailler dur pour gagner davantage de revenu, ensuite les études des autres enfants est aussi important.
texts.en: Dorette is a young woman who is an example of courage and strength.  She is an active and dynamic 25 year old woman.  She is married and is the mother of three children who are 9 months, 5 and 6 years old.  The two oldest children are enrolled in a private school and the youngest is currently on an expensive medical treatment because of an illness that he has had since birth.  Dorette has been running a hardware store for about 7 years now, or since she has been married.  It is her husband who has been in this business for a long time and who taught her the trade.  At the moment, both spouses have their own store, so the family has two stores in total.  Her current priority is obviously the treatment of her baby and this

loans.use: to buy the motor oils: Motul 2001, Elite 2001 and BP 2001

loans.name: Jean Joël

texts.fr: Joël, 61 ans, est marié. Il a trois enfants. Il vend des matériaux de construction tels que fers, ciment, clous, etc. Pour développer son activité, Palmis lui a fourni plusieurs microcrédits. Il continue à avoir recours au crédit pour éviter des ruptures de stock.
texts.en: Joël, 61 years old, is married and has three children. He sells construction materials such as iron bars, cement, nails, etc. In order to develop his business, Palmis has given him several small loans. He continues to turn to these loans so as to avoid running short of inventory items.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cement and iron bars.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.fr: Jackson, 24 ans, est célibataire. Jeune homme courageux et dynamique, il vend des cannes à sucre et des recharges téléphoniques pour pouvoir gagner un peu d’argent pour répondre à ses besoins. Il veut développer cette activité. Il demande un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Jackson, 24 years old, is single. A courageous and dynamic young man, he sells sugar cane and telephone recharge cards so as to be able to earn a little money to cover his needs. He wants to develop this business. He is asking for a loan to grow his stock.

loans.use: to buy sugar cane to resell.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor has successfully built her business of tailoring with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. With time, she has attained a good number of customers, and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now, she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more sewing materials, such as spools of thread, laces and ribbons, to complete the maximum number of orders on time.

She aspires to saving money for her prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more sewing materials, such as spools of thread, laces and ribbons, for completing the maximum number of orders on time.

loans.name: Lirije

texts.en:
Borrower Lirije is a 42-year-old married mother of seven children between six and 20 years of age. Her husband is a construction worker earning a low salary. For more than 10 years, she has operated a business selling used shoes. 

With her business Lirije is able to provide more income for the family's living. She likes what she does and enjoys selling in a market. She is requesting her first loan to buy more used shoes.

Lirije's goal is to have an opportunity to give her children a better education. She thanks all lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes

loans.name: Zaniab

texts.en:
Zaniab has successfully built her business selling animals and selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. With time, she has attained a good number of customers, and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now, she has applied a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales and earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales and earn more profits.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
A senhora Ana de 37 anos de idade é comerciante, casada mãe de 2 filhos dos quais 1 e independente e a trabalhar no estrangeiro e outro a estudar, sustenta sua mãe enviando lhe dinheiro e vive na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar  arroz, açúcar, amendoim, óleo para reforçar o volume de mercadoria na sua banca .
O seu sonho é crescer no negocio, criar uma outra fonte de rendimento construir casa para o seu filho.
Diz que o seu maior desafio e o financeiros e conta com ajuda de seu esposo pedreiro para supri-los, e pretende tomar mais vezes para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
Ana, 37, is a businesswoman. She is married and the mother of two children; one of them is independent and works abroad, while the other one goes to school. She sustains her mother by sending her money. She owns the house where she lives.

She says that with the requested amount she is planning to buy rice, sugar, peanut, and vegetable oil to increase her stock levels.

Her dreams are to expand her business, have another source of income, and build a house for his son.

She says that her biggest challenge is of a financial nature. Her husband, who is a mason, helps her to overcome them. She is planning to apply for more loans in order to overcome the difficulties and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, peanuts, and vegetable oil to strenghten her business.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
A 33-year-old married father of three children, Isaac has been running a motorcycle transport service for the last four years. His monthly income is ksh 20,000.

Isaac has requested a loan of ksh 101,482 to purchase a new motorcycle for transporting goods and people. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and open another business.

This is Isaac's first loan from VisionFund Kenya. In the future he hopes to own rental houses, educate his children and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 27 years old. He is married and has one child. His business is poultry keeping. He has been in this business for one year.

He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES. This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy poultry for rearing.

He will use the profits from his expanded business to increase his savings and expand the poultry stock. His hopes and dreams are to become a large supplier of poultry to several towns.

loans.use: to buy poultry for rearing.

loans.name: Marie Saintanie

texts.fr: Saintanie, 44 ans, est mariée. Elle a quatre enfants. Elle revend des légumes. C’est ainsi qu’elle gagne sa vie et s’occupe de sa famille. Elle cherche un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Saintanie, 44 years old, is married and has four children. She sells vegetables. That is how she earns a living and supports her family. She is asking for a loan to grow her stock.

loans.use: to grow her stock of onions, eggplants, and carrots.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen has successfully built her business selling animals with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. With time, she has attained a good number of customers, and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now, she has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales and earn more profits.

She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales and earn more profits.

loans.name: Arciviliano

texts.es: Arciviliano migró a Barranquilla proveniente de su tierra natal con el anhelo de iniciar su propio negocio, este municipio se convirtió en su lugar de prosperidad  en donde por 20 años ha solventado con su venta de frutas y verduras a su familia.  Él tiene 59 años de edad y es padre de cinco hijos, tan solo uno es menor de edad y aún depende económicamente de él.  Este emprendedor hombre comercializa en su local una gran variedad de frutas y verduras; manzanas, peras, fresas, apio, cebolla, pimentón, tomates, sandias, piñas y demás, todos los días a partir de las 6 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., a transeúntes del sector, generalmente sus ventas se realizan de contado, sin embargo ofrece facilidad de pago a sus clientes fieles.  Sus compras las compras las realiza a mayoristas quienes por compras al por mayor le ofrecen precios de oportunidad, sin embargo  su capital no es suficiente para abastecer a la clientela por eso está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual piensa invertir en volúmenes de papa, plátano, melón y sandias.  Esta inversión hará que sus costos se minimicen y obtenga mas utilidades.  Su meta a futuro es tener sucursales que le permitan incrementar sus ingresos y con ellos lograr mejorar las condiciones de habitabilidad de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Arciviliano migrated to Barranquilla from is homeland with the dream of starting his own business. This town has become his place of prosperity where he has supported his family for 20 years by selling fruits and vegetables. He is 59 years old and is a father to 5 children, only one of whom is a minor and is economically dependant on him.
This entrepreneurial man sells a wide variety of fruits and vegetables from his store: apples, pears, strawberries, celery, onions, peppers, tomatoes, watermelon, pineapples and more. He sells these everyday from 6am until 6pm to passers-by. Generally, his sales are in cash, however he also offers ease of payment to his faithful customers.
He purchases his products wholesale in order to get the best prices, nonetheless he does not have sufficient capital to supply products to his customers and this is why he is requesting his first loan from Kiva with La Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He is planning to invest this in large quantities of potatoes, bananas, melons and watermelons.
This investment will reduce costs and increase profits.
His goal for the future is to have subsidiaries that will allow him to increase his income and with that be able to improve the conditions of his home.

loans.use: to invest in large quantities of potatoes, bananas, melons and watermelons.

loans.name: Alice

texts.pt:
A senhora Alice de 48 anos de idade é comerciante, casada mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 2 a estudarem e os outros 2 maiores de idade, sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar produtos de 1a necessidade  e refrigerantes para reforçar o seu negocio  que faz na sua casa.
O seu sonho é crescer no negocio satisfazendo as necessidades de seus clientes, ter um estabelecimento próprio e em condições na sua casa e reabilitar sua casa.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é o financeiro e para supera-lo também faz machamba. Com os empréstimos anteriores fez uma casa para seus filhos e tem um filho na escola privada graças ao empréstimo, pretende tomar mais vezes ocredito para suprir as dificuldades e alcançar os seus objetivos.
texts.en:
Alice, 48, is a businesswoman. She is married and has four children; two of them go to school and two are adults. She sustains two grandchildren that live with her in a house she owns.

She says that she will use the loan to buy essential products and refrigerants to strengthen the business she runs at home.

Her dreams are to expand her business and fulfill her customers’ demands, have her own well-equipped establishment at home, and remodel her house.

She says that her biggest challenge is financial in nature, and she also grows food to overcome it. With the previous loans, she built a house for her children, and could send her son to a private school. She plans to apply for more loans to overcome the difficulties and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy essential products and refrigerants.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina es una joven estudiante de SENATI de la carrera de Administración Industrial, la cual le atrae mucho porque tiene mucha demanda laboral, la cual la beneficiará económicamente. 

Podrá apoyar a sus padres, quienes actualmente no cuentan con un ingreso fijo y ponen en riesgo el desarrollo profesional de Yanina, porque dejaría de estudiar para dedicarse a trabajar hasta reunir el dinero suficiente que le permita retomar sus estudios.

Ella se encuentra actualmente en el II Semestre, aún le faltan dos años para que culmine su carrera. El único obstáculo que ella presenta ahora es el económico. No quiere dejar de estudiar, por eso recurre al apoyo de KIVA para que cumpla su sueño de ser una excelente profesional. Cuando termine de estudiar le gustaría trabajar en una empresa internacional.

Ella se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brinda KIVA, porque solo así podrá realizar su mayor sueño de terminar su carrera, seguir superándose y convertirse en una profesional exitosa. Es por eso, que ella quiere dedicarle unas palabras a las personas que sin conocerla la están apoyando. Ella les quiere decir: "Me siento feliz y agradecida con este apoyo que me están brindando, no los defraudaré".
texts.en:
Yanina is a student at the SENATI and is pursuing a degree in Industrial Administration. She chose this degree because of the demand for graduates in this field. She hopes this will help her economically.

Upon graduating, she will be able to support her parents, who currently are without a consistent income. Her family situation puts her studies at risk because without a loan, she will need to quit school and work until she has saved enough money to finish her studies.

She is currently in her second semester and she still has two years to go before she completes the requirements for the degree. And so she is looking to Kiva to help her see her dream of becoming an excellent professional come true. When she finishes her studies, she would like to work for an international company.

She is very thankful for the support that Kiva has given her because without Kiva she would not be able to see her dream of finishing her degree come true. With Kiva's help she will continue to work hard and become successful in her career. She would like to say a few words to the people that are helping her even though they do not know her: "I am happy and thankful for your help and I will not let you down."

loans.use: continue her studies in Industrial Administration.

loans.name: Arold

texts.en:
Arold is a married man. He has four children. He operates a posho mill, where he sells maize flour. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a marketable place, and his primary customers are regular.

He describes his biggest business challenge as power outages. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more cereals and a sieving machine.

He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business and have better living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more cereals and a sieving machine.

loans.name: Maa Mahalaxmi Group

texts.en:
In this calendar year 2015, five women members from Jayramguda village of Rayagada district in Odisha, India formed a Self Help Group called Maa Mahalaxmi to access loans from Mahashakti Foundation and expand their businesses. Santilata is one of them. She is 46 years old and lives with her husband, one daughter, and two sons. The member standing in the middle with raised hand in the photo is Santilata.

Along with her husband, Santilata is doing vegetable cultivation and has been in this business for the last 10 years. Santilata earns about 9,500 INR per month from this business which is insufficient to meet the day to day expenses of her family as well as the farm expenses. She wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. She will utilize this loan to buy fruit and vegetables like apples, bananas, coconuts, tomatoes, cauliflowers, peppers, carrots, onions, etc. She expects a good return from her business by expanding it. Santilata hopes to give her daughter a better education so she can build a bright career.

The other four members of this group are also involved in similar businesses and doing vegetable cultivation and such.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables like apples, bananas, coconuts, tomatoes, cauliflower, peppers, carrots, onions, etc.

loans.name: Mariyamma Group

texts.en:
Deepa is an inhabitant of J.K.Pur village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. The lady standing second from the right with raised hand in the photo is Deepa. She is 35 years old and resides with her husband and only son. The main source of income for Deepa is tailoring. Deepa does the tailoring job and her husband helps in marketing.

Deepa has been doing this tailoring for the last eight years and the amount she earns is just hand-to-mouth for her family. Deepa's family income is about 8,000 INR per month. So to overcome this situation, in the year 2013 she formed a Self Help group comprised of herself and four other members. They took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. This will be their second cycle loan.

From this loan amount Deepa will purchase a Pico machine, cloth, and thread. This loan will definitely bring in more income for her. Deepa hopes to construct a house and provide a better education to her children.

The other four members of the group are doing rice businesses and fish businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a Pico sewing machine, cloth, and thread.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim  is a 52-year-old hardworking woman with 7 children. She  provides sewing services in her community and is known for her stitching skills. Shamim ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they faces prior to working. She has established a good clientele and requests 40,000 PKR to purchase a new sewing machine, spools of thread,  and lace to meet customer demands. She aspires to save money for a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine,spools of thread, and lace to meet customer  demands.

loans.name: Llapanchis Llankasun Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LLAPANCHIS LLANKASUN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Maria, la socia continua con su negocio de cultivo de frutas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia  continua cultivando frutas para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita le crédito para comprar semillas, abono entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de agricultura, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
Los socios en general agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño  y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members here belong to the communal bank “LLAPANCHIS LLANKASUN”. This bank is located in the district of Echarate and belongs to the province of La Convención in the department of Cuzco.

The member of this loan is Mrs. Maria. She makes a living by growing fruit. She is responsible and hard working. She has several years experience growing fruits for her customers. Everything is going well thanks to the labor she puts into her business. Her business is also what helps improve the lives of her family members.

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase seeds, manure and more.

The other members of the bank make a living by selling animals, working in agriculture, by running a grocery store and by selling food.

The members of the communal bank are thankful for those who form a part of this dream and they promise to meet the terms of their repayment within the established time frame.

loans.use: purchase seeds, manure and more.

loans.name: Suhey Beatriz

texts.es: Suhey es una microempresaria residenciada en Barranquilla un municipio del departamento del Atlántico y en su hogar materno prevaleció el comercio de artículos varios, actividad en la que a estuvo vinculada desde su niñez, cuando obtuvo su mayoría de edad consiguió un empleo en una empresa y se alejó de esta labor, sin embargo decidió nuevamente retomar la actividad y ser una empresaria independiente.  Hoy en día cuenta con dos años de experiencia funcionando desde la comodidad de su hogar y en un almacén en el que maneja una variada gama de artículos para el hogar entre ellos canastros, sabanas, almohadas, sillas, papeleras, mesas, vajillas entre otros. En la actualidad está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual piensa invertir en nuevo surtido para su local. Ella está muy feliz de poder compartir con sus dos pequeños hijos a quienes ofrece bienestar gracias a su trabajo que es su principal medio de sostenimiento y al mismo tiempo respalda a su hogar en su condición de mujer separada de su cónyuge. Su meta a futuro es aperturar otro almacén y continuar brindándole a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Suhey runs a micro-business located in Barranquilla. In her material home, there was constant buying and selling of a variety of items. She helped in the family business from a young age. When she became an adult, she took a job at a company and did not participate in the family business as much. But she has decided to take up the activity once more and be an independent businesswoman.

Today, she has two years of experience running her own business from her home and from a storefront where she sells a variety of items for the home, like baskets, sheets, pillows, chairs, waste-paper baskets, tables, silverware and more.

She is currently asking for her first Kiva loan through the foundation Mario Santo Domingo. She wants to use the loan to invest in stocking her business. She is very happy to be able to give well being to her two young children thanks to the work she does. Her business is their primary source of income and supports her home like a wife supports her husband. Her goals for the future include opening another store and giving her children a good education.

loans.use: invest in purchasing stock for her home-goods business.

loans.name: Imrane

texts.en:
Imrane is very thankful for the previous which she used to purchase wood for heating. Imrane runs a business selling used shoes and second-hand items. Imrane and her husband buy shoes cheaply to sell in a big market outlet in Kosovo. This income helps to meet their living and family needs. This has been a profitable business and she likes what she does. Imrane and her husband also collect plastic bags to sell.

She requests a loan to buy more used shoes which will generate a larger income for her family. Her goal is to open a shop and increase her earnings to educate her children. She thanks all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to  buy used shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals and fruits.

loans.name: Evanson

texts.en:
Evanson is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself to be faithful. He operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be competition.

Evanson will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy carpentry materials. He hopes that in the future, he will open a timber yard. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is 30 years old. He is married to Margaret who is a farmer, and they are blessed with three school-going children. He has had a transportation business for three years, currently earning a monthly income of KES 35,000.

Nathan has borrowed KES 70,000 from Visionfund Kenya as his third loan after successfully repaying the previous loans. He will be using this loan to purchase spare parts and to service his motor vehicle.

Nathan also hope that the anticipated profit will help him to buy food for his family, pay school fees for his children, cater for medical care, invest in farming, and expand his current business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to enjoy an improved life with his wife and children.

loans.use: to buy parts & service his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 40 years old. He is married and has two children. His business is a retail shop. He has been in this business for 10 years. He earns a monthly income of thirty-nine-thousand Kenyan shillings.

This is Stephen's first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, tea leaves, cooking oil, salt, maize flour, rice, detergents, etc. for the shop and to pay school fees for his children.

Stephen will use the profits from expanded business to expand his business and meet family needs. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business and make his family comfortable.

loans.use: to restock his store.

loans.name: Dromo Group

texts.en:
Patience is a 49-year-old businesswoman and a member of Dromo Group of five women. Patience sells soap and fry fish. She has been in this business for the past eight years. She opens her business seven days a week from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. at the market. Patience established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food from the profits she gets from her business. Patience is standing on the second from left in the group picture.

Patience and her group members need a loan totaling GHS 5,300 of which Patience is entitled to GHS 1,500, which she will use to buy more fish, firewood, cooking oil to fry fish, and also soaps to sell to her customers. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profits to support her family. Patience is a single mum and has two children, ages 26 and 29; both are in the teacher training college and university respectively.

loans.use: to buy more fish, firewood, cooking oil to fry fish, and also soaps to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Bela N Nabra - Domonaayili Group

texts.en:
Ayishetu is a 41-year-old hardworking woman from Dimonaayili in the Northern region of Ghana. Ayishetu is married and has 6 children. She is the woman measuring locally-processed rice with a bowl in the basin whiles squatting in the group photo.

Ayishetu is a member of a par-boiled rice processing group that has been in business for close to two decades. The name of the group is ‘Bela N Nabra - Dimonaayili’. She earns a good profit from the business and loves doing the business. The group has been trained on improved methods of processing the par-boiled rice such that they can always produce premium quality for their customers in Ghana.

Ayishetu and ‘Bela N Nabra - Dimonaayili’ have asked for a loan of GHC 10,900.00 after having paid off their previous loan of GHC 8,200.00. Ayishetu's share of the current loan is GHS 700.00, which would be used to buy more paddy rice from local rice farmers for processing. She would earn more income as a result and would pay back this loan and support her family as usual. Her children are happy for her love and care for them.

Ayishetu thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy rice for processing.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en: Sammy is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, milk, flour, soap and other items. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour,eggs, milk and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy restock his retail business.

loans.name: Shanti Group

texts.en:
Khira, aged 41, is a self-motivated, active woman entrepreneur of J.K. Pur village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a very hardworking lady. She is standing third from the left with a raised hand in the photo. She resides with her husband and only one son.

Khira has been doing vegetable vending for the last five years. Her husband is also supporting the business. Initially, Khira started this business with a small investment of her own. When Mahashakti Foundation started working in her village, she motivated five other women entrepreneurs and formed a group named “Shanti” during 2013, and took a loan for the development of their businesses.

Now, Khira’s income is about 9,800 INR per month, but it is not at all sufficient to meet the household expenses. So, for further development, she will take another loan. From this loan, she will purchase fruits and vegetables such as apples, bananas, coconuts, tomatoes, cauliflower, capsicum, carrots, onions, etc.

Khira hopes to construct a permanent cabin for her business and a good house for her family.

The other five members are doing milk businesses and vegetable vending.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables such as apples, bananas, coconuts, tomatoes, cauliflower, capsicum, carrots, onions, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman. She has 2 children. She operates a farm where she grows rice. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favourable place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

Margaret will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Magali

texts.en: Magali  is 45 years old and she is a dedicated mother. Magali is married and her husband is a mason. Magali wants to help her husband and she needs a loan to buy tools for her husband. Magali takes care of the home, she cooks and cleans but she would like to be the owner of her own house in the future.  She hopes you can help her to improve her husband's business. Magali is doing great at her grocery store but she has 5 kids to feed.

loans.use: to buy tools for her husband

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a married man. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells chopsticks. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

Alex will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of chopsticks. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy chopsticks to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman. She has 4 children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds.

Fatuma will use this KES 120,000 loan to buy tailoring materials. Her business goal is to own a boutique within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will expand business. She will use the anticipated profits to set up a boutique. She hopes that in the future she will grow her business and ensure that her children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials.

loans.name: Nicerate

texts.en:
Nicerate is a married woman. She has 7 children. She describes herself to be honest.

Nicerate operates a farm where she grows bananas, coffee, tea, and also keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

Nicerate will use this KES 50,000 loan to buy more bananas to resell. Her business goal is to buy a transport vehicle within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she can educate her children.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

loans.name: Bangarama Group

texts.en:
Bangarama group is located in Kattapeta village of Rayagada district of Odisha, India. This group consists of five women members from below poverty line category, and Nirmala is one of them. The lady standing in the middle with a raised hand in the photo is Nirmala. She is 38 years old. She is the leader of this self-help group. She lives with her husband and three children.

Nirmala’s husband is running a welding garage in a nearby market. From the business, he earns a monthly income of 7,500 INR. According to Nirmala, in the context of the present market situation, this income is hand-to-mouth for her family, so it is very difficult to think of the future development.

Although there is potential market for her business, finance was a hindrance for her. After the intervention of Mahashakti Foundation in her village, she saw a ray of hope and motivated other women members to borrow from Mahashakti Foundation by forming this group. From the present loan, Nirmala’s husband will purchase more iron and welding materials to expand the existing business.

Nirmala hopes this will help her to generate more income so she can materialize her dreams of giving better education to her children and constructing a house for her family.

The other four members of the group are doing a milk business, grocery shop, cloth store, and motor garage.

loans.use: to purchase more iron and welding materials.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 54-year-old mother of two, who lives with her husband and children in the Aley area of Lebanon. Her children both go to university and her husband works in car mechanics. Twenty years ago, she decided to support her husband in providing for the family by starting her own business in basket weaving. She works from home, where she makes and displays her products for clients.

Huda is very proud of her business, and her clients' satisfaction pushes her to constantly improve her work and diversify her products. She is asking for a 2,571,213 LBP loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa, in order to buy weaving supplies and materials that will allow her to increase her production. With the help of this loan, Huda is expecting to see her income increase, as well as her ability to support her children in their last years of education.

loans.use: to buy basket weaving supplies.

loans.name: Sri Ganesh Group

texts.en:
Prabhasini, the lady standing second from the right with a raised hand in the photo, is a very active woman of 50 years of age. She resides with her family in the village named Jayaramguda of Rayagada district in Odisha, India. Prabhasini hails from a very poor family of Below Poverty Line. She is living with her husband and three sons.

Prabhasini herself has been running a seeds shop with the support of her husband from her home for the last ten years. She started the business with a small investment of her own. Presently, she is earning a monthly income of 8,000 INR. As per the statement of Prabhasini, this small income is not at all sufficient to manage the family. So, she wants to increase her income by expansion of her existing business.

She motivated other like-minded women members of her village and formed a group of four for a fresh loan. From the present loan, she will purchase good-quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides as per the demand of her customers.

She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income and make savings. She wants to be a wholesaler of seeds in the market.

The other three members of the group are doing vegetable vending.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides to sell.

loans.name: Alas De Aguila Group

texts.es:
The eleven women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Alas de Águila” or “Wings of an Eagle” live in San Martín Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango,  in the central region of Guatemala. They range in age from 20 to 40 and have been with Friendship Bridge for one year. The majority of the ladies are mothers and have between 2-7 children. Some of their children are in school.  The women have various businesses in the areas of agriculture, handicrafts and commerce. In the past, they have shown themselves to be very responsible by attending meetings and making their loan payments on time

María is a member of the Trust Bank who is married with six children. She was able to go to school until the 6th grade and is keenly aware of the value of education for her children. She has a convenience store in the town and needs to secure a loan to purchase additional items like corn, rice, beans, oil, sugar, eggs, juice and soap as well as other necessities. 

KIVA investors are wonderful partners with Friendship Bridge in the lives of these women. Slowly, a door is being opened to a brighter and more prosperous tomorrow, benefitting themselves, their families and their community. Thank you!
texts.en:
The eleven women of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank group, 'Alas de Águila' or 'Wings of an Eagle,' live in San Martín Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango, in the central region of Guatemala. They range in age from 20 to 40 and have been with Friendship Bridge for one year. The majority of the women are mothers and have between two and seven children. Some of their children are in school.

The women have various businesses in the areas of agriculture, handicrafts, and commerce. In the past, they have shown themselves to be very responsible by attending meetings and making their loan payments on time.

María is a member of the Trust Bank. She is married, with six children. She was able to go to school until the sixth grade and is keenly aware of the value of education for her children.

She has a convenience store in the town and she needs to secure a loan to purchase additional items, like corn, rice, beans, oil, sugar, eggs, juice, and soap, as well as other necessities.

Kiva investors are wonderful partners with Friendship Bridge in the lives of these women. Slowly, a door is being opened to a brighter and more prosperous tomorrow for these women, benefitting themselves, their families, and their community. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase additional items for a convenience store, like corn, rice, beans, oil, sugar, eggs, juice, and soap, as well as other necessities.

loans.name: Altamirano Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México habitan personas muy alegres a quienes les encanta vivir rodeadas de naturaleza y tradiciones que han prevalecido desde tiempos prehispánicos. Celebran fiestas patronales como la del 12 de diciembre en donde queman fuegos pirotécnicos, abordan juegos mecánicos y degustan delicioso pan de fiesta y dulces típicos.
   Doña Cesaria es una mujer que, aunque seria, disfruta mucho de platicar con las personas que la rodean. Es una mujer muy trabajadora cuyo esfuerzo está destinado al bienestar de su familia integrada por su esposo Silvino y sus dos hijos. Desde hace ocho años se ha dedicado a la cría de cerdos, para lo cual compra los ejemplares unos días después de haber nacido para así asegurar el sano desarrollo de todos y cada uno de ellos. Generalmente todo el proceso de cría dura cuatro meses y una vez terminado los clientes acuden hasta su domicilio para solicitarlos. 
   El mejor momento para obtener ganancias es cuando se realizan fiestas como bodas y quince años dentro de su comunidad. "Estoy muy agradecida con VF México porque confían en mí y en mis habilidades, además con las ganancias puedo sacar adelante a mis hijos" comentó contenta Doña Cesaria. En esta ocasión planea invertir en la compra de más cerdos pequeños y alimento suficiente. Hasta este momento su negocio es muy redituable y su mayor deseo es que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera profesional. 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo llamado Altamirano son Patricia, María Jacinta, Cesaría, Concepción y Jessica quienes, de igual forma, planean invertir en la compra de cerdos. Mientras que Marisol, en dulces y  Valentina y Elvira, en borregos y cerdos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, Doña Cesaria es quien viste el mandil color verde.
texts.en:
In a community in the state of Mexico there lives very happy people who love being surrounded by nature and tradition that has been present since prehispanic times. They celebrate local festival holiday on December 12 where they launch fireworks, ride mechanical rides, and enjoy delicious traditional bread and sweets.

Cesaria is a woman who, although serious, really enjoys chatting with people around her. She is a very hard-working woman whose efforts are directed to the well-being of her family. She is married to her husband Silvino and has two children. For 8 years she has been raising pigs, which she buys a few days after they are born in order to ensure healthy development of each and every one. Generally she raises them for 4 months and once grown customers arrive at her home to purchase them. The best time to obtain income is when there are events such as weddings and quinciñeras (parties for young ladies turning 15 years old) in the community. "I am very thankful to VF Mexico because they have confidence in me and my abilities. In addition with the income I can support my children," Cesaria comments.

Today she plans on purchasing small piglets and a sufficient amount of feed. Up until today her business is going well and her greatest wish is that her children finish school with a professional career.

The other members of the Altamirano group are Patricia, María Jacinta, Cesaría, Concepción and Jessica, who each also plan to invest in buying pigs. Other members Marisol, in candy; Valentina and Elvira in groceries and pigs.

The photograph was taken on the stares of the municipal park. Cesaria is dressed in the green smock.

loans.use: to buy small piglets and feed.

loans.name: Amro

texts.en:
Amro is a 19-year-old, single young man from Khanyounis city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family’s needs.

Amro is a student in the university where he studies Business Administration. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family with part of their expenses. Amro took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Amro will be able to do his homework and reports easily. Amro appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Liseth

texts.es:
Liseth es una mujer de cincuenta y un años de edad, muy innovadora y creativa, ella tiene un negocio de corte y confección, desde hace veinte años se dedica a ser modista, se ha entregado en cuerpo y alma a su trabajo, su principal apoyo es una sobrina. Ella ya ha sido beneficiada antes con un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, con el cual pudo sacar adelante toda una colección de vestidos, que logro vender a buen precio, no tiene forma de describir el agradecimiento que tiene por ambas organizaciones. 
En estos momentos ha vuelto a solicitar un préstamo, dado que esta temporada del año, es muy buena para su negocio, ella pretende usar el crédito para comprar telas, aplicaciones, hilos, cintas, encajes y otras cosas relacionadas a la costura. En un futuro desea hacer de su negocio un taller donde las mujeres puedan llegar aprender a coser y confeccionar ropa.
texts.en:
Liseth is a 51 year old woman who is very creative and innovative. She has a business cutting and sewing clothing. She has been a dressmaker for twenty years and she has devoted her body and soul to her work; her main support is a niece. She has already benefited with a loan from Kiva together with MiCrédito with which she was able to put together a collection of clothing which she managed to sell at a good price. There is no way to describe her gratitude to these two organizations.

At this time she has returned to request a loan given that this season of the year is very good for her business. She plans to use the loan to buy fabric, appliqués, thread, ribbons, lace and other things related to sewing. In the future she wants to make her business become a shop where women can come to learn to sew and make clothing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, appliqués, thread, ribbons, lace and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un hombre casado, su trabajo le demanda exponerse muchas horas al sol, por lo cual se ha desarrollado una inflamación del tejido de la conjuntiva en el ojo izquierdo, sus síntomas son muy dolorosos junto con ardor e irritación así como perdida considerable de su visión. A él le urge un tratamiento para evitar que el daño siga avanzando hacia la cornea.
texts.en: This borrower is a married man whose work demands that he is exposed to the sun for many hours.  As a result, he has developed an inflammation in the conjunctive tissue of his left eye.  His symptoms are very painful with burning and irritation, as well as a significant loss of his vision.  He has been urged to get treatment to avoid having the infection continue into his cornea.

loans.use: ophthalmic treatment

loans.name: Julio De Nilson

texts.es:
Julio, es un joven estudiante que vive junto a su padre y sus hermanastras. Él es el hijo mayor. Su padre es técnico soldador, fabrica todo tipo de trabajos de estructuras metálicas en su taller. Su trabajo no le genera ingresos fijos, lo cual ocasiona un problema para Julio, porque no puede continuar sus estudios.

Él está cursando el II Semestre de la carrera de Electrónica Industrial. Aún le queda 2 años para que pueda terminarla. Le interesa mucho su carrera, porque creció observando los trabajos que realiza su padre. Él desea poder terminar su carrera en el tiempo estimado, para luego poder convalidar con alguna universidad de prestigio y así tener más experiencia, que le permita trabajar en una gran empresa especialista en su carrera.

De no tener el acceso al crédito, Julio hubiera tenido que adecuarse al nivel educativo que su padre pudiera solventar. Truncaría sus sueños, porque no estudiaría lo que tanto desea. Es por eso, que recurre al apoyo de KIVA para no dejar de estudiar lo que tanto le gusta.

Él se siente muy agradecido con aquellas personas que lo apoyarán, por eso quiere decirles lo siguiente: "Que bueno que existan estos programas como estos, para poder dar pie a que tengamos la oportunidad de estudiar carrera que van a servir a forjar el futuro de nuestro país. Estoy muy agradecido por su gentil apoyo aún sin conocerme. Muchas gracias.
texts.en:
Julio is a young student who lives with his father and his step sisters. He is the oldest child. His father is a welder who makes all kinds of metal structures in his workshop. His work does not generate regular income, which is a problem for Julio, because he can not continue with his studies.

He is in the second semester of the Industrial Electronics program. He still has 2 years remaining to finish it. His course of study is very interesting to him, because he grew up watching his father work.

He hopes to be able to finish his studies in the estimated amount of time, so that he can then earn credit with a prestigious university and thereby gain more experience. This would allow him to work in a large specialized company for his career.

If he didn't have access to the loan, Julio would have had to be content with an educational level that his father would be able to fund. His dreams would be cut short, because he would not be able to study what he so wishes to. This is why he is seeking Kiva's support, so that he won't have to abandon the studies that he so enjoys.

He is very grateful to the people who support him. This is why he wants to tell them the following: "How good it is that programs such as these exist, that allow us to have the opportunity to pursue studies that will help forge the future of our country. I am very grateful for your kind support, even though you don't know me. Thank you very much."

loans.use: to cover his costs for Industrial Electronics studies.

loans.name: Milagro De Dios Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION MILAGRO DE DIOS ESTA CONFORMADA POR DIES INTEGRANTES SIETE MUJERES Y TRES HOMBRES MADRES Y PADRES RESPONSABLES DE FAMILIA CON QUINCE HIJOS TODOS ORIGINARIOS DEL SAUCE LUGAR QUE ESTA UBICADO EN LA ZONA NORTE DE LA REGION, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LE GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPANIA DE LA SUS FAMILIAS, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN PARA SALIR ADELANTE DIA A DIA CON SU DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONOMICA,LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO PUDO ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDA CON LOS DEVERES DEL HOGAR.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES LUZ ES LA CORDINADORA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE TORTILLAS EN SU CASA DE HABITACION, ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y COMPRA MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA ELABORACION DE TORTILLAS COMO UN QUINTAL DE MAIZ, LEÑA, CAL, ETC, PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS, MILAGRO DE DIOS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Milagro de Dios Association is composed of 10 members, seven women and three men who are responsible family mothers and fathers with 15 children between them. They all come from Sauce which is located in the northern zone of the region. They are characterized as hard-working and responsible with a desire to rise above the rest personally. In their free time, they like to enjoy the company of their families. Nowadays, they are struggling to get ahead day by day with their different economic activities. Unfortunately, they were not able to study due to a lack of economic resources and found themselves needing to work at a early age in order the help with the household needs.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Luz and for her economic activity she sells tortillas out of her house. She works at this business offering her products for 12 hours a day. The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and buy raw materials for making tortillas, such as a hundredweight of maize, firewood, lime, etc. so that in the not-so-distant future she will be able to obtain better income.

Milagro de Dios is grateful for the help the Kiva investors offer to people with scarce resources in order to have a worthy means to work.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials to make tortillas, such as corn, lime, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Dios Proveera Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACION COMUNAL DIOS PROVEERA ESTA CONFORMADA POR OCHO  INTEGRANTES MADRES SOLTERAS CON VEINTE HIJOS TODOS MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES ESTAN ESTUDIANDO, SON ORIGINARIOS DE MALPAISILLO, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACION PERSONAL, EN SUS RATOS LIBRE LES GUSTA DISFRUTAR DE LA COMPANIA DE SUS HIJOS, EN LA ACTUALIDAD, LUCHAN PARA SEGUIR ADELANTE CON SUS NEGOCIOS,LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO PUDIERON SEGUIR ESTUDIANDO Y SE DEDICARON A TRABAJAR PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR, EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN  PARA BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS LA ESTABILIDAD QUE NECESITAN Y CUMPLIR SUS SUEÑOS Y METAS COMO FORMAR A SUS HIJOS EN PROFESIONALES, Y DARLES UN TECHO DIGNO DONDE VIVIR.
GRACIAS A SU PERSEVERANCIA LA CORDINADORA ES AURA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA UNA PULPERIA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES LA CUAL ESTA UBICADA EN SU CASA DE HABITACION PRODUCTOS COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZUCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, ACEITE, JUGOS, GALLESTAS, HIELOS, TISTE, ETC. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNOS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS.DIOS PROVEERA AGRADECE LA AYUADA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The communal association Dios Proveerá is made up of eight women who are single mothers with twenty children, all of whom are minors who are going to school. They are from Malpaisillo and are characterized as being hard-working, responsible, with the desire to improve themselves. In their free time they like to enjoy their children's company. Currently, they are struggling to get ahead with their businesses. Sadly, due to the lack of economic resources, they were not able to continue their education and they worked to help with the household expenses. Currently, they struggle to offer their children the stability they need and to achieve their dreams and goals to make their children into professionals and give them a dignified roof to live under.

Thanks to her perseverance, the coordinator is Aura and she has as her work a pulpería which is a small store where she sells food products which is located in her house. She sells products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, oil, juice, ices, tiste [a drink made from corn and cocoa], etc. She works at her business some twelve hours each day, selling her products. The goal for this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with the purchase of food products so that in the not-so-distant future she can get better income. She is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified means of working.

loans.use: to purchase food products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juices, soft drinks, cookies, tiste [a drink made from corn and cocoa], etc.

loans.name: G. S. La Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
EL G.S LA VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE ESTA CONFORMADA POR CUATRO INTEGRANTES MADRES SOLTERAS CON SEIS HIJOS, TODOS MENORES DE EDAD, SON ORIGINARIOS DE MANAGUA, Y SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER PERSONAS TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSBLES CON GANAS DE SUPERCION PERSONAL. LAMENTABLEMENTE POR FALTA DE RECURSOS ECONOMICOS NO PUDIERON ESTUDIAR Y SE VIERON EN LA NECESIDAD DE TRABAJAR A TEMPRANA EDAD PARA AYUDAR CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR. EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DIA A DIA PARA HACER CRECER SUS NEGOCIOS A TRAVES DE LA PERSEVERANCIA.
GRACIAS  A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES MARTHA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE ROPA NUEVA COMO: PANTALONES PANTALON CORTO , FALDAS, VESTIDOS, BLUSAS, CAMISETAS, ROPA DE NIÑO, ROPA INTERIOR, ETC.  EL NEGOCIO LO DESEMPEÑA DE FORMA AMBULANTE Y POR ENCARGOS A CLIENTES  FIJOS Y EVENTUALES. ELLA DEDICA A SU NEGOCIO UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS OFRECIENDO SUS PRODUCTOS, TODOS LOS DIAS SALE A VENDER CON SU MERCADERIA CON UN BOLSOS DE UNOS 20 KG PARA OFRECER Y ENTREGAR LOS PEDIDOS SOLICITADO POR SUS CLIENTES. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE MERCADERIA PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS, G.S VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The "Virgen de Guadalupe" solidarity group is composed of four members, single mothers with six minor children, from Managua. The women are hard-working and responsible with a desire for personal advancement. Lamentably, lacking economic resources, they could not attend school and were forced to begin working at an early age to help cover household expenses. At present, they struggle day to day to make their businesses grow through their perseverance.

Owing to her strong urge to get ahead, Martha is their coordinator. Her economic activity is selling new clothes such as pants, short pants, skirts, dresses, blouses, undershirts, children's clothes, and underwear, etc. Her business involves walking about the city and obtaining orders from fixed and casual customers. Martha dedicates some 12 hours per day, seven days a week to her business. She starts each day with a 20 kilogram bag of merchandise, offering clothing and fulfilling her customer's orders.

The objective of the loan is to invest working capital in resupplying her clothing business, buying and selling merchandise so that in the not too distant future she may obtain better income.

The "Virgen de Guadalupe" solidarity group is grateful for the help provided by Kiva investors for persons of scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that women such as these can have a means of pursuing dignified work.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, short pants , undershirts, children's clothes, underwear, bed clothing, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Las Flores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LAS FLORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de San Sebastián, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucila ella es soltera y tiene 63 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de panaderia,la socia prepara diferentes panes,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia es un persona emprendedora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de panaderia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar harina,manteca y leche para que prepare panes.
 La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.



 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de tortas, negocio de cabinas de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Las Flores" (The Flowers) communal bank.  This communal bank is located in San Sebastián District, which is a part of Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

The member Sra. Lucila is single.  She is 63-years old and has three children.  She works in her bakery preparing different types of bread from 8:00a.m. until 6:00p.m.  Sra. Lucila is an enterprising person who, through her business, wants to get her children ahead.  Her dream is to expand her bakery.  She is requesting the loan to purchase flour, lard and milk for making bread. 

The member whose photo is inset to the group photo had her picture taken separately; she was absent from the meeting because she had to work. 


The other members make their livings through businesses selling pastries, selling clothing, with a grocery store and with a restaurant.

Sra. Lucila is grateful to those who are helping make her dream come true through the loan.  She promises to comply with her established re-payment plan.

loans.use: to purchase flour, lard and milk for making bread.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a married woman who has five children. She describes herself to be joyful. She operates a retail business where she sells cooking oil, soap, soda, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, cooking oil, sweets and other items. Her business goal is to own a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, cooking oil, sweets and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La señora esta casada, tiene 51 años de edad, quien estudió hasta tercero de primaria, por cuestiones económicas no logró culminar sus estudios dedicándose a trabajar en la agricultura especializándose en la producción de uva desde muy corta edad, actualmente vive en la comunidad de Sunchuhuayco siempre tuvo el deseo constante de superación pero su estado de salud hasta esta parte decayó y es por eso que la señora necesita el préstamo para poder costear la operación de su esposo ya que se encuentra enfermo del corazón y según los estudios realizados y la valoración médica  tienen que cambiarle una Válvula Aortica sin esta cirugía seguirá sufriendo dolor en el pecho, dificultad para respirar entre otros síntomas que aquejan esta enfermedad truncando el deseo de tener una vida más normal y mejorar su calidad de vida para poder trabajar su tierra que es lo que más desea por el bienestar de sus hijos y familia.
texts.en: This woman is married to Rufino. He is 51 years old, went to school up to the third grade, and for economic reasons wasn't able to finish his education. He has worked in agriculture, specializing in growing grapes from a very young age. Currently he lives in the community of Sunchuhuayco and has always had the desire to improve himself, but his health situation has deteriorated and for this, the woman needs the loan to be able to pay for her husband's operation since he has a heart disease and according to the completed tests and the medical opinion, they will have to replace his aortic valve. Without this surgery, he will continue suffering from chest pain, difficulty breathing, and other symptoms that afflict this illness, cutting off his desire to have a more normal life and improve his quality of life to be able to work his land which is what he most desires for the well-being of his children and family.

loans.use: to pay the high cost of her husband's operation who is in very poor health.

loans.name: Larry Arturo

texts.es: Larry de 33 años se encuentra residenciado en Barranquilla, un municipio del departamento del Atlántico y en su microempresa familiar confecciona todo tipo de prendas de vestir; esta actividad la inició motivado por su esposa quien desde joven se dedicó a la costura y fue quien lo incitó a aprender y empezar un taller en su compañía.  En la actualidad cuenta con cinco años de experiencia ofreciendo exclusivas prendas de vestir a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son almacenes reconocidos, también ofrece servicio de maquila en mayores volúmenes a almacenes mayoristas de la ciudad.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar telas e insumos al por mayor, necesarios para el eficiente funcionamiento de sus confecciones.  Su meta a futuro es adquirir otras máquinas que le permitan incrementar su capacidad de producción y en lo personal desea remodelar su vivienda para que su hijo de siete años de edad cuente con una condiciones favorabes de habitabilidad.
texts.en: Larry is 33 years and lives in Barranquilla, a municipality of the Department of the Atlantic. In his family small business, he sews all types of clothes. He started this business motivated by his wife, who worked sewing since she was young and who made him learn and open a workshop in his company. Currently, he has five years of experience offering exclusive clothing items to his customers, who are mostly known wholesale department stores. He also offers assembly services in large quantities to wholesale department stores in the city. Currently, he is applying to a Credikiva, the first loan he does with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy fabrics and inputs at wholesale prices, needed for the efficient performance of his finished textile products. His goal in the future is to get other machines to allow him to increase his production capability; and personally, he wants to remodel his house so that his seven year old son will have favorable living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and inputs at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Dieubon
