texts.fr: Dieubon, 39 ans, est entrepreneur. Il est marié et vit à Petit-Goâve où il exerce une petite activité de vente de produits alimentaires. Il étale se produits chez lui. Il est dans cette activité depuis une douzaine d’années. Il a démarré avec ses propres fonds. Mais pour développer son commerce, il a fait appel au service de Palmis pour avoir un microcrédit qui lui permettra d’augmenter son stock et de générer plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Dieubon is 39 years old and a businessman. He is married and lives in Petit-Goâve where he has a small business selling groceries. He displays his products in front of his home. He has been selling groceries for the past twelve years. He started his business with his own funds. However in order to grow his business, he is asking field partner Palmis for a loan that will allow him to increase his stock and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy cases of smoked herring and oil.

loans.name: Inesa

texts.en:
Inesa is 46 years old. She lives alone in Khelvachauri district. Inesa is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she owns a citrus garden and sells the harvest locally at a good price.

Inesa wants to get a more stable business and needs credit to renovate a flat that she owns and rent it out. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 3000 USD. With the received credit she will renovate the flat and will rent it out in order to get a stable income. Inesa will be able to generate more income and with increased income she will improve her living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out in order to get a stable income.

loans.name: Ignacio Rigoberto

texts.es:
Ignacio un hombre de 19 años soltero no tiene hijos muy humilde y trabajador que por falta de recursos económicos no ha podido continuar con sus estudios superiores, actualmente se dedica a labores de construcción, cada día lucha y se supera por tener un futuro mejor.  
Don Ignacio desea emprender en una pequeña granja porcina comprando cerdas madres y vendiendo lechones a pesar de su edad tiene mucha experiencia en este negocio ya que sus Padres y hermanos también se dedican a la producción de cerdos cuenta con el espacio suficiente para esta actividad a la misma le dedicará un promedio de 4 horas diarias. 
Don Ignacio agradece a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidades brindadas ya que es la única institución que se preocupa por las personas que desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ignacio is 19 years old and is single with no children.  He is very unassuming and hardworking.  Due to a lack of financial resources, he has not been able to continue to study in college.  He now works in construction.  Every day he strives to succeed so that he can have a better future.

Ignacio wants to start up a small pig farm by purchasing female pigs and selling suckling pigs.  In spite of his age, he has a lot of experience in this business because his father and brothers also work producing pigs.  He has enough space for this business, in which he plans to spend an average of 4 hours a day.

Ignacio thanks Kiva for the support and opportunities provided, because it is the only institution that is concerned with people who are struggling to get ahead.

loans.use: to start up a pig farm

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres proviene de una familia muy humilde, formó pareja muy joven, trabajó durante 48  años una empresa privada, gracias a eso pudo darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
Hoy está jubilado y con la idea de poder seguir trabajando y ganándose la vida, se dedica a la venta de bebidas varias en su propia casa. Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que pese a todo quiere seguir trabajando y esforzándose por  su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas variadas, para poder surtir su negocio, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Andres comes from a very humble family. He got married young and he worked for 48 years for a private company. Thanks to this, he was able to give a good education to his children.

Now he is retired and has an idea to be able to continue working and earning a living. He is making a living selling drinks in his own house. He is a very hard-working and feisty person, who despite everything wants to continue working and struggling for his family.

He is requesting this loan in order to be able to purchase various beverages in order to stock his business, and in this way to continue with his sales as he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy various beverages for sale.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
El Sr. Emilio está casado con la Sra. Sonia hace 2 años aun no tienen hijos, es un matrimonio joven, que se esfuerza para poder crecer.
Emilio tiene un negocio en donde vende todo tipo de bebidas. Él y su esposa se iniciaron en esta actividad con un pequeño capital que juntaron cuando aún eran solteros, y decidieron montar este negocio para poder cubrir las necesidades del día a día.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con más bebidas, ya que tiene muchos clientes y quiere poder cumplir con ellos y con los pedidos que siempre recibe.
texts.en: Emilio has been married to Sonia for 2 years and they have no children yet. It is a young couple who works hard to prosper. Emilio has a business where he sells all types of beverages. He and his wife started this job with a small capital they saved when they were still single, and they decided to start this business to cover their daily needs. He is requesting this loan to be able to stock up his business with more beverages, because he already has many customers and wants to fulfill their wishes and the orders he always gets.

loans.use: to buy different beverages for sale.

loans.name: Mujeres Tayacanes Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Mujeres Tayacanes es conformado por tres microempresarias de éxito, coordinado por doña Cecilia una mujer laboriosa de 46 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo, ella inicio su negocio con la venta de sopas lo cual le ayudó a tener su propia pulpería donde lleva más de tres años administrándola con el apoyo de su hijo, quien le ayuda a realizar compras o a despachar a los clientes, ella solicita por noveno ciclo el financiamiento de la institución porque desea invertir en la compra de granos, básicos, avena, jabón y papel higiénico, con las ganancias que obtuvo con créditos anteriores logro comprar una máquina de coser y su nueva meta es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio, para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, la segunda socia es Antonia de 56 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla y nacatamales,  la tercer socia es Maricela de 28 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa interior.
texts.en: The solidarity group Women Tayacanes is composed of three micro successful entrepreneurs, coordinated by Mrs. Cecilia a laborious 46-year-old, single mother of a son, she began her business by selling soups which helped him to have his own grocery store where she is managing since more than three years ago with the support of her son, who helps him make purchases or dispense to clients, she asks for the ninth cycle financing institution because she wishes to invest in the purchase of grains, basics, oats, soap and toilet paper, with the gains obtained in previous credits achievement she bought a sewing machine and his new goal is to improve the infrastructure of their business, to provide better service to her customers, the second partner Antonia is 56 years old who it sells tortillas and tamales, the third member 28 is Maricela who sells underwear.

loans.use: para la compra de granos, básicos, avena, jabón y papel higiénico

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail business where she cooks food to sell. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to own a hotel within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients to prepare food.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman who has one child. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, sugar, flour, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, rice, cooking fat and other items.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, rice, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is a 43-year-old community leader who lives in Nairobi's Mukuru Kwa Reuben. He is popular for his commitment towards ensuring the safety of his neighbors and is popularly referred to as 'welfare chairman'.

He is also a small scale businessman who has established a water vending business and has a few rental units where he also lives with his family of three children.

At his plot, there are no toilet facilities. Haron's family and tenants use neighboring ones at a cost of four shillings per use.

Having learnt and even used Fresh Life Toilets that are now popular in Mukuru, Haron's goal this year has been to establish Fresh Life Toilets for his tenants. As he says, the facility will contribute immensely towards improving sanitation at his plot.

In addition, access to clean and hygienic toilets at all times will guarantee that tenants and Haron's family will not have to traverse through unsafe pavements particularly in the night in search of toilets.

Let us help Haron towards acquiring one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.use: to pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Gnunibohiwuni – Kunkuna Group

texts.en:
Tambo is a hardworking 36-year-old married woman with 5 children. She lives in Kunkuna, a suburb of Bimbilla, in the northern region of Ghana. In the group photo, Tambo is the woman squatting in front with both hands on a shea nuts basin.

Tambo belongs the ‘Gnunimbohi Wuni – Kunkuna’ group, made up of shea nuts and rice processors, which has been in business for the past seven years. The group has been trained by Grameen Ghana on ways to improve their shea nuts and rice processing business in order to satisfy customers’ quality preference for a sustainable market in Ghana.

Tambo and her group have asked for a loan of GHC 14,400. Tambo’s share of the loan is GHC 800, which she would use to buy shea nuts from nuts pickers and processors for processing into shea butter to sell at local markets. Tambo would earn more income to pay off this loan, grow her business and care for her children.

Tambo thanks and looks up to Kiva lenders for support.

loans.use: to buy shea nuts from nuts pickers and processors for processing into shea butter to sell at local markets.

loans.name: Kahathi

texts.en:
Kahathi is a widowed woman; she has seven children, all of whom do not attend school. Kahathi owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are domestic use.

Kahathi has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase four sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Iyad

texts.en:
Iyad is a 36-year-old Palestinian young man who lives with his wife and three children in a Palestinian refugee camp located in North Lebanon. While his two daughters and son all go to elementary school, his wife works as an assistant nurse in an NGO inside the camp to support the family with an extra income. Iyad started working as an independant construction painter five years ago after starting to practice it since he graduated from school.

He is asking for a 1,799,994 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. He needs the loan because he is planning on expanding his line of business by opening a paint shop inside the camp which will increase his income from paint and painting tools sales.

This increase in his income will allow Iyad to provide his three children with improved living conditions despite the socioeconomic instability they are growing up in.

loans.use: to buy painting supplies

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 48 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a sus 2 hijos de 20 y 12 años de edad. Ella es una mujer que todos los días se esfuerza para sacar adelante a sus hijos a la falta del padre de sus hijos. Dora adquirió un crédito anteriormente que invirtió en el cambio de una parte del techo de la cocina ahora nuevamente está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en tejas de barro para mejorar la parte del techo que les falta y seguir mejorando su vivienda popo a poco y seguir manteniendo a sus hijos en un lugar seguro para vivir, ya que ella sabe que una vivienda digna es un derecho de sus hijos.
texts.en: Dora is a 48 year old single mother and lives in her own home with her two children, who are 20 and 12 years old.  She is a woman who strives every day to bring up her children in spite of the lack of their father.  Dora took out a loan previously, which she invested in replacing part of the roof of her kitchen.  Now she is again requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in clay tiles to continue improving her home little by little, and to continue supporting her children in a safe place to live, because she knows that decent housing is a right of her children.

loans.use: to invest in clay tiles to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 55 years old. She is married and has four children. Her business is selling vegetables and farming. She has been in the business for six years. She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings. This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase stock of cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, onions and avocados to sell. She will use the profits from her expanded business to meet family expenses. Her hopes and dreams are to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, onions and avocados to sell.

loans.name: Meseleman

texts.en: Meseleman is a Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 17 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en: Saidi is a married man. He has three children. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables. His business goal is to be a supplier of vegetables within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Metunje

texts.en: Metunje is married and has one child. For the past three years, she has operated a retail business selling tomatoes, snacks, coconuts and clothes. Metunje will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and clothes. She hopes that, in the future, she will have better living conditions. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and clothes

loans.name: Amiran

texts.en:
Amiran is 45 years old and lives in his own house together with his wife and child. He has worked in agriculture for many years, growing vegetables.

Amiran is a very hardworking, responsible person with a lot of experience in his work. He lives in very humble conditions with his family, and that situation serves as an incentive for him to keep struggling and giving his best. That's how he will manage to provide his family with a better quality of life. He works very hard to bring bread home every day since he has no other source of income besides agriculture. It's for that reason that he has decided to request a loan to start up an additional business.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2500 GEL. With the received credit he will renovate a flat he owns and will rent it out in order to generate income.

Amiran hopes he will earn additional income to cover household necessities so that he can realize his dream of giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out in order to generate income

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is a married mother of eight children, all of whom do not attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. In addition she also operates a farming business that earns her another source of income.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Leotran

texts.en: Leotran is single and has no children. He owns his own house and a little farm. Leotran makes cheese for a living and is also a mason. Leotran learned to make cheese when he was a child. He needs a loan to buy a milking cow since he would like to increase his milk production. Leotran hopes you can help him; he is alone.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Musili

texts.en:
Musili is married and has two children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. For the past nine years, Musili has operated a retail business selling cabbages, tomatoes, onions and fruits. Her primary customers are locals. Musili describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds.

Musili will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits. She hopes that, in the future, she will expand her business. This is Musili's fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a baker, married and living with his wife and three children in a camp for the Palestinian refugees located in the North of Lebanon.

He is 44 years old and owns a bakery inside the camp. Khaled became a baker 15 years ago, but decided to open his own business in 2014. In order to develop it, Khaled is asking for a 2,569,000 Lebanese pound loan from Kiva's partner Ibdaa for the first time. He wants to buy grills for chicken and other equipment to expand his menu. In that way, Khaled will be able to sell sandwiches and not only baked products.
He is an ambitious man. Developing his business will insure him its sustainability and continuation. Khaled will be able to attract more clients with the diversity of items on his menu in addition to his very good reputation among his clients and suppliers.

loans.use: to buy equipment for his bakery.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation and theft in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria, 61 years old, still makes bread and sells her products as a traveling seller. She lives with her 27-year-old daughter, who helps her to make bread. Maria's daughter is going to college so Maria has to often work alone. Maria has been making bread for twenty years. She needs a loan to buy more flour in great quantities before the prices go up. In the photo, you can see Maria in her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy flour

loans.name: Kidodo

texts.en:
Kidodo is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is domestic needs. She has operated a farming business for the past two years planting and selling vegetables at the market. She mentioned transportation as a major challenge in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her farming business. She decided to join Yehu to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her farming business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as God-fearing.

Esther operates a retail business where she sells clothing. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a populated place, and her primary customers are locals.

Esther describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of clothing.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of clothing.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada, su primer esposo falleció y ella se volvió a acompañar, su pareja se dedica a la ganadería y tiene una buena producción de derivados de la leche; todos sus hijos ya están aparte y ella solo vive ella junto a su esposo y dos nietos. 

Dina, tiene una tienda en la que vende todo lo más necesario para la cocina como arroz, frijoles, aceite y azúcar, esta tienda la tiene desde hace 6 año la cual ha sido su principal fuente de ingresos y es así como ha logrado suplir todas sus necesidades y las del hogar, antes de tener la tienda se dedicaba a ayudarle a su esposo con el ganado, la tienda la tiene en la casa y sus nietos le apoyan a vender cuando ella no está. 

El préstamo será utilizado para surtir la tienda con más productos, ya que está aumentando las ventas y le buscaban productos que ella no tiene, por lo que a decidió surtir más y poder darle una mejor atención a sus cliente.

Ella sueña con ver a sus nietos preparados académicamente.
texts.en:
Dina is 51 years old and studied until the third grade. She is a widow, her first husband died and she remarried. Her partner raises cattle and has a good business producing dairy products. All her children are on their own, and she just lives with her husband and two grandchildren.

Dina has a shop that sells everything necessary for cooking such as rice, beans, oil and sugar. She started this store six years ago and it has been her main source of income and has been able to supply all their needs and those of the household. Before having the store she made a living helping her husband with the livestock. The shop she now has is in her house and her grandchildren help sell things when she is not there.

This loan will be used to stock her store with more products, as they are increasing their sales and the customers are asking for products that she does not have. So they have decided to stock more to be able to give better service to their customers.

She dreams of seeing her grandchildren complete their education.

loans.use: to stock her store with more products.

loans.name: Jai Hanuman Group

texts.en:
Some like-minded women members from Kattapeta village of Rayagada district in Odisha, India formed a group named Jai Hanuman. To strengthen the social relations and to obtain the financial support to expand their businesses, they are doing regular meetings and researching financing at an affordable cost.

Maleswari is one of them. She is a 39-year-old lady who lives with her husband and three children. The member standing third from the left with a raised hand in the photo is Maleswari. Her husband has been running a bookshop in a nearby market for the last ten years. Maheswari’s husband is a good businessman and earns about INR 9,000 per month.

Maleswari is a very active lady, and she also collects leaves locally and sells them after stitching them as leaf plates. However, the total family income is not sufficient to materialize their dream. So, the present loan will be utilized to purchase a showcase, some books, paper, pens, pencils, sketch pens, stapler, etc.

Maleswari hopes this loan will definitely help her husband to add extra income to her family.

The other five members are doing leaf plate stitching, fast food business, and tailoring.

loans.use: to purchase a showcase, some books, paper, pens, pencils, sketch pens, stapler, etc.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is the age of 34, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a weaver and knots blankets at home. For knotting blankets wool is used in making blankets. There is no better kind of blankets than blankets made by hand; though this is far from implying that all hand-tufted blankets are superior to all machine-made ones.

Her husband is very expert and knots very fine blankets. This is a very slow and time consuming procedure; he knots blankets over nights. This is why her husband sells them for a high price but the problem is the customers do not agree upon the demanded cost. The demand for fine blankets has been increasing from time to time. However, her husband wants to buy more raw materials for knotting blankets but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible.

Therefore, Nazia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy wool for knotting blankets and it could become the cause of an increase in income.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for knotting blankets for her husband's blanket business.

loans.name: Khamida

texts.en:
Khamida is a married woman with one child who is still too young to attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. She has operated a petrol and diesel business for the past four years selling as retail. She mentioned a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of petrol and diesel for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of petrol and diesel to sell.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a Palestinian refugee living in a camp located in north Lebanon who works as a taxi driver. He is 39 years old, married, and lives with his wife and 2 sons and daughter.

Saleh has 5 years of experience as a taxi driver and a very good reputation inside the camp. Despite competition, his clients stay loyal to him because he is friendly and reliable.

Saleh is requesting a 1,543,992 LBP loan for the first time from Kiva's partner Ibdaa. His only concern is to ensure a good life for his family. He believes that, with this loan, he will be able to pay for his taxi's maintenance, and thus he will get more orders for his taxi service which will improve his income and work conditions.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Shiva Ganga Group

texts.en:
Jyoti, an active married lady of 29 years of age, is a resident of a rural village named Kotapeta in Rayagada district of Odisha, India. The lady standing second from the left with a raised hand in the photograph is Jyoti. She resides with her husband and one son and two daughters. All three of her children are studying in a government school.

To increase the income of her family, Jyoti, along with three other like-minded women of her locality, formed a group. They wish to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation.

Jyoti’s husband has been running a hotel for the last eight years. At present, the monthly household income is 8,000 INR. As the children are reading, the monthly income hardly meets the monthly expenses. For increasing income, Jyoti’s husband wants to change the interior decoration of the hotel. With the loan, they will purchase some modern furniture and utensils. From the loan, Jyoti wants to fulfill the desire of her husband.

The other three members of the group are doing vegetable vending, a tiffin stall, and a Xerox shop. The loan will definitely change the income level of the members.

loans.use: to purchase some modern furniture and utensils.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es: El arte culinario permitió que Richard un emprendedor hombre de 34 años se convirtiera en propietario de un restaurante, ubicado en un sector muy concurrido de Barranquilla, en la zona metropolitana con cercanía a Soledad un municipio de su periferia.  Durante años laboró como auxiliar de cocina en distintos restaurantes de la ciudad en donde adquirió toda la destreza necesaria para preparar alimentos, sin embargo su forma creativa y su toque personal, solamente lo pudo expresar en su restaurante en donde sus platos son una mezcla de cultura y tradición.  Richard es un hombre muy organizado y maneja en su negocio condiciones de seguridad e higiene, para evitar posibles problemas de salud y mantener su calidad nutricional, diariamente apertura su negocio a las 6 a.m. y cierra a las 4 p.m., un horario adecuado para que sus comensales puedan degustar de desayunos y almuerzos corrientes.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar un enfriador e insumos necesarios para su negocio, con esta inversión pretende mejorar las condiciones de conservación de los alimentos.  Su meta a futuro es adquirir su propio local con todo el equipo necesario para ser un restaurante reconocido en Barranquilla.  Su meta personal es continuar apoyando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Richard, an entrepreneurial 34-year-old, became a restaurant owner thanks to his liking of the culinary art. His restaurant is located in a busy area of Barranquilla, near the municipality of Soledad. He worked as a kitchen assistant for many years in different restaurants, where he acquired the necessary skills to prepare food. He could, however, only express his creativity and his personal touch in his own restaurant -- his dishes are a mixture of cultures and traditions. 

Richard is a well organized man and he makes sure that everything is in order regarding hygiene and safety, with the goal of avoiding possible health problems and maintaining a high quality in his establishment. He opens his business daily at 6:00 a.m. and closes at 4:00 p.m., which is an adequate schedule for his customers to taste his breakfasts and lunches. 

He is applying for a Kiva loan, his first one through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to purchase a cooler and supplies needed for his business. With this investment, he intends to improve the conservation of his food. His future goal is to purchase his own property and all the necessary equipment to have a renowned restaurant in Barranquilla. His personal goal is to continue supporting his parents.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler and supplies needed for his business.

loans.name: Sabera

texts.en: Sabera is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells beans, maize, and other cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a big cereals store. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Raheema

texts.en:
Raheema is a 40-year-old lady, who is a very poor and needy woman. Her husband provides sheltering services to earn money to feed her entire family. He has been doing this business for many years and has been using wooden planks and bamboo, which has been depreciated time to time. Now her husband is unable to continue his business without wooden boards and bamboo.

Therefore, Raheema requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new wooden, smooth boards and bamboo to continue his business again. She hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her life and her husband will earn maximum profits with the help of this loan. Raheema is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan, because they empower her husband to buy new sheltering materials.

loans.use: to buy sheltering materials such as wooden boards, bamboo, etc. for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase work tools.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 48 years old and married. He has his own house, and he is the father of two kids that are going to school. Ruben and his wife make jackets. They need a loan to buy more materials to make more jackets. Ruben and his wife work with leather.

Ruben and his wife have 2 children they love very much. Ruben hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy more materials to make more jackets.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru:
44 летняя  Дилором проживает  в Чилике. У нее прекрасная семья: любимый муж и трое замечательных  детей в возрасте 15, 12 и 9 лет. Ее муж занимается мастером по ремонту домов в Российской Федерации. Сама Дилором  обладает мастерством кройки и шитья. Уже на протяжении много лет она занимается пошивом женских платьев национального стиля. 
Дилором любить свою деятельность и хорошо справляется с ней. По ее словам ей удобно шить на дому, так как она дополнительно может делать работу по домашнему хозяйству и присматривать за детьми. Ей в этой работе нравится ежедневный доход, а так же она обожает шить и кроить. 
Дилором просит кредит для купли новую швейную машинку модели «YAMATA», чтобы улучшить и расширить деятельность. Она ждет Вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Dilorom is 44 and lives in Jilikul.  She has a beautiful family: a beloved husband and three great kids who are now 15, 12 and 9.  Her husband makes a living repairing and renovating houses in Russia.  Dilorom herself has become quite skilled at designing and sewing clothes.  She has been sewing women's traditional dresses for many years already.

Dilorom loves her work and copes very well with all aspects of her activity.  She finds it convenient to work from home because it allows her to take care of her children and to do the household chores at the same time.  She not only loves designing and sewing clothes but also enjoys the daily income that she makes.

Dilorom is taking a loan to buy a new YAMATA sewing machine.  This will help her to improve and expand her activity.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new YAMATA sewing machine.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en: Edita is a farmer from Bonga, Maria, Siquijor. She cultivates her own farmland and engages in a rice production business. To head up for the next cropping season, she asks from the cooperative an amount to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Kadriye

texts.en:
Kadriye is married and a mother of four.  When her husband's income was not enough she opened a small cafe.  She has been doing this for two years.  At first she only sold beverages but in time she started selling toasts and meatballs and expanded her business.  With the help of the loan from Maya she renewed her grill.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Kadriye Hanım evli ve 4 çocuk annesi.  Eşinin geliri çocuklarının okul masraflarına ve ev bütçesine yetişmemeye başlayınca küçük bir cafe açmış.  2 yıldır cafe işletmeciliği yapan Kadriye hanım önceleri sadece içecek servisi yaparken ilerleyen zamanlarda tost, köfte gibi gıda satışına da başlayarak işini geliştirmiş.  Maya dan aldığı kredi ile ızgarasını yeniledi.

loans.use: to buy a grill for her cafe.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is the age of 40 and a mother of two children, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a taking loan for her husband’s business; his practice is the sale and purchase of vehicle tyres. Her husband has grown old and is energetic no more. Through this business he generates income for his family.

He wants to buy more vehicle tyres to grow his business but he does not have a sufficient amount to buy more tyres. Therefore, Khalida contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and presented her humble request for taking a loan.

Khalida seems very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and hopes that the lenders will take an active part to support her.

loans.use: to buy vehicle tyres for resale.

loans.name: Onua Do 2 Group

texts.en:
There are 4 hardworking women in Onua Do 2 Group, who live in Teshie, Accra, the capital city of the country. However, they are considered to be urban poor people.

The ladies have various small businesses, including the sale of charcoal, dried fish, maize, gari (cassava flour), and sugar. These women make up a very unique and special group because they have very good experience in their various businesses. They are determined to create a more prosperous future for themselves and their families.

Abigail, a member of this group, has a business selling charcoal and dried fish (koobi). She is requesting a loan to buy more dried fish and sacks of charcoal which she will sell to her customers. This type of business is good year-round and very lucrative too.

Abigail shares that she really likes to participate in the group's activities as the ladies are committed, responsible, and motivated to improve their lives. She enjoys participating in the educational training held at each bi-weekly meeting. Some of the subjects covered include costing, business development, health, hygiene, and nutrition, as well as human rights.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and sacks of charcoal which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mburica Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mburica Poty, está integrado  por  mujeres  de la misma comunidad, están trabajando para superar la línea de pobreza, por medio del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que les permitirá poder capacitarse y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Eva quien con su encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza quiere poder crecer y seguir ayudando a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas que lo hace de manera ambulante. Tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella, es por eso que le está yendo muy bien y con lo que tiene de las ventas ayuda a sus seres queridos.
La Señora Eva pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser camisas, jeans, remeras, pantalones, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo hace hasta ahora.
texts.en:
The group called Mburica Poty is formed by women of the same community. They are working to get beyond the poverty line through the program for eliminating poverty, which will allow them to be trained and advance.

One of the members is Señora Eva, who with her survey for eliminating poverty wants to be able to grow and continue helping her family. She sells articles of clothing, which she does as a street vendor. She has a good customer base that always buys from her. It is for this reason that it is going very well for her, and with what she has from the sales, she helps her loved ones.

Señora Eva is requesting this loan to be able to buy various articles of clothing to sell, such as shirts, jeans, t-shirts, pants, and other items, so that she can continue with her sales as she has been doing up to now.

loans.use: to buy items of clothing to sell, such as shirts, jeans, t-shirts, pants, and other items.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
La Esperanza  lleva por nombre este grupo, ya que sus integrantes se unieron con la fe de poder crecer y mejorar e ir superando su situación de pobreza, están en el 5º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, trabajando y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mercedes ella  es cliente de la Fundación hace mucho tiempo, se desempeña como tesorera del comité y se dedica a la venta de ropas, es una mujer muy sacrificada que siempre tiene mucho optimismo y ganas de poder superarse y crecer en el pequeño emprendimiento que tiene.
Mercedes pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de más prendas para la venta, y de esa forma poder tener una mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando en su emprendimiento.
texts.en: La Esperanza (Hope) Group is the name of this group, because its members got together with faith to keep on growing and improving, and to keep overcoming their poverty situation. They are in the fifth cycle of the program of the Women's Committee, working and helping each other to progress. One of its members is Mercedes. She has been a Foundation's client for a long time, works as the Committee's treasurer, and her business is selling clothes. She is a very self sacrificing woman who always has much optimism and wishes to prosper and grow in her little enterprise. Mercedes is requesting this loan to invest in buying more clothing items to sell, and in this way to have more variety to offer her customers. She is grateful for the given opportunity to keep on growing and improving in her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy diverse clothing items for sale.

loans.name: Aquilino

texts.en:
Aquilino owns ten cows and lives from selling their milk on a daily basis. He was very enthusiastic about the opportunity to transform their manure into two precious resources: organic fertilizer and biogas! This will not only allow him to save money by displacing LP gas, wood and chemical fertilizers, but also treat the raw waste he used to pile up in his farm, thereby eliminating the bad smells, flies and potential sources of infection.

Investing in a biodigester will allow Aquilino to turn his farm into a clean, sustainable and cost-effective place to live and work. As he starts cooking and heating water with biogas, his family will not be exposed to the toxic smoke generated by burning wood anymore. Further, he plans to use his savings to improve his animals' corrals, and build a roof on top of them.

This loan represents 50% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to purchase a 10 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes knew she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business. Agnes has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner.

Recently, she requested a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her business. Agnes wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Jose Aivan

texts.en:
Jose Aivan is from Upper Cangomantong, Lazi, Siquijor. He is 30 years of age. From his desire to help the family, he engaged in selling fish in different barangays in the municipality of Lazi, Siquijor. Only his motorcycle was used as his source of transportation to reached the different barangays and sell fish. His source of income has existed for 4 years now.

In need of additional working capital, he requested financial assistance in the amount of Php 11,000 from Paglaum MPC to purchase more stocks of fish. Through this, he hopes to increase and/or have more income so he is able to provide for the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of fish for selling

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring, and harvesting, as well as earning income. She has supported her husband doing this type of work.

As a farmer, Victoria has nurtured her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs.

Recently, Victoria applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

Someday, Victoria hopes to purchase another rice plot to cultivate which will potentially add to her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds which will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally is 42 years old. She is a widow and a resident of Sabang, Larena, Siquijor, Philippines. She has been in this business for many years already.

Since Sally wants to be more productive, she has now decided to enter into business herself, purchasing fish in bulk to resell at market. She says that she also enjoys the Cooperative's add-on benefits like insurance and savings.

Sally has now applied for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy her fish to resell. She is hoping that with Paglaum’s help, and with the patience & diligence of her husband, she can look forward to being a successful vendor someday and to owning a stall in the public market.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina operates a motorcycle transport business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 PHP in sales every day.

For Josefina to continue her business, she has taken a loan to pay for both motorcycle spare parts and its repair.

Josefina dreams of owning more motorcycle units and being able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle spare parts and its repair.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 37 years old, married, and lives at Cangmalalag, Larena, Siquijor, Philippines. In order to earn a living she takes in and raises pigs from their neighborhood. The piglets' owners share in the profit upon sale, to be divided 60/40 or 70/30 depending in their agreement. With a desire to earn more, she decided to raise pigs on her own as well.

Through Paglaum PC she obtained the capital to purchase her original piglets & feed. Now, she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional feed. She really hopes & prays that her business would grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional bags of feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of sugar and corn.

loans.name: Andy

texts.en:
Andy is very conscious about how contaminating his sheep's manure is for his environment, and has spent a lot of time looking for a solution. Investing in a Sistema Biobolsa biodigester is the perfect option for him, as the system will not only treat his animals' manure, thereby eliminating any negative effect on the environment, but also produce renewable energy (biogas) for his home and farm, as well as organic fertilizer for his field. He will therefore reduce his farm's greenhouse gas emissions, protect underground water sources, and save money by displacing LP gas, wood and chemical fertilizer.

His wife and children will no longer be exposed to the toxic smoke produced by burning wood in the kitchen, since they will cook and heat water with biogas. Selling his sheep will become more profitable as he operates at a lower cost, he will be able to save money and buy additional sheep to expand his sheep raising activity.

This loan represents 50% of the full cost of the biodigester. The remaining part is being covered by a government subsidy and a downpayment from the client.

loans.use: to purchase a 12 m3 Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a 39-year-old woman, who has lived with her boyfriend for a long time. With him she has two teenage children, the boy who is the older one, is now heading to the college, and the girl who is younger, is now at the high school.

Carolina contributes to the house income by making tortillas at a grill. These are no common tortillas, because she boils the corn on her own, then she grinds it, and she kneads it. This way the tortilla dough is cleaner and tastier. After this process she makes a little ball of dough that she places on the grill. She sells these tortillas and she may sell quesadillas done with the same tortillas. She names her business "Tortillas el molinito" ("tortillas the little mill" in english). She enjoys working because that way she may help her children with their daily expenses. She also likes her job because of the independent life this provides for her.

She is thinking about making improvements to her house, which isn’t done. It still needs to be painted, and there are some windows that are missing glass. She wants to make her place a little more comfortable for herself and her family. To address this, she is asking for a 9,500 MXN loan. She is going to use this loan to fix her house, but she claims that if there is something left after the improvements, she will invest it on her business. She may buy corn and other rough materials to meet client demands.

loans.use: to improve her house.

loans.name: Palma Dorada Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 27 años de edad, vie con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es dedicada, emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en su domicilio ubicado al sur de la ciudad, dentro del área peri urbana donde en los últimos años ha tenido un importante crecimiento poblacional principalmente por la llegada de migrantes del interior del país. De clima cálido subtropical, con una temperatura que ronda entre los 21-35 grados centígrados.
 Maria es de piel morena, baja estatura y físico robusto. Su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (sentada al centro, viste blusa azul y calza blanca). Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja en el comercio, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su deseo de superación la llevo a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; carpintería, lavandería, venta de empanadas, venta de ropa de segunda mano, artesanía en cuero, venta de comida y venta de carne de pollo. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como la ‘patasca’ hecha a base de granos de maíz y cabeza de cerdo, es muy popular desde la época de los Incas, “esta comida tiene la supuesta cualidad de curar resacas para seguir la fiesta…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de carne e insumos de cocina como, aceite, arroz, yuca, fideo, etc. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta de comidas tradicionales en su domicilio, ella desea realizar la compra de carne e insumos de cocina para mejorar la atención a sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de carne e insumos de cocina para mejorar la atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is a 27-year-old woman, who lives with her partner, without children, and her business is the sale of traditional food.

She is dedicated, enterprising, and very hard-working. Her business is in her home, located to the south of the city, in a peri-urban area where in recent years there has been a significant growth in the population, primarily due to the arrival of migrants from the interior of the country. It has a warm subtropical climate, with a temperature that is around 21-35 degrees centigrade.

Maria has dark skin, is short and has a robust physique. Her native language is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish (she is seated in the middle, wearing a blue shirt and white pants). She has her life with her partner who works in trade. They live in a rented room built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting and a cement floor which has all of the basic services. Her desire to improve herself brought her to form a bank of people with businesses such as carpentry, laundry, selling empanadas, selling second-hand clothing, leather crafts, selling food and selling chicken meat. Her business is the sale of traditional food such as "patasca" made with a base of corn grains and pig's head, it has been very popular since the time of the Incas. "This food has the supposed quality of curing hangovers to continue partying..." she says. The advantage of her business is that it has daily sales, the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase the meat and cooking supplies such as oil, rice, yucca, noodles, etc. Her dream is to have a sales stand of traditional food in her home. She wants to make the purchase of meat and cooking supplies to improve her customer service. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years that she has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Maria is asking for a loan to purchase meat and cooking supplies to improve her customer service.

loans.use: to purchase meat and cooking supplies to improve her customer service.

loans.name: Pacincia

texts.en:
Pacincia landed at a right place for her needed capital when she joined PMPC. She knew this would be her last chance to get back on her feet when she went broke after her first business went bad. PMPC came to Paincia as a rescue to lend her money when she needed it the most.

Now, she has requested another loan for the next cropping season. She was loaned an amount for land and seedbed preparation. Pacincia perseveres and always believe she will be able to reach her goals to continuously provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation.

loans.name: Las Gaviotas Group

texts.es:
Es usual que se formen costumbres y leyendas en torno a lugares emblemáticos de ciertas comunidades. Es el caso de una laguna en el estado de Oaxaca en donde los pescadores realizan una pequeña peregrinación dentro de sus aguas transportando a la virgen de Guadalupe ya que, según la tradición, ella es quien los provee de pescado todo el año.  
   En dicha comunidad se integró un grupo llamado Las Gaviotas cuyo nombre hace referencia al vuelo que realizan estas aves sobre la laguna; las integrantes del grupo son: Guadalupe y Clara quienes venden pescado; Blandina y Ángela, abarrotes; Mauricia, pollo y Lidia, cosméticos. 
   Doña Guadalupe y su esposo José sienten un especial cariño por la laguna ya que gracias a ella han podido llevar a cabo su actividad económica: la pesca. De pequeños sus hijos se entusiasmaban cuando partían con su padre a bordo de una balsa hasta el centro del agua y después se llenaban de alegría cuando veían a los peces moverse dentro de las redes. Para poder vender el producto es necesario que se limpie de lo cual se encarga Doña Lupe, como es mejor conocida. Posteriormente forma paquetes para su fácil manejo, “durante tanto tiempo mi familia se ha dedicado a pescar y vender mojarra que ya sé lo que pesan” comenta con una sonrisa.
   El tipo de pez que habita en la región es llamado mojarra, “vender mojarra me gusta pues tengo trato con muchas personas, he conocido distintos lugares y me da gusto que mis hijos se involucren en nuestra actividad”  menciona Lupe. Para ella VF México ha sido una gran motivación, no sólo por los préstamos sino por las recompensas que recibe, por ejemplo, el aparecer en el calendario de la institución y el ser visitada por personal extranjero a quienes muestra la riqueza de su comunidad. El préstamo le será de utilidad a Doña Lupe para comprar; tendales, más pescado y una nevera.
   Las ganancias les han dado la oportunidad de dar educación a sus hijos, remodelar su casa y construir dos locales en donde planea abrir una papelería y un negocio de comida. 
*Ellas son las integrantes del grupo Las Gaviotas, la fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de Doña Ángela.
texts.en:
It is normal for legends and traditions to form around iconic places in certain communities. Such is the case of a lake in the state of Oaxaca, where the fishermen make a small pilgrimage in its waters while traveling to the Virgin of Guadalupe who, according to tradition, is the one who provides the fish throughout the year.

In this community, there formed a group called "Las Gaviotas" [Seagulls] whose name is a reference to the flight that these birds make over the lake. The members are: Guadalupe and Clara who sell fish; Blandina and Ángela, groceries; Mauricia, chicken; and Lidia, cosmetics.

Doña Guadalupe and her husband José feel a special affection for the water because thanks to it they have been able to carry out their job: fishing. Since they were little, their children were enthusiastic when they left with their father on board the raft for the center of the water and afterwards they were filled with joy when they saw the fish move inside the nets.

In order to sell the product it needs to be clean, which Doña Lupe is in charge of as she is better known. Afterwards she makes packages for easy handling. "For a long time my family has made a living by fishing and selling "mojarra" [a type of fish, often the same as tilapia] since I already know what they weigh," she says with a smile.

The type of fish that lives in the region is called mojarra, "I like selling mojarra because I have to deal with many people, I am known in many places, and I am glad that my children are involved in our work," says Lupe. For her, VF Mexico has been a great motivation, not only because of the loans but also the rewards that she receives; for example, her appearance in the institution's calendar and being visited by foreign staff to whom she shows the richness of the community. The loan will be used by Doña Lupe to buy awnings, more fish, and a refrigerator.

The profits have given her the opportunity to educate her children, remodel her house, and build two places where she plans to open a stationery shop and a food business.

*These are the members of the Las Gaviotas group. The photo was taken at Doña Ángela's shop.

loans.use: to buy awnings, "mojarra" [fish], and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Cesaria

texts.en:
Cesaria is a farmer who earns her living through her farming activities such as growing vegetables and spices. She is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance.

Recently, Cesaria applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to renovating her house. She wishes to be able to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks.

loans.name: Abdimamat

texts.ru: Абдимамат, 53 года, женат, отец 5 детей. Уже 35 лет Абдимамат занимается животноводством. Он очень трудолюбив и ответственнен, на сегодняшний день смог развить свою деятельность до 6 коров. Деятельность приносит прибыль в размере 30,000 сом (KGS). Абдимамат обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита он направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и покупку земельного участка для постройки дома.
texts.en: Abdimamat is 53 years old, married, and the father of five children.  He makes a living raising cattle and has been involved in this activity for 35 years already.  He is very hardworking, responsible, and has been able to increase his cattle headcount to a total of six cows.  He makes approximately 30,000 som (KGS) from his activity.  He has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS).  He will use his loan to buy a few cows and increase his cattle headcount.  He is planning to use the earnings from his loan to further develop his business and to buy a plot of land to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase a few cows in order to increase his livestock headcount.

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Zunilda es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa,  cuenta con un comedor dentro de una empresa, desde hace 4 años que trabaja en esto. Su marido también trabaja y de esa forma ambos se ayudan para poder mantener el hogar, son un matrimonio muy trabajador y luchador.
La Sra. Zunilda comenta que tiene muchas personas que van a su comedor ya que ella siempre hace comidas muy ricas, y por eso le va muy bien.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder usar en su comedor, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su humilde trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sra. Zunilda is from the city of Villa Elisa. She has been working at a company cafeteria for 4 years for a living . Her husband also has a job, and both of them help maintain the living costs. It is a marriage that is very hard-working and persevering.

Sra. Zunilda comments that many customers come to her cafeteria, since she always makes very delicious meals. For this her business is doing well. 

She is requesting this loan in order to buy ingredients to use at her cafeteria, such as vegetables, meat, condiments, baked goods, and others. In this way, she will be able to continue with her humble job.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, meat, condiments, baked goods, and others

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Jessica, who is married with an only child, resides in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. While her husband is working as a private employee, she manages their farm to make a living. She also grows and harvests mango on her farm. Recently, she joined GDMPC and is borrowing 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. 

She knows very well that with this investment, she will earn multiple returns. She plans to use her income to buy another farm and to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida  is 49 years old and is a married woman.  In order to meet her household expenses she started her business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45000  to purchase more animals such as baby goats to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals such as baby goats to increase her sales

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer de 32 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos de 1, 3, 10, 12 y 17 años, y su negocio es la panadería.
Ella es buena madre, amable y de muy buena actitud. Su negocio lo realiza ambulantemente en el barrio ‘plan 3000’ zona donde se refugiaron los sobrevivientes del desborde del rio en años anteriores. 
Teresa es de mediana estatura, físico robusto y ojos obscuros. Su lengua materna es el Guarani y habla español. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su pareja que trabaja en el mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de masitas tradicionales como; cuñapés, estos son a base de almidón de yuca con queso son muy populares a toda hora, “vendo todo tipo de horneados tradicionales, son muy populares a la hora del té…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de un horno industrial y diferentes tipos de harina. Su sueño es tener una panadería grande, ella desea comprar un horno industrial y diferentes tipos de harina para hornear. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Teresa solicita un préstamo para comprar un horno industrial y diferentes tipos de harina para hornear masitas tradicionales.
texts.en:
Teresa is 32 years old, lives with her partner, and has five children aged 1, 3, 10, 12, and 17. Her business is a bakery. She is a very good mother. She's very friendly and has a good attitude. She conducts her business as an ambulant vendor in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood where many survivors took refuge after a flood in previous years.

Teresa is of medium height, robust physique, and has dark eyes. Her native language is Guarani and she also speaks Spanish. She lives her life with her partner who works in the same business and their children who are attending school. She lives in a house owned by her family. It is built of bricks and has basic utilities.

Her business is selling traditional pastries such as cuñapés, which are made with cassava starch and cheese. They are always popular. "I sell all kinds of traditional baked goods, which are very popular at tea time," she says. The advantage of her business is that sales are daily. The disadvantage is her lack of capital to purchase an industrial oven and different types of flour. Her dream is to have a large bakery. She wants to buy an industrial oven and different types of flour for baking. This is her first loan and she has one year of experience in this business. Teresa is applying for a loan to buy an industrial oven and different types of flour to bake traditional pastries.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven and different types of flour to bake traditional pastries.

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es:
Leandro es un hombre de 59 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo de 22 años, y su negocio es la fabricación de canaletas.
Él es emprendedor, independiente y muy dedicado. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘16 de julio’ caracterizado por su feria donde se comercializa desde un lápiz usado hasta tractores y camiones.
Leandro es moreno de baja estatura y cabello corto. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica el mismo negocio y con su hijo que trabaja como albañil, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la fabricación de canaletas que son conductos que se utilizan como desagües para conducir el agua de la lluvia del techo al suelo, “aprendí el oficio cuando era joven, luego me compré la máquina dobladora y me independicé…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la poca competencia, la desventaja es la época de verano no hay trabajo. Su sueño es abrir una tienda den su casa para vender por mayor, él desea realizar la compra de planchas metálicas para fabricar canaletas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la intuición en 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Leandro solicita un préstamo para la compra de planchas de metal para fabricar canaletas.
texts.en:
Leandro is a man of 59. He is married and has a 22-year-old son. His business is making gutters.

He is entrepreneurial, independent, and very dedicated. His business is located in the "Sixteenth of July" zone, which is characterized by its fair, where they sell everything from a pencil to tractors and trucks.

Leandro is dark, of short stature, with short hair. He shares his life with his wife, who works in the same business, and with his son, who works as a mason. They live in their own house made of adobe, which has all the basic services. His business is making gutters, which are channels that are used for drainage to lead rainwater from the roof to the ground. "I learned this work when I was young, then I purchased the folding machine and I became independent," he comments. The advantage of his business is that there is little competition. The problem is that in the summer season there is no work. 

His dream is to open a store in his house to sell wholesale.

He wants to make the purchase of metal sheets for making gutters. This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the 20 years that he has been doing this work. 

It is for these reasons that Leandro is applying for a loan for the purchase of metal sheets for making gutters.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets to make gutters

loans.name: Casimera

texts.en: Casimera is supervising the renovation of their home. Casimera hopes to live comfortably with a  good roof, which will be supported by her loan of Php 50,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters that Casimera has been given priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. She is thankful that all her financing needs for her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: pay for the renovation of her house.

loans.name: Nurzhamal

texts.ru: Нуржамал, 36 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее большой трудовой стаж, работает учителем в школе. Также в качестве дополнительного источника доходов для семьи, она занимается животноводством, начав бизнес в 2005 году. Супруг и дети активно помогают по хозяйству. На сегодня в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 4 лошади. Также занимается торговлей продуктами питания в магазине около дома, в обороте есть товар на сумму 60,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нуржамал обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы с теленком для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Нуржамал планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nurzhamal is 36, married, and the mother of two children.  She has an impressive work experience and currently works as a school teacher.  In order to provide an additional source of income for her family, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 2005.  Her husband and children actively help her with the farm work.  She currently has two cows and four horses on her farm.  Nurzhamal also sells food products in a store located near her house.  She currently has 60,000 som (KGS) worth of merchandise.

Eager to further develop her business, Nurzhamal has turned to Kiva's Field Partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow with her calf, for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business.

loans.use: to buy one cow with her calf for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo formado en la ciudad de Luque, la fundación paraguaya por medio de sus capacitaciones las orienta para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y los emprendimientos que cada una hace.
Lourdes es una de las que integra este grupo, quien se dedica a la peluquería, comenta que constantemente tiene que ir surtiendo su negocio para poder cumplir con la demanda y las exigencias de su clientela. Queriendo mejorar es que pide este préstamo, para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para su peluquería, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues, alicates y otros, y asi seguir con su buen servicio como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Seventeen woman make up this group which was formed in the city of Luque. La Fundación Paraguaya through their training orientate them to be able to improve their living conditions and the undertaking each of them has.

Lourdes is one member of the group and she works hairdressing. She comments that she constantly has to stock her business to fulfill the demand and requirements of her clients. She is requesting this loan as she wants to improve. She will invest in the purchase of supplies for her beauty salon such as dye, cream, shampoo, rinse, pincers and others. Then she can go on providing good service as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon such as dye, cream, shampoo, rinse, pincers and others.

loans.name: Mehrangez

texts.ru: Жительнице района Кумсангир 22 год ее зовут Мехрангез. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж Мехрангез работает в армии страны. Мехрангез любит животных, и поэтому она занимается животноводством. Мехрангез занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота более 2 года. Она покупает молодых телят и откармливает их в течение определенного времени и перепродает их на скотном рынке. Мехрангез быстро учиться и за столь короткое время она освоила свою работу на отлично. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтоб расширить свою деятельность. Мехрангез считает, что набралась опыта и пора продвигать бизнес на новый уровень. Мехрангез за счет денег купить несколько молодых телят. Этот кредит поможет ей достичь своей целей и улучшить условий жизни ее семьи.
texts.en:
Mehrangez is 22 years old and lives in the Quamsangir area. She is married and has three children. Her husband is in the national army. Mehrangez loves animals, which is why she raises livestock. She has been raising cattle for over two years. She buys young calves, feeds them for a while and later resells them at the animal market. Mehrangez picks up things quickly, and has been able to master this business perfectly in a short time. 

She is applying for a loan in order to expand her business. Mehrangez believes that she now has enough experience to take her business to a new level. She plans to use her loan to buy several calves. This loan will allow her to achieve her goals and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to expand her livestock business and buy calves.

loans.name: Tania Liliana

texts.es:
Tania vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, una ciudad muy comercial. Vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos; a pesar de su corta edad de 21 años, ellos son jóvenes muy responsables en su negocio y en sus créditos, ya son cliente s fidelizados con la institución.
Tania es una señora muy trabajadora, se dedica al comercio de ropa, la misma que la vende de manera ambulante recorriendo a clientes fijos que entrega al por mayor; mientras que su esposo trabaja como pintor. Juntos ha podido progresar y salir adelante, incluso con los créditos que le ha otorgado Fundación Alternativa y Kiva  han podido fortalecer su negocio y con las ganancias han podido construir su casa en terreno de familiares, están muy felices porque se ha visto la mejora que han tenido.
Ahora con este crédito Tania seguirá invirtiendo en ropa, comprará más mercadería para seguir fortaleciendo y creciendo como microempresarios. Están agradecidos por que gracias al apoyo de KIVA  se han convertido en mejores microempresarios.
texts.en:
Tania lives in the city of Santo Domingo, a very commercial city. She lives with her husband and their two children. Despite her young age of 21 years old, they are very responsible youth with their business and loans. They are already trusted clients of the institution. 

Tania is a very hard working woman. She works selling clothing. She sells this as a traveling street vendor to return customers who order wholesale. Meanwhile, her husband works as a painter. Together, they have been able to progress and get ahead. Along with the loans which Fundación Alternativa and Kiva have granted them, they have been able to strengthen her business. With the profits, they have been able to build their home on the land of a relative. They are very happy because they have seen the improvement they have had. 

With this loan, Tania will continue investing in clothing. She will buy more merchandise to continue building and growing as a small business entrepreneur. They are gracious because thanks to Kiva's support, they have become better small business entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the school year in order to continue building and growing as a small business entrepreneur.

loans.name: Martha Alexandra

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos estudian en escuela  fiscal. Su esposo Luis es albañil, el tiene 32 años. Desde que Martha tenía 15 años trabaja vendiendo granos y frutas ambulantemente. Vive en casa propia que la obtuvo con la ayuda del gobierno y el Ministerio de desarrollo urbano y vivienda (MIDUVI). 
Actualmente Martha se dedica al comercio de granos, moras y frutillas en el mercado, esta actividad la realiza de Lunes a sábado, el negocio lo aprendió de su madre. Adicional a su actividad principal también se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y tiene un ingreso extra. 
Vive en la comunidad de la Esperanza sector Cruz Loma que pertenece a la parroquia de San Roque, en el sector las personas se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura.
Solicita un crédito para invertir en la compra de granos y productos que ella vende, y de esta forma tener mayores ingresos para poder ofrecer a sus hijos una buena educación. Agradece a Kiva por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Martha is a very hard-working woman of 27 years old. She is married with four children, all of whom are studying in public schools. Her husband Luis, 32 years old, is a construction worker. 

Martha has been selling grains and fruits as a travelling merchant since when she was 15 years old. She lives in her own house which she obtained with the help of the government and the Ministry of Urban Development and Housing (MIDUVI). Currently, Martha sells grains, blackberries, and strawberries in the market from Monday to Saturday. She has learned this business from her mother. In addition to this activity, she also works in pig breeding for extra income. 

She lives in the community of La Esperanza in the Cruz Loma sector, parish of San Roque, an area where people work in animal breeding and agriculture. 

Martha is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of grains and other products that she sells. This way, she can have bigger income to offer a better education for her children. She is grateful to Kiva for the given support.

loans.use: to buy grains, blackberries, and strawberries to obtain a better income and to offer a better education for her children

loans.name: Barnohon

texts.ru: Барнохон, 39 лет, в разводе, мать 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает учителем младших классов в школе, также занимается животноводством. По хозяйству активно помогает вся семья.
