В хозяйстве Барнохон есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. В целях увеличения поголовья скота, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Развитие бизнеса позволит Барнохон увеличить доходы ее семьи. Доходы от кредита Барнохон направит на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и воспитание детей.
texts.en: Barnohon is 39 years old, divorced, and the mother of three. She has a college degree and works as an elementary school teacher. She also raises livestock. Her family actively helps her with the farm work. Barnohon has two cows and 10 sheep. In order to increase her livestock headcount, she has applied to Bai Tushum for a loan in the amount of 150,000 soms (KGS) to buy cattle. Developing her business will allow Barnohon to increase her family income. She will use the revenues from her loan to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her family income.

loans.name: Miyansar

texts.ru: Миянсар 52-летняя жительница района Кумсангир. В Кумсангир имеет хорошие погодные условия для ведения сельского хозяйства. Миянсар проживает здесь давно. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Ее муж работает в коммунальном хозяйстве села. Старший сын занимается парикмахером. Младший сын на земле занимается земледелием. Миянсар сама занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота в течение 6 лет. Она покупает молодых телят, откармливают их несколько месяцев, и потом вывозит на продажу. Ей в этом помогают ее сыновья. Целью данного кредита является развитие животноводческой деятельности. Миянсар планирует увеличить поголовье скота и тем самым улучшить условия жизни семьи. Она надеется на Вашу помощь. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас!
texts.en:
Miyansar is 52 years old and lives in the Qumsangir region. This region has a good climate for agriculture. Miyansar has been living here for a long time. She is married and has three children. Her husband works for the communal services of her village. Her eldest son is a hairdresser. The youngest son has a land lot and grows crops. 

Miyansar has been raising cattle for six years. She buys young calves, fattens them for some months, and then transports them to be sold. Her sons help her in this business. The purpose of this loan is developing her livestock business. Miyansar plans to increase her livestock headcount and thus improve her family's quality of life. She hopes for your help. You can support her right now!

loans.use: to increase her livestock headcount by buying cattle.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña pora está en su ciclo número 1º  del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo nuevo que está esforzándose para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes que se destaca por su entusiasmo y lucha es la Sra. Irma, una mujer muy trabajadora que se dedica a las confecciones, ella es modista, es una muy buena modista, y hace todo tipo de confecciones en lo cual le va muy bien y con la cual ya se formó muy buena clientela.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, agujas, y otros, y con ello poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Está contenta por formar parte de este grupo, ya que podrá mejorar su emprendimiento y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Kuña Pora is in it's first cycle of the women's committee programs. It is a new group which is making an effort in order to be able to improve their life conditions through the elimination of poverty program.

One of the members who stands out for her enthusiasm and struggling is Irma, a very hard-working woman who makes a living from sewing. She is a dressmaker, a very good dressmaker, and she does all sorts of sewing with which goes very well for her and through which she has acquired a very good clientele.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy cloth, thread, elastic bands, needles, and other things, and with these she will be able to comply with the requests of her customers. She is happy to be a part of this group since she will be able to improve her entrepreneurship and continue to help her family.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, elastic bands, needles, and other things.

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Group

texts.en:
A women's group of six members called Maa Laxmi is located at Kumutipentha village in the Rayagada district of Odisha, India. Kumari is one of the members of this group. The lady standing third from right with her hand raised is Kumari. She is a very active young lady who is 32 years of age. She lives with her husband, one daughter and one son.

Kumari’s husband has been running a motor garage in the nearby market for the last eight years. The family's income is about 8,500 INR per month. On other hand, the monthly expenses of Kumari are also the same, and as a result, savings or reinvestment in the business is almost nil. Kumari wants to expand the business of her husband by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Her husband will use the present loan to buy tubes, tyres, lubricant oil, spare parts and tools to repair vehicles. Kumari’s husband expects a good return from the business by expanding it. Kumari also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work.

The other five members of this group are also involved in businesses like tailoring, a tea and tiffin stall, a grocery shop and milk businesses.

loans.use: to buy tubes, tyres, lubricant oil, spare parts and tools to repair vehicles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing garments for sale such as: shirts, pans, T-shirts, jeans, skirts, blouses, and others.

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es:
Nila es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 5 meses, 2 y 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de empanadas.
Ella es buena madre, decidida y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ caracterizada por su artesanía en cerámica y cuero. 
Nila es morena de cabello largo y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (sentada al centro, viste polera rosa). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la plomería y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran ene dad escolar, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta sólo con energía eléctrica. Su deseos de superación la llevaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de frutas, artesanía en cerámica, artesanía en cuero, venta de comida, llantería, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de verduras y lavandería, para solicitar un crédito y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de empanadas, las empanadas son masas rellenas con carne de res, pollo y verduras, son muy populares y comen a todas horas, “preparo la comida en mi casa y junto a mis hijos salgo a vender a la calle…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede cuidar a sus hijos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de insumos de cocina como; aceite, carne y otros. Su sueño es abrir un puesto de venta en el mercado, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina para preparar empanadas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nila solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos de cocina para preparar empanadas.
texts.en:
Nila is a woman of 34. She lives with her partner, and she has three children, ages 5 months, 2, and 4. Her business is selling empanadas. She is a good mother, determined and very hard-working. Her business is located in the "Cotoca" area, which is characterized by its handicrafts in ceramics and leather.

Nila is dark, with long hair and a thin physique (she is seated in the center, wearing a pink top). Her native language is Guaraní, and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her partner, who works in plumbing, and with her children, who are not yet of school age. They live in their own room made of wood with a tile roof and a dirt floor, which has only electrical service. Her desire to achieve led her to form a bank with people having businesses such as selling fruit, ceramic handicrafts, leather handicrafts, selling food, tire shop, selling secondhand clothing, selling vegetables, and a laundry in order to apply for a loan and improve their businesses. Her business is selling empanadas. The empanadas are made of corn filled with beef, chicken, and vegetables. They are very popular and are eaten at all hours. "I prepare the food in my house, and I go out with my children to sell in the street," she comments. The advantage of her business is that she can care for her children. The problem is the lack of capital to purchase cooking supplies to prepare the empanadas. This is her first loan sequence with the institution in the two years that she has been working in this business.

It is for these reasons that Nila is applying for a loan for the purchase of cooking ingredients to prepare empanadas.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients to prepare empanadas

loans.name: Milton Javier

texts.es: Las comidas rápidas de Milton son muy reconocidas en un barrio de Soledad, un municipio ubicado en el departamento del Atlántico en donde hace 22 años emprendió su negocio, luego de haber quedado desempleado y con su liquidación compró los utensilios necesarios para empezar a ejercer esta profesión con la que ha logrado sostener a su familia.  Él es padre de dos hijos mayores de edad y vive en compañía de su cónyuge, su familia le ayuda en la atención de su puesto de comidas y su éxito se ha debido al trabajo en equipo con el que ha logrado tener un excelente servicio.  Sus inicios no fueron tan fáciles sin embargo no hay gloria sin sacrificio, hoy en día su negocio es muy prometedor y está cotizado, lo que le permite continuar haciendo acciones de mejora para estar a la vanguardia de la culinaria, es por ello que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en la compra de un enfriador, materias primas y sillas para su establecimiento, una inversión muy importante para el progreso de su negocio.  Así mismo mejora condiciones de imagen y de conservación de alimentos, lo que permite ofrecer un producto de calidad.  Su meta a futuro es tener un local bien adecuado y continuar apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Milton's fast food is well recognized in the Soledad neighborhood, a municipality located in the Atlántico department, where 22 years ago he launched his business after having become unemployed. With his termination pay, he purchased the necessary tools to begin practicing this profession, with which he has managed to support his family. He is the father of two children, now adults, and he lives with his spouse. His family helps him by tending his food stall and its success was due to the excellent service achieved through their teamwork. His beginnings were not very easy. However, there is no glory without sacrifice. Today his business is very prominent and valued. It allows him to continue taking actions to improve it in order to be at the culinary vanguard.

This is why he is applying for a credikiva ['Kiva loan'], his first financing made through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo ['Mario Santo Domingo Foundation'], in order to invest in purchasing a cooler, raw materials, and chairs for his establishment, very important investments for furthering his business. By improving image and food preservation conditions, it will allow him to offer a quality product. His goal for the future is to have a good, suitable premises and to continue helping his children in their professional studies.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a cooler, raw materials, and chairs for his establishment.

loans.name: Elmera

texts.en:
For almost five years now, Elmera has earned a living through raising and selling hogs. She is 37 years old and a married woman with three children aged 14, 11 and nine. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Elmera needs additional capital to support her existing business. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP to buy additional piglets and feed. The loan will enable her to improve her livelihood and raise more pigs. With these new pigs, her earnings will improve.

Elmera will also be able to support her family and do the necessary expansions required in order to improve their living conditions for brighter future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs An is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in a rural area where raising poultry and cattle is her main job. She has been doing this for more than 20 years. 

This loan will help her to build a sanitation latrine in order to improve her family's living standards, especially for her children.

loans.use: to build a latrine and improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Mrs Huong is a hardworking woman. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children. Her family’s income comes mainly from a small business and husbandry. 

Huong would like to borrow this loan in order to build a latrine, which will help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she will be able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine and improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Thuyet

texts.en:
Mrs Thuyet is a hardworking woman. She is 51 years old, married, and has three children. 

She needs a loan to build a sanitation latrine. This will help to improve the health of her family members and also protect the environment. Her family’s income comes mainly from a business, so they have regular monthly income to repay the loan as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine and improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Mrs Thuy is 21 years old, married, and lives with her husband. She works hard to support her family. 

She would like to improve her family’s living standards, especially for her children, but has a lack of capital. This loan will help her to build a sanitation latrine. She is able to repay the loan by selling chickens, pigs and vegetables.

loans.use: to build a latrine and improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Vara Laxmi Group

texts.en:
Santilata is an inhabitant of Kumutipentha village in the Rayagada district of Odisha, India. The lady standing in the front row first from the right with her hand raised in the photo is Santilata. She is 31 years old and resides with her husband and one son. Santilata has been running a grocery store for the last seven years with the support of her husband. She is doing a very good business by fulfilling the demands of her customers on time. The monthly family income of Santilata is about 8,500 INR.

For the development of her business, Santilata is in need of financial support at an affordable cost. With this loan amount, Santilata will purchase rice, tea, sugar, oil, nuts, biscuits, detergent, shampoo, soap, etc. from the wholesaler. She hopes this will definitely help her to expand the business and to earn an extra profit. Santilata’s dream is to provide better education to her child for his better future. The other four members of the group are doing tailoring, running a Xerox shop, and a motor garage.

loans.use: to purchase rice, tea, sugar, oil, nuts, biscuits, detergent, shampoo, soap, etc.

loans.name: Chanthy's Group

texts.en:
Chanthy, 52, is the mother of five children, two of whom are still in school. The family lives in Mondulkiri province. For the past six years she has operated a sari-sari, or small general store, while her husband has driven a taxi to earn a living. Her main challenge this year has been a shortfall in profits due to her having to use extra capital to restock her store.

Chanthy took out and successfully repaid a previous loan through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia, which resulted in steady improvement in her business. She is the leader of this group of three members and has applied for a 5,400,000 KHR loan to be apportioned among themselves. Chanthy will use her entire loan portion to buy more groceries for her shop so as to attract more customers and increase her sales.

Chanthy hopes to earn more money to spend on her children’s educational costs.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her shop to attract more customers, increase her sales and so have more money to spend on her children’s educational costs.

loans.name: Aradhana Group

texts.en:
Bhawani, an active married lady of 29 years of age, is a resident of Rayagada, in the district of Rayagada, in Odisha, India. The lady standing third from the right with her hand raised in the photograph is Bhawani. She resides with her husband and has only one son.

To increase the income of her family, Bhawani, along with five other like-minded women of her locality, formed a group and approached Mahashakti Foundation for loan support.

Bhawani’s husband has been running a goods transport business by vehicle in the nearby market for the last five years. At present, the monthly household income is about 9,000 INR. The vehicle has broken down now and needs repairing. However, the repair cost is very high and it is not possible on the part of Bhawani and her family to meet that expense. The family income has stopped now and if the vehicle is not repaired very soon, the family will face various problems. So Bhawani has requested a loan. This loan will be used to purchase different types of spare parts to repair the vehicle.

The other five members of the group are doing a cloth business, a leaf plate business, running a hotel and a cosmetic shop. The loan will definitely change the income level of the members.

loans.use: to purchase different types of spare parts to repair a vehicle.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina es una mujer de 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 8 años y una hija de 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de frutas.
Ella es buena madre, paciente y muy generosa. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias de la ciudad. 
Cristina es de piel morena, cabello trenzado y vestir tradicional. Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de frutas, actividad que heredó de su madre que se dedica al mismo negocio, “tengo mucha experiencia en la venta de frutas…”. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con experiencia en el rubro la desventaja es el tiempo de conservación de la fruta fresca. Su sueño es establecer su negocio, ella desea comprar un kiosco para contar con un puesto de venta fijo y dejar de ambular. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad independientemente.
Es por esos motivos que Cristina solicita un préstamo para la compra de un kiosco para contar con un puesto de venta fijo.
texts.en:
Cristina is a 28-year-old woman; she lives with her partner; she has a son who is 8 and a daughter who is 9; and her business is selling fruit.

She is a good mother, patient and very generous. She does her business on foot at different markets in the city.

Cristina has dark skin, braided hair, and wears traditional clothing. She lives her life with her partner, who works in construction, and with her children, who are in school. They live in a rented room built of brick and mortar that has all the basic utilities. Her business is selling fruits, which is a business that she inherited from her mother, who works in the same business: "I have a lot of experience selling fruits...". The advantage of her business is that she has experience in the profession; the disadvantage is the season for preserving dried fruits. Her dream is to establish her business; she wants to buy a kiosk so she can have a permanent shopping stand and stop selling on foot. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the three years she has run this business independently.

For these reasons Cristina is requesting a loan to buy a kiosk so she can have a permanent shopping stand.

loans.use: to buy a kiosk so she can have a permanent shopping stand.

loans.name: Om Sai Group

texts.en:
Om Sai group is located in Rayagada, in the district of Rayagada, in Odisha, India. This group consists of six women members from the below poverty line category and Manorama is one of them. The lady standing third from the right with her hand raised in the photo is Manorama. She is 44 years. She is the leader of this SHG. She lives with her husband and two sons.

Manorama has been running a hotel (a simple restaurant) with the support of her husband for the last five years. Manorama manages the in-house activities as well as the business. From this business, she earns a monthly income of 9,000 INR. According to Manorama, in the context of the present market situation, this income is hand-to-mouth for her family, so it is very difficult to think of future development.

Although there is a potential market for her business, finances are a hindrance for her. After the intervention of Mahashakti Foundation in her village, she saw a ray of hope and motivated other women members to borrow from Mahashakti Foundation by forming this group.
It will be their first loan. With the present loan, she has planned to purchase more hotel items like rice, wheat, oil, tea, sugar, potatoes, onions, etc. to expand the existing business. She hopes this will help her to generate more income to materialize her dream of giving a better education to her children and constructing a house for her family.

The other five members of the group are also running small enterprises like a grocery shop, Bengal shop, cloth shop and a tailoring business.

loans.use: to purchase more hotel items like, rice, wheat, oil, tea, sugar, potatoes, onion, etc.

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.fr: Rachelle, 27 ans, vit union libre. Elle a un enfant à charge. Ce dernier est régulièrement scolarisé.  Pour trouver de quoi faire vivre sa famille et subvenir aux besoins de tous les jours, elle a mis sur pied une boutique de produits alimentaires. Cela fait déjà 5 ans qu’elle tient cette activité. Elle cherche du financement pour ajouter plus de produits dans la boutique.
texts.en:
Rachelle is twenty-seven years old, lives with her partner and is responsible for one child. Her child regularly attends school.

In order to earn a living, Rachelle opened a shop selling food products five years ago. She is requesting this loan to expand the range of products that she offers.

loans.use: to buy boxes of eggs and oil.

loans.name: Mirlande

texts.fr: Mirlande, 23 ans, est mariée. Elle habite à Petit-Goâve avec son mari et leur fils. Elle vend des articles pour bébé. Dans le souci d’assurer la croissance de son activité, elle fait des démarches pour trouver un prêt qu’elle va utiliser dans l’achat de biberons et de couches pour nourrissons.
texts.en:
Mirlande is twenty-three years old, married and lives in Petit-Goâve with her husband and son. She sells articles for babies.

Mirlande would like to expand her business so she is requesting this loan. She will buy bottles and diapers for babies.

loans.use: to buy bottles and diapers for babies.

loans.name: Lynn Mabel

texts.es:
Lynn es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de vestidos.
Ella es alegre, feliz y muy emprendedora. Su negocio lo realiza en la ceja del alto, zona caracterizada por el comercio informal en todas las áreas.
Lynn es de baja estatura, piel morena y cabello negro, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan y es propia, construida de ladrillo y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de vestidos para bodas, cumpleaños, aniversarios o casuales, “trabajo desde mis 18 años vendiendo para mi mamá, junté un capital y pude independizarme…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que con ayuda de sus familiares pudo capitalizarse, la desventaja es la competencia y la falta de mercadería variada. Su sueño es ser vendedor mayorista y lograr extender su negocio, ella desea comprar vestidos de temporada por mayor para luchar contra la competencia. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lynn solicita un préstamo para la compra de vestidos por mayor para luchar contra la competencia.
texts.en:
Lynn is a young woman of 21; she is single, has no children, and her business is selling dresses.

She is upbeat, happy, and very entrepreneurial. Her business is located in La Ceja del Alto, a neighborhood known for having informal businesses everywhere.

Lynn is short, with dark skin and black hair; her mother tongue is Aymara and she speaks Spanish. She lives at home with her working parents who own their home, which is made of brick and has all the basic utilities. Her business is selling dresses for weddings, birthdays, anniversaries, and casual dresses: "I have worked since I was 18 selling for my mom; I saved up some money and was able to go out on my own," she tells us. The advantage of her business is that she was able to capitalize on it with the help of her relatives; the disadvantage is competition and a lack of variety in her merchandise. Her dream is to be a wholesaler and to be able to expand her business. She wants to buy seasonal dresses wholesale so she can beat her competition. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years she has had her business.

For these reasons Lynn is requesting a loan buy dresses wholesale so she can beat her competition.

loans.use: to buy dresses wholesale to beat her competition.

loans.name: Radha Krushna Group

texts.en:
In the year 2015, a woman entrepreneur named Padma of Kotapeta village in the Rayagada district in Odisha, India formed a group named “Radha Krushna”with three other women from her locality with the intervention of Mahashakti Foundation.

The lady standing second from right raising her hand in the photo is Padma. She is 34 years old and is living with her husband and two children. She is doing vegetable vending with the support of her husband. Padma is selling vegetables at her home. She started this business seven years ago on a small scale and has been working hard to grow her business. Her family earns a monthly income of 8,500 INR, with which it is very hard to manage the family's educational, domestic and business expenses. Due to a lack of finances, she is not able to complete the construction of her house. So Padma is planning to expand her business. With the present loan, she will purchase a stock of Brinjal, tomatoes, green chili, zinger, garlic, curly flowers, cabbage, carrots, cucumbers and all green vegetables along with a large quantity of potatoes and onions. Padma dreams of completing the construction of her house and giving a better education to her children.

The other three members of the group are running a cosmetics shop, a hotel and a salon.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of Brinjal, tomatoes, green chili, zinger, garlic, curly flowers, cabbage, carrots, cucumbers and all green vegetables along with a large quantity of potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Merzelia

texts.fr: Merzelia, 50 ans, mariée, mère de deux enfants, est commerçante. Elle revend des produits alimentaires. Pour éviter des ruptures de stock, elle a recours au microcrédit. Son rêve est de devenir stable financièrement.
texts.en:
Merzelia is fifty years old, married and mother to two children. She is a trader and sells food products.

In order to avoid selling out of stock, Merzelia has requested a loan. Her dream is to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy boxes of milk.

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et a cinq enfants. Elle est revendeuse de légumes. Elle vend des oignons, épinards, aubergine, choux, laitues, etc. Pour éviter des ruptures de stock, elle contracte des prêts.
texts.en:
Jeanne is forty-nine years old, married and has five children. She sells vegetables such as onions, spinach, aubergines, cabbages and lettuces.

Jeanne is requesting a loan to build up her stock levels and avoid running out of supplies.

loans.use: to buy onions and sacks of aubergines.

loans.name: Gertha

texts.fr: Gertha a 38 ans. Elle est veuve et a deux enfants. Elle revend des vêtements. C’est grâce aux revenus gagnés sur cette activité qu’elle arrive à prendre soin de sa famille. Elle est très déterminée à améliorer sa situation financière. Elle demande un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Gertha is thirty-eight years old, a widow and has two children. She sells clothing to earn a living to support her family.

Gertha is determined to improve her financial situation so she has requested this loan to build up her stock levels.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dresses for girls.

loans.name: Nestor David

texts.es:
Néstor es un joven muy trabajador, es soltero y no tiene hijos, tiene 22 años, vive en una casa arrendada desde hace 2 años. Vive en la cuidad de Antonio Ante desde hace 5 años desde entonces trabaja como ayudante en una vulcanizadora, trabajo durante 2 años y luego se cambió de trabajo a Serviauto y ya trabaja en este lugar 3 años. Tiene experiencia en todas las tareas que se realizan en una vulcanizadora, además con los ingresos que tiene de su trabajo ha ido comprando maquinaria necesaria para iniciar su negocio, y actualmente cuenta con una balanceadora, un compresor, 3 gatas, una enllantadora y herramientas, además ya tiene ubicado el lugar en donde va funcionar su vulcanizadora, puesto que ya firmó el contrato de arrendamiento  por 2 años.
Vive en Natabuela, que pertenece a la ciudad de Antonio Ante, es conocida y visitada por la gran oferta de tiene en productos textiles y además por su gastronomía típica como la fritada.
El crédito lo va invertir en la compra de aros y llantas. Agradece a KIVA por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Néstor is a very hardworking young man; he is single and has no children. He is 22 and has lived in a rented house for two years. He has lived in the city of Antonio Ante for 5 years, where he worked as an assistant at a tire shop. He worked there for 2 years then went on to work at a Serviauto mechanic's shop and he has been there for 3 years now. He has experience with all the work that is done at a tire shop and with the income from his work he has been buying the machinery he needs to start his own business. He currently has a balancing machine, a compressor, 3 jacks, a tire mounting machine, and tools. He also has a place where he will set up his tire shop, as he already signed a rent agreement for 2 years.

He lives in Natabuela, part of the city of Antonio Ante, which is known and frequented for its wide array of textile products, as well as for its typical dishes, such as fritada.

He will use this loan to buy rims and tires. He thanks KIVA for the help he has been offered.

loans.use: to start his auto repair and tire business so he can apply the knowledge from his years of experience.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo makes a living through his retailing business. He runs a lumberyard in Calamba and earns a promising income to support his family. He has signed up for his membership with PMPC to gain access to capitalization. He wants to increase his inventory. Now he availed a loan to purchase more lumber to sell. Leonardo hopes to sustain his business and dreams of sending all his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to sell

loans.name: Pablo

texts.en:
Pablo immigrated to Perth Amboy at the age of 10 from Santo Domingo in the Dominican Republic. Pablo has always wanted to own his own business, something he realized as a child while helping his mother sell homemade Dominican sweets after school. After graduating from high school, Pablo's brother started his own trucking company, and Pablo began to work for his older brother, eventually driving routes. Over several years, he learned the ins and outs of the trucking business, and eventually saved up enough to buy his own truck and start his own business. Now, Pablo delivers home goods to the local businesses of Perth Amboy, a fact he is especially proud of because it means he is supporting his local community.

Pablo runs his business as a team with his fiancee. While he drives the routes, his wife-to-be handles all of the payroll and clerical work that needs to be done to keep his company up and running strong. Pablo plans to use this loan to purchase a second truck, hire a driver, and expand his business. He is excited to take this step as he and his fiancee are expecting a child and planning their wedding.

loans.use: to purchase a second truck

loans.name: Finber

texts.en:
Finber has been driving trucks for five years, and last year he took advantage of an opportunity to start his own trucking business. Since Finber is the primary caretaker for his mother, the move from being a driver to having his own company made a major impact on his family. After struggling to get by for many years, Finber's business has begun to transform his life. He can now support his mother, and he recently got engaged to his girlfriend.

Finber began his business by driving routes for Amazon. More recently, he began contracting with Disney. Finber has hired four people from Perth Amboy to help him with his business that now delivers Disney products to retailers all over New Jersey, New York City, and Upstate New York. Finber now has the opportunity to take on more routes for Disney, and he needs to buy another truck to be able to meet the demand. A Kiva loan from you will help Finber purchase another truck and put another driver on the road as he continues to grow his business in support of his family.

loans.use: to purchase another truck

loans.name: Maria Belen

texts.es:
María Belén es una joven trabajadora, desde que tenía 15 años trabaja en sus meses de vacaciones atendiendo locales comerciales en la ciudad de Otavalo, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, también aporta económicamente en su hogar, adicional ella también confecciona camisas indígenas, por lo que obtiene un ingreso extra para cubrir con sus gastos. Es soltera y no tiene hijos, tiene 21 años y ya se graduó del colegio.
Vive en el barrio Monserrath Alto de la ciudad de Otavalo, en la zona las personas se dedican a la confección de ropa en tela polar. Otavalo es una ciudad muy reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional, por sus lugares turísticos, sus tradiciones y gastronomía típica, entre los más destacados tenemos la plaza de ponchos, las piscinas Neptuno, las fiestas de inty raimy y pawkar raimy, y el plato llamado yamor.
Desea iniciar con su propio negocio de comercio de productos Naturales, conoció este negocio por sus amigos quienes le apoyan para que María Belén pueda emprender este negocio. Los productos Naturales son bebidas energizantes, vienen en sobres para disolver en agua y son de diferentes sabores.
Con esta inversión en este negocio María Belén desea mejorar sus ingresos para apoyar a su madre y mejorar su calidad de vida. Agradece a KIVA por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
María Belén is a hard-working young woman. Since the age of 15, she worked in the school holidays as an assistant in local shops in the city of Otavalo. She lives with her parents and brothers and sisters and she also contributes financially to the family home. She makes indigenous blouses, which gives her extra income to cover her costs.

She is 21 years old, single with no children and has graduated from school. She lives in the Monserrath Alto district of the city of Otavalo, the area where people make clothes from fleece.

The city of Otavalo is well-known nationally and internationally for its tourist sites, traditions and typical gastronomy. Some of the best known are the Plaza de los Ponchos, the Neptune Pools, the inty raimy and pawkar raimy festivals and the silver called yamor.

María Belén wants to start her own business selling Natural products. She knows about this business from friends who are helping her to start her business. The Natural products consist of energy drinks that come in sachets in different flavours and are dissolved in water.

With this business investment, María Belén hopes to improve her income to support her mother and improve her quality of life. She is grateful to KIVA for the support she is being offered.

loans.use: to start selling natural products to diversify her existing business and increase her income.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en: Modesto has been raised by a carpenter father. As he grew up, he assisted his father in carpentry work, especially making furniture,  which has now become a source of income for Modesto. Unable to sustain his business due to financial constraints, he signed up with Paglaum MPC for additional capital. Now that he successfully repaid all his loans without records of defaults, he applied for a loan to expand his furniture production. The amount of PHP 10,000 will be used to purchase lumber, varnish, paints and carving tools for his furniture-making business.

loans.use: to purchase lumber, varnish, paints and carving tools for his furniture-making business.

loans.name: Esa

texts.en: Esa is married with five adult-age children. She operates a hog-fattening business in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She provides the needs of her family through this. She obtained her initial capitalization from Paglaum MPC. She successfully rolled her business proceeds and bought neighboring land that she cultivates now for additional income. Now that she needs additional capital to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins, she asked for a loan from the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en: Zarina is a 31-year-old married woman. She has two children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Zarina expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 52-year-old woman living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her son is a driver by profession and provides transportation services by using a three-wheeled auto rickshaw. With the help of his savings, he has purchased a used auto rickshaw. Its engine quality is good but the body is totally damaged. He does not have a sufficient amount to buy a new body and seat covers. He wants to start driving but is looking for lump sum amount to buy a rickshaw body.

Therefore, Zubaida has requested a loan for her son so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and seat covers and can drive the rickshaw smoothly. Zubaida hopes that now her son will be able to earn more income. Zubaida is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body and seat covers for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna has wide experience in farming. She has mastered the farming activities of growing, caring, harvesting and earning income as well. Myrna has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Myrna has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  Someday, Myrna hopes to purchase additional rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Advincula

texts.en: Advincula, 41 years old, lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental with her husband and three children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack and food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viands and snacks to her neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. She became a Microfinance member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she has applied for 14,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en: Shazia is a 25-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of three children. She is working very hard to provide her family with the basic necesstities of life. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Emprendedora V P  1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Elena is one of the members of Emprendedora V P 1 & 2 (Entrepreuners). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo, in a community district called Los Guaricanos. These 10 businesspeople are dedicated to working hard and developing their businesses to bring changes to their families and their community.

Elena makes her home in a simple structure with two of her six children and she is a single mom. They live together in this neighborhood of scarce resources. She is excited to be taking out her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She sells underwear and she will invest this loan to increase her inventory. Elena also sells food that she cooks in her home. She enjoys cooking, which is the reason why she is running this second business. She will use the profits to provide her family's needs; she also saves to reinvest when she needs to buy for any of her businesses. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Roger Romer

texts.es:
Roger es un hombre  de 27 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de electrodomésticos.
Él es emprendedor, independiente y muy responsable. Su negocio lo realiza en la población de ‘los yungas’ que se encuentra a 4 horas de distancia por tierra de la ciudad, de clima tropical muy húmedo.
Roger es de tez morena, cabello y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a l mismo negocio, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica no cuenta con agua potable ni alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de electrodomésticos, como; televisores, microondas, ollas, planchas, dvd’s y otros, “compro mercadería en la ciudad y la vendo en mi población donde tengo mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la competencia es mínima, la desventaja es el transporte de la mercadería hasta el lugar. Su sueño es establecer su negocio, él desea comprar electrodomésticos para satisfacer la demanda de su pueblo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Roger solicita un préstamo para la compra de electrodomésticos para satisfacer la demanda de su pueblo.
texts.en:
Roger is 27 years old and lives with his partner. The couple has no children. Roger has a business selling electrical appliances.

Roger is enterprising, independent and very responsible. His business is in the town of Los Yungas, four hours on land from the city. Here the climate is tropical and very humid.

Roger himself is dark skinned, with dark hair. He is thin, and has Aymara as his native tongue although he also speaks Spanish. Roger shares his life with his partner, who also works at his business. The couple lives in a room that they rent; it is built with bricks and cement. The room has electricity but no running water; it is not connected to any sewer system.

Roger has a business selling electrical appliances, such as televisions, microwaves, pots, irons, DVD players, and more.

He says, "I buy merchandise in the city and sell it in my town where I have my business.

One strong point of Roger's business is that there is very little competition. One difficulty Roger has, however, is transporting merchandise.

Roger's dream is to establish his business on the market. He wants to buy electrical appliances to satisfy demand in his town.

This is Roger's first loan with Emprender in the time that he has had his business.

For the above reasons, Roger is applying for a loan in order to buy electrical appliances to satisfy demand in his town.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances to cover demand in his town.

loans.name: Marie Myrtha

texts.fr: Cela fait 10 ans que Myrtha est dans le commerce de chaussures. Agée de 46 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant, elle est infatigable. Elle souhaite devenir une commerçante de grand renom dans son quariter. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en: Myrtha has been selling shoes for 10 years. She is tireless—she is 46 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She would like to become a renowned seller in her neighborhood. She needs a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: buy men's shoes.

loans.name: Marie-Lise

texts.fr: Marie-Lise, 25 ans, est célibataire et sans enfants à charge. Son activité est un petit poulailler. Elle y élève une trentaine de poussins qu’elle revend ensuite à des particuliers dans la zone. Son reve est d’agrandir le poulailler.
texts.en: Marie-Lise is 25 years old and has no dependents. She runs a henhouse with about 30 chicks that she then resells to individuals in her area. Her dream is to have a bigger henhouse.

loans.use: buy chicks.

loans.name: Yanique

texts.fr: Yanique a 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants. Elle vend des produits alimentaires pour gagner de quoi nourrir sa famille et assurer l’écolage de ses enfants.  Cela fait déjà 14 ans qu’elle est dans le commerce de produits alimentaires en détail. Elle du financement pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Yanique is 38 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. She sells groceries in order to feed her family and secure her children’s education.

She has been selling groceries at retail prices for 14 years. She needs financing to increase her stock.

loans.use: buy rice and beans.

loans.name: Jeannise

texts.fr: Jeannise  a 58 ans. Elle est mariée et a trois enfants.  Elle vend des livres scolaires. Pour la rentrée des classes, elle souhaite bien profiter de la montée de la demande pour multiplier ses ventes. Elle a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock.
texts.en:
Jeannise is 58 years old. She is married and has three children. She sells school books.

She would like to take advantage of the increase in demand on the first day of school to multiply her sales. She needs a loan to increase her stock.

loans.use: buy books.

loans.name: Onimanoro Judith Mireille

texts.fr: Onimanoro remercie beaucoup tous les prêteurs qui l'ont aidé lors de son dernier prêt avec lequel elle a pu augmenter ses  stocks de riz c'est à dire augmenter son fonds de roulement et qui a pour conséquence l'augmentation des bénéfices. En ce moment de préparation à la rentrée scolaire (2015-2016), elle voudrait investir dans les fournitures de bureau et scolaire, c'est pourquoi, elle demande un autre crédit de 1,600,000 mga. En ce moment, elle arrive à vendre en gros sur certaines marchandises. C'est une femme courageuse et travailleuse. Son acharnement au travail a pour but d'offrir à ses enfants une meilleure condition de vie et surtout pour leurs scolarisations.
texts.en:
Onimanoro thanks the lenders who helped her with her last loan. This loan helped increase her stock of rice, which led to increased working capital and profits.

While preparing for the 2015-2016 school year, she would like to invest in office and school supplies. For this reason, she is asking for another loan for 1,600,000 MGA.

Currently, she sells some of her goods for wholesale prices. She is a courageous and hard-working woman. Her relentlessness toward her work allows her provide her children with better living conditions and schooling.

loans.use: buy 10 bags of rice plus office and school supplies.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man with 2 children who describes himself as ambitious. He has operated a retail business to sell timber for 3 years. His primary customers are local people.

He will use the loan to buy more timber. His business goal is to start a hardware store within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more timber

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 57-year-old married woman with three children.

She has earned a living raising pigs for 5 years. Vilma is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She earns additional income from food vending and operating a computer shop.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream: which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas han visto una gran oportunidad en este programa, ya que podrán conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Ramona, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas frescas de estación, hace sus ventas de forma ambulante, y por medio de sus ventas tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia, y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Ramona es una mujer muy emprendedora que está esforzándose a través de su trabajo para poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas de estación para la venta, para que de esa forma pueda seguir con sus ventas, y tener los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The communal bank is in the program of eliminating poverty, they have seen a largte opportunity in this program, since they will be able to know the situation of life of each one, and according to that to be able to improve their living conditions.

One of the members of the communal bank is Ramona, who makes a living selling fresh seasonal fruits as a street vendor and through her sales she has the means to help her family so they do not have to go through any type of needs. Ramona is a very enterprising woman who is striving to get ahead through her job.

She is asking for this loan to buy seasonal fruit to sell so that she may continue with her sales and have the means to help her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits to sell.

loans.name: 6 De Enero Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó en la Lejana ciudad de San Pedro, una zona alejada de la capital del país que aún está en crecimiento, y que tiene un difícil acceso, donde las integrantes del grupo sueñan con que su ciudad crezca y mejore.
La señora Cecilia es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, comenta que trabaja en la venta de ropas usadas, tiene una gran cantidad, y con este trabajo humilde lucha para poder dar a sus seres queridos lo que ella no pudo tener. Cecilia se sacrifica para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y la de su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas usadas, para poder seguir con sus ventas, y de esa forma continuar luchando por mejorar su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
This group was formed in the distant city of San Pedro. It is an area far from the capital of the country that is still growing. It is difficult to access. The members of this group dream of their city growing and improving.

Cecilia is a very hardworking woman who is a fighter. She says that she works selling used clothing. She has a large quantity, and with this humble work she fights to give her loved ones what she was unable to have. Cecilia makes sacrifices in order to be able to improve her and her family's living conditions.

She is asking for this loan to be able to invest in buying used clothing to continue with her sales and that way continue fighting to improve her enterprise.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida is an amazing woman who lives in small village near Hebron City. She has five children and works hard to ensure a good life for them and ensure that they do not need anything.

Majida husband works as employee but he could not cover all the needs for his big family. She wants to help him in anyway she can and because she is a very productive and ambitious woman, she decided to open her own business.

Majida started her business five years ago to sew clothes to sell. She gained experience and decided to expand and develop her work. She will use the loan to help her buy a new sewing machine, yarn, and fabric to increase her income.

She needs your support to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to  buy a new sewing machine, yarn, and fabric to increase her income.

loans.name: Asesewa 2 Group

texts.en:
The Asesewa 2 group is in the city of Accra, Teshie. They demonstrate unity and trust among themselves. They work separately on tasks and they are comfortable and feel okay with their respective jobs; they intend to improve their earnings and become increasingly more independent. They sell soft drinks, slippers, banku (cooked corn and cassava paste), fried chicken, fresh and fried fish, tea, and bread.

Gladys is one of the members of this group. She has sacrificed a lot and little by little, has been making progress. She sells slippers, soft drinks, and sewing accessories to her customers. She started out with very little, but she has been making progress and she is fairly well-known in her neighborhood.

She requests this loan to buy slippers, soft drinks, and sewing accessories to better serve her customers.

She is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to grow and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy slippers, soft drinks and sewing accessories to be able to serve her customers better.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman who has operated a retail business for 5 years. She sells shoes and clothes.

Her primary customers are local people. Her biggest business challenge is a lack of capital. She will use the loan to buy shoes and clothes.

Her business goal is to have a big fashion shop within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy  shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina  is a 48-year-old married woman who trades fabric. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells them in her town. She has a strong customer base and requests 50,000 PKR. She will use the loan  to buy a greater variety of fabric in different colors and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cloth in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy edible products, beverages, juices, snacks and more, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cadel

texts.en:
Cadel is a 28-year-old man from Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

He joined Paglaum MPC in 2015 and he appreciates the programs and services of the co-op.

He has helped his family by selling fish for 2 years, in different barangays in the municipality of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. His motorcycle provides transportation to reached the different barangays to sell fish.

He needs additional working capital and requests financial assistance from Paglaum MPC to purchase fish.

He hopes to increase his income to provide for the daily needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Ledelina

texts.en:
Ledelina is a 57-year-old married businesswoman from Calamba. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Ledelina is a full fledged member of PMPC and has had several loans. She maintains her membership in good standing and has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and consumable items.

Ledelina continues to look for better business opportunities which is proof that she has the passion and energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Mère de cinq enfants, Ablavi est une femme mariée âgée de 52 ans résidant à Baguida. Ablavi  prépare et vend de la boisson locale appelé « Tchoukoudou » faite à base du mil. Ablavi s’approvisionne du nécessaire une fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des bols de mil, Ablavi  demande ce prêt pour financer son achat ; ce qui lui permet d’augmenter sa quantité de marchandises, éviter les ruptures ; de fidéliser ses clients et avoir plus de bénéfices pour participer aux charges de son foyer puis aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Ablavi is 52 years old, married and mother to five children; they live in Baguida. Ablavi makes and sells a local drink called "Tchoukoudou", which is made from millet. She gets the supplies she needs once a month at the market, and is requessting this loan to fund the purchase of bowls of millet. This will enable her to increase her quantity of goods, avoid running out of stock and maintain her customers' loyalty, so that she can make more profit to contribute to the household's daily outgoings and help with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 130 bowls of millet.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants, Amavi est une femme résidante à Baguida. Agée de 65 ans, Amavi est une revendeuse d’oignons et des carottes qu’elle achète trois fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant dans les quartiers  environnant. Amavi désire ce crédit pour commander des tas d’oignons et des bassines de carottes afin de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en: Amavi, who is 65 years old, married and mother to three children, lives in Baguida. She retails onions and carrots which she buys three times a month at the market and then resells while wandering around the surrounding districts. Amavi would like this loan so she can order heaps of onions and bowls of carrots in order to earn sufficient profit to help out with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy two piles of onions and four bowls of carrots.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is a 29-year-old single woman with 3 school-aged children. She has a butcher shop business. She is supported by Paglaum MPC as a financial partner in her ventures.

She requests a loan to buy livestock to butcher to have enough meat to sell.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Flor Camarosa Group 1

texts.en:
Juana is a 43-year-old woman with six children ranging in age from 21 to 8 years old. She married when she was twenty years old.

She is a weaver and sells tissue. She has had a lot of debts and her income was not enough to pay the debts and meet her family's needs.

She heard about an association in Chajul that gave loans; this was the Chajulense Association of Women United for Life. She was informed that she had to be part of a group of women to get access to the credit. With the support of the association, she formed a group called the Camarosa Group.

Her first loan helped her to cover her debts and buy thread. A new life began for Juana. She will use a second loan to buy poultry, pigs, and thread.

The loans have enabled her to offer their children better food and clothing.

Juana is the leader of Camarosa Group 1. The group consists of seven women from the ethnicity Ixil Maya. The group will invest their loans in typical tissue (71%) and retailing (29%).

loans.use: to  buy thread, poultry, and pigs.

loans.name: Vespertina Encarnacion

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  los socios del Grupo De Crédito Liceth del Florón. 
En este lugar vive la señora Vespertina, tiene 71 años de edad, hace ya varios años su esposo falleció y quedo viuda, pero de esa relación tiene 8  hijos mayores de edad, con  ella vive una hija que aun está soltera.
Doña Vespertina para ganarse su propio sustento y para ayudarle a su hija en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la cría de gallinas criollas y chanchos, para esto ella tiene una pequeña granja en sus casa, allí  cría sus gallinas y chanchos  y luego las lleva al mercado local a vender las gallinas y los huevos que estas le dan y con lo cual se gana algo extra, los chanchos los vende a comerciantes en su casa. Así ella logra salir adelante sin depender  de sus hijos.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas tanto para las gallinas y  los chanchos. Es fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños seguir adelante contando con la ayuda de la fundación.
texts.en:
In the El Florón neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Liceth del Florón loan group meet every two weeks.

Vespertina lives in this place. She is 71 years old and some years ago her husband died and she became a widow, but from this relationship she has 8 adult children and one daughter, who is still single, lives with her.

Vespertina, to earn her own sustenance and to help her daughter with the household expenses, works raising creole hens and pigs. For this, she has a small farm at their house. There, she raises her hens and pigs and later she brings them to the local market to sell the hens and the eggs that they lay and with that she earns a little something extra. She sells the pigs to business people at her house. So, she manages to get ahead without depending on her children.

This loan will be used to purchase chickens, and feed and medicines for both the hens and the pigs. She is a founding member of the loan group and she likes it because the loans help her a lot. Her dreams are to continue onward, relying on the help of the foundation.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, and feed and medicines for hens and pigs.

loans.name: Limbert Humberto

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  los socios del Grupo De Crédito Liceth del Florón. 
En este lugar vive don Limbert, tiene 46 años de edad está casado y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos mayores y la menor de 17  años que  estudia enfermería en un centro en la ciudad. Su esposa es comerciante.
El señor Limbert es un hombre muy trabajador que a punta de esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, el tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa, allí  vende todo tipo de víveres, carnes, frutas, legumbres, pescado, aguas gaseosas, helados, cosas de bazar y papelería,  gas de uso domestico entre otros productos, el siempre trata de comprar mayor variedad de productos esto le ha ayudado a ganar más clientela ya que sus clientes encuentran de todo en su local, ya son más de 22 años con su negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito es para comprar más variedad de víveres y productos de bazar. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan a todo el grupo. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y mejorar su vida.
texts.en:
In the El Florón neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Liceth del Florón loan group meet every two weeks.

Limbert lives in this place. He is 46 years old, married, and in this relationship has three children, two adults and the younger one who is 17 is studying nursing at a school in the city. His wife is a businesswoman.

Limbert is a very hard-working man who, with his efforts, has managed to get his family ahead. He has a grocery store in his house. There, he sells all sorts of groceries, meat, fruit, vegetables, fish, sparkling water, ice cream, small miscellaneous items and paper goods, natural gas, and other products. He always tries to purchase a greater variety of products. This has helped him to earn more customers since his customers find everything in his store. He has had the business for over 22 years now, which allows him to earn a living.

This loan is to purchase more variety of groceries and miscellaneous items. He has been in the communal bank since the beginning and he likes it for the help that it gives the whole group. His dreams are to get ahead and improve his life.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and miscellaneous small items.

loans.name: María Melicenda

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  los socios del Grupo De Crédito Liceth del Florón. 
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene  44 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene una hija de 16 años de edad la cual estudia en colegio. 
Doña María es una mujer que siempre le ha gustado ganarse lo suyo y así salir adelante sola, ella es la encargada del bar de una escuela de la ciudad, allí vende alimentos que ella prepara desde muy de mañana en su casa, como ceviches, arroz colorado, corviches, empanadas y sanduches acompañados de jugos naturales, todos estos alimentos preparados  de la manera más saludable para que los niños tengan muy buena alimentación, ella varían el menú todos los días para no cansar a los niños. Esto le deja lo necesario para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va  a emplear para comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos, así como también platos, vasos y otras cosa que necesita. Lleva 3 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a  los créditos ella empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante mejorando con la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
In the El Florón neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of the Liceth del Florón loan group meet every two weeks.

María lives in this place. She is 44 years old, separated, and from this relationship has a 16-year-old daughter who is in secondary school.

María is a woman who always has liked to earn her own way and, so, to get ahead alone. She is in charge of the food stand at a school in the city. There, she sells food that she prepares from the early morning at her house, such as ceviches, arroz colorado [a rice dish], corviches [a savory stuffed pastry], empanadas and sandwiches with natural juices. All of these foods are prepared in the most healthful way so that the children have very good nutrition. She varies the menu every day so the children don't get tired of it. This lets her have what she needs to get ahead.

This loan will be used to purchase groceries to make her dishes, and also plates, glasses, and other things she needs. She has been in the loan group for 3 loan cycles and she likes it because, thanks to the loans, she began her business. Her dreams are to continue improving with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, plates and glasses.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José es soltero, tiene 25 años, no tiene hijos, vive en casa familiar con sus padres. 
José desde hace 5 meses se dedica a la crianza de pollos, el los compra de semanas luego los cría para venderlos, José no va a las ferias para expender sus productos, los clientes lo llaman y le hacen pedidos, el entrega los pollos en su domicilio, según los pedidos que tenga. Tiene adecuado un galpón en una casa de adobe, con plásticos y viruta, por lo que quiere invertir en un nuevo galpón, y en la compra de más pollos, para mejorar sus ingresos.
Vive en Pucara de San Roque de la ciudad de Antonio Ante, en la zona las personas se dedican a la crianza de diferentes animales como chanchos, cuyes y pollos. Antonio Ante es muy reconocido a nivel nacional por sus productos textiles, ya que en esta ciudad funcionan muchas fábricas de confección de prendas de vestir, por lo que cuenta con un gran número de almacenes de venta de ropa, además en la ciudad es muy conocido el plato típico la fritada.
José solicita un crédito para invertirlo en su negocio, agradece a KIVA por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José is single, 25 years old, doesn't have children, and lives in the family house with his parents.

For the past 5 months, José has worked raising chickens. He purchases them weekly then raises them to sell. José doesn't go to the markets to sell them, he delivers them to the home according to the orders he has. He has outfitted a chicken coop in an adobe house, with plastics and shavings, so he wants to invest in a new chicken coop and in the purchase of more chickens to improve his income.

He lives in Pucara de San Roque, in the city of Antonio Ante. In this zone, people work raising different animals such as pigs, guinea pigs and chickens. Antonio Ante is very well-known nationally for its textile products since in this city there are many factories that make clothing, so it has many clothing stores. In addition, the city is well known for its traditional dish, the fritata.

José asks for a loan to invest it in his business. He is grateful to Kiva for the offered support.

loans.use: to invest in a chicken coop and purchase more chicks, in this way to improve his earnings.

loans.name: Luyen

texts.en:
Luyen is 43 years old. She is married and has two children, so she works very hard to provide for them. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and cultivation.

She is interested in improving the living standard for her family, so she needs the loan to build a toilet.

loans.use: to build a toilet to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Ban

texts.en:
Ban is a 25-year-old single security guard at a microfinance institution who resides in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. He has worked in the province since 2014, earning approximately $4.7 per day.

Ban is also pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in finance and banking in his first year. Due to the fact that he is lacking finance to pay his first-year university fees, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to go through the first year at the university successfully.

Ban dreams of running a small business so he will be able to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his first-year university fees.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy continúa con su negocio de producción de estuco. El préstamo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de leña y combustible. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Con su préstamo pudo trabajar y obtener ganancias para el bienestar de su familia, “mis necesidades son las mismas porque la forma de realizar el trabajo no cambia…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son por mayor, la desventaja de su negocio es la carencia de combustible para que funcione el negocio. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio, el desea realizar la compra de abomo y combustible para la explotación de estuco. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Freddy solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y combustible para producir estuco.
texts.en:
Freddy continues with his stucco production business. The previous loan was invested in the purchase of firewood and fuel. The payments were punctual. With the loan, he was able to work and get earnings for his family's well-being. "My needs are the same because the way of doing the work hasn't changed..." he says. The advantage of his business is that the sales are in bulk, the disadvantage of his business is the lack of fuel so for his business to function. His dream is to improve his business. He wants to purchase manure and fuel to make stucco. This is his second loan cycle with the institution in the 6 years that he has been doing this work.

For these reasons, Freddy asks for a loan to purchase manure and fuel to make stucco.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fuel to make stucco.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is a businessman in Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur known for his palay buying and rice trading business. He also owns and operates a rice milling business. He is making good proceeds through this type of business.

Allan said that everything was made possible because of the supports that Paglaum MPC had extended to him. Recently, he availed a loan to purchase more palay (rice grains) for rice milling and grains production.

loans.use: to purchase more palay (rice grains) for rice milling and grains production.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung is 52 years old, married, and has four children.

The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine, which can improve the health of her family as well as protect the environment.

Husbandry is main income source of her family, and she is able to repay the loan monthly from chicken-raising activity.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: The

texts.en:
The is 29 years old. There are five people in her family. Fishing is main income source of her family. She can cover family’s daily costs and education from selling fish, which her husband catches.

With this loan, she can build a hygienic latrine to improve the living conditions and health of her family.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda started her small business and became a boss with her sari-sari store. She has managed to have enough inventories and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. Every day she makes good sales since she is the only store in their barangay.

Recently, she approached Paglaum for much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce.

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Hesila

texts.en:
Hesila is making a profit through her sari-sari (small grocery) store business. She is 41 years old and married and she has three school-age children.

She never gets tired of tending her store. Hesila's passion is selling, and she earns a meager income from it that is sufficient to support her needs.

Hesila is a full-fledged member of PMPC and applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items to increase her inventories and sales. Hesila continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she is determined to pursue her goals.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en:
Binh is 26 years old, married and has a baby.

The loan can help her to build a sanitary latrine, which can improve the health of her family, especially her children.

She has daily income from pig raising and fishing so she is able to repay the loan monthly as scheduled.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Ngon

texts.en:
Ngon is a hardworking woman, 57 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small house and without a hygienic latrine.

The loan can help her to build a latrine to improve her family's living standard. Her family’s income is mainly from husbandry and fishing. With more than 20 years experience and the support of her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Nuevo Oriente I Group

texts.es:
Ingrid es una joven mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 2 meses y 5 años, y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos.
Ella es buena madre, independiente y muy paciente. Su negocio lo realiza ambulantemente en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por su bosque verde tropical.
Ingrid es morena de baja estatura y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español (la primera de la izquierda, carga a su bebe en brazos). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la hizo formar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, artesanía en cuero, venta de cuñapés, venta de refrescos, verdulería y servicio de limpieza para solicitar un crédito y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos como; lápiz labial, sombras, pintura de uñas y otros “ambulo por toda la ciudad, buscando clientes y entregando pedidos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con pedidos continuos, la desventaja es la falta  de capital para reponer el stock de mercadería. Su sueño es tener su negocio en su domicilio, ella desea realizar la compra de cosméticos por mayor para abastecer su stock y cumplir con los pedidos pendientes. Esa es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ingrid solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor para abastecer su stock y cumplir con los pedidos pendientes.
texts.en:
Ingrid is 25-year-old young woman who lives with her partner and has 2 children, ages 2 and 5. Her business is cosmetic sales.

She is a good mother, independent, and very patient. She conducts her sales door-to-door in the southern part of her city, which is characterized by its green, tropical forest.

Ingrid has a dark complexion, short stature, and a robust build. Her native tongue is guaraní and she speaks spanish. In the picture she is the first one on the left holing her baby in her arms. She shares her life with her partner who works in transportation with his sons, who are not yet of school age. They live in a rented room made of brick and cement that has all basic services.

Her need to improve her business led her to form a bank for people with business like food sales, second-hand clothes, leather handicrafts, cuñapés [yucca and cheese bread], refreshments, groceries, and cleaning services to request a loan and improve their businesses.
