Her business is selling cosmetics like: lip liner, eye shadow, nail polish, and others. "I travel through the city looking for clients and delivering orders..." she says. The benefit of her business is that she has continuous orders. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to replenish her stocks and merchandise. Her dream is to run her business out of her home. She hopes to purchase wholesale cosmetics to replenish her stocks and fulfill pending client orders.

This is the first loans with this institutions in the 3 years that she has worked in this business.

For this reasons, Ingrid requests a loan to purchase wholesale cosmetics to replenish her stocks and fulfill pending client orders.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale cosmetics to replenish their stocks and fulfill pending client orders.

loans.name: Assoupi  Pascaline

texts.fr: Sans enfant, Assoupi est une femme mariée résidant à Baguida. Agée de 46 ans, Assoupi est une revendeuse des objets en plastique qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Assoupi vend ses marchandises à domicile et en circulant les quartiers environnant. Assoupi sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des douzaines de sceaux en plastiques et des passoirs en vue de répondre favorablement aux besoins de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière considérable pour aider sa famille supporter les charges quotidiennes.
texts.en: Assoupi is a 46-year-old married woman, with no children, who lives in Baguida. She earns a living through selling plastic items which she purchases from market twice monthly. Assoupi is requesting this loan to purchase plastic buckets and sieves so she can meet her customers needs. By doing this, she will then have a considerable amount of financial independence and will be able to support her family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 10 dozen plastic buckets and eight sieves.

loans.name: Ablewa

texts.fr: Ablewa est une femme mariée âgée de 57 ans résidant à Baguida avec quatre enfants à charge. Ablewa vend des nattes pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants grâce au bénéfice de son activité. Ablewa s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et désire commander le nécessaire pour la fabriquation de ses nattes. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Ablewa  pourra soutenir son mari dans les charges  de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ablewa is a 57-year-old married woman who lives in Baguida with four children in her care. She sells mats in order to meet her children's needs. She is able to do this thanks to the income generated from this activity.

Ablewa gets her supplies from market once per month and wishes to order the items she needs to make these mats. With the resulting profits, Ablewa will be able to support her husband in paying for their family's expenses and she will be able to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase nine piles of mats.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Ayawa est une veuve femme de 71 ans qui vit à Baguida avec ses six enfants à charge. Ayawa vend des perles et du pure water pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants grâce à la rentabitité de son activité. Ayawa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de perles et des sachets de pure water, Ama demande ce prêt  pour financer son achat et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ayawa is a 71-year-old widow who lives in Baguida with six children under her care. She earns a living selling pearls and pure water so she can meet her children's needs. She is able to do so thanks to the income generated by her activity.

Ayawa gets her supplies twice monthly from market. She is requesting this loan to purchase bags of pearls and sachets of pure water so she can earn a good profit. By doing this, she will be able to meet her children's needs.

loans.use: to purchase 10 bags of pearls and 20 sachets of pure water.

loans.name: Jahaira Sara

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Florón de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  los socios del Grupo De Crédito Liceth del Florón. 
En este lugar vive la señora Jahaira, tiene 23 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene un hijo de 5 años el cual estudia en escuela.  Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Jahaira es una mujer que  le gusta trabajar para ayudarle a su marido con los del gastos del hogar, para esto ella  se dedica al comercio, vende  ropa de todo tipo y su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale tres días por semana  y también vende en su casa, deja a crédito y cobran cada ocho  días, lleva varios  años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual le permite ganar lo suyo y en ocasiones solventar los gastos ya que el trabajo de su marido no es seguro.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas y camisetas. Lleva 2 ciclos en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le permiten salir adelante. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the members of the Liceth Credit Group of Floron meet in the area of El Floron of the larger Portoviejo city, capital of Manabi and known for many years as the city with the real tamarinds.

This place is home to Mrs. Jahaira, who is 23 years old and maintains a free union relationship. She has a 5 year old son from this relationship who studies in school. Her husband is a construction worker.

Mrs. Jahaira is a woman who likes to work to help her husband with the expenses of the home. Accordingly, she works in commerce, selling clothes of all types door to door. She goes out three days a week and also sells from her home. She sells on credit and collects payments every week. She has been doing this work for several years which allows her to make her own and on occasion pay for the home's expenses as her husbands job is not always guaranteed.

She will use this loan for the purchase of more merchandise such as: pants, blouses and shirts. She has done two cycles with the credit group and she likes it because the loans help her get ahead. Her dream is to provide the best for her son.

loans.use: purchase pants, blouses and shirts

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Marlene continúa con su negocio de venta de pan. El crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. En esta oportunidad lidera la banca de personas para solicitar un crédito y  mejorar sus negocios, su negocio es la panadería, “con el anterior crédito pude mejorar mi negocio realizando la compra de muebles, ahora necesito comprar harina por quintal…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de  capital para la compra de harina por quintal. Su sueño es ser la elegida por los clientes, ella desea realizar la compra de harina por quintal para hacer pan. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Marlene solicita un préstamo para la compra de harina por quintal para hacer pan.
texts.en:
Marlene continues with her bakery. She invested the previous loan in the purchase of tables and chairs for her business. Her payments were executed punctually as she did not experience any trouble. This time around, she leads a bank of people to request a loan and improve their businesses, hers is baked goods. "With the previous loan I was able to improve my business by purchasing furniture, now I need to purchase flour by the quintal..." she comments. Her business' advantage is that sales are daily, the disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of flour by the quintal.
Her dream is to be the customer favorite, she wants to purchase flour by the quintal to make bread. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in the one year that she has been practicing this activity independently.
These are the reasons that Marlene requests a loan for the purchase of flour by the quintal to make bread.

loans.use: purchase flour by the quintal to make bread

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 56 years old, married, and blessed with six children. Among her children, one is in school while the others are already married. Lolita is engaged in the buying and selling of bananas. She buys volume of bananas in their village and sells them in the market. 

Lolita wants to take a loan of P20,000 to buy more bananas to sell. She hopes to sell more bananas and gain great income from it. It will be a big help for her to grow the business and earn a bigger income to support the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Yulexi Tatiana

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América, en este lugar se reúnen cada 15 días el  Grupo De Crédito Los Radicales.
En este lugar vive la señora Yulexi,  tiene 24  años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene 2 hijos  de 9 y 2 años de edad, la mayor estudia en escuela.  Su esposo es albañil. 
Doña Yulexy es una mujer muy trabajadora que hace lo posible para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella sale todas las mañanas a realizar sus recorridos y también vende en su casa, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene 3 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisuterías. Lleva dos ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y está muy agradecida por  la ayuda de los créditos. Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important getaway spot, popular and visited in Ecuador because of its beautiful and welcoming beaches. It is Ecuador and South America's first deep water port. This is where, every 15 days, the 'Los Radicales' (The Radicals) Credit Group meets.

It is also the home of Mrs. Yulexi, who is 24 years old and in a free union relationship. She has two children from this relationship, ages 9 and 2. The eldest studies in school. Her husband is a construction worker.

Mrs. Yulexy is a hard working woman who does as much as possible to help her husband with the expenses of the home. She does this through the sale of Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women's accessories). She sells door to door, going out every morning to make her rounds and she also sells from her home. She sells on credit and collects payments every week. She has been doing this for the past 3 years and it allows her to make her own for the good of her family.

This loan will be used to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry. She has done two cycles with the credit group and is very thankful for the help the loans provide. Her dream is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
For the last 20 years, Maria earns a living by means of fishing. She catches and sells fresh fish, crabs and shellfish. 
She is 56 years old  married woman with eight children from Talibon, Bohol. Her youngest child is 19, and still attending school. She needs capital to support her fishing livelihood.

She has requested a loan to buy fishing materials like fishing nets and to pay for tuition fee. With the presence of the resources, she could maximize the materials needed and able to support her child's needs.

She is doing her best to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net and pay for tuition fee

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thanking KIVA and its supporters and CCT for their tireless support for small business people like her. The loans which were granted to her were a great help to grow and sustain her ornamental business. She trusts for your continuous help on her livelihood.

Once again she would like to request for a loan in the amount of Php 17000 loan to buy fertilizer, garden soil, pots, nets, various seedlings to grow a variety of ornamentals. Erlinda puts her best efforts to grow beautiful and healthy ornamental plants as this is her source of income to feed and send her children to school. 

Erlinda prays for more customers and dreams to see her children to college to allow them better opportunities in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, garden soil, pots, wires and net she needs to grow more beautiful and healthy ornamental plants.

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
Katlyn is grateful for CCT and KIVA for their continuous support on her livelihood. The numerous loans she has accessed in the past have certainly sustained her store and thus helped provide for her and her child's needs. Being a single parent is not easy but with her faith and hard work she is doing a good job raising her child.

She trusts that she can again take a 19000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of grocery items like canned goods, coffee, soda, instant noodles which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for supporting herself and in sending her child to school. She is thanking God for your heart.

Katlyn's precious dream is to grow her business and send her child to College. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of grocery items, like canned goods, coffee, soda, instant noodles and frozen foods

loans.name: An's Group

texts.en:
An is a farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province. She is 36 years old and a mother of three dependent children. To support her family’s living condition, she does rice cropping and grows cassava as her main businesses. Her rice did not grow well because it has destroyed by insects. She can earn her daily income about 12USD per day and she has involved her businesses for 18 years.

In a group of two, she is the group leader and this is her first time with VisionFund. An will manage her loan portion to buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield. She hopes that her family condition will be better than before after she got this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase productivity of her crop yield.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 42, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by trade and sells milk in the market. His customers like to buy fresh, delicious milk from his shop. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market and the customers as well.

Due to quality and low reasonable rates many of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase the stock of milk on a daily basis and wants to buy milk in large quantity. But he does not have enough cash in hand to buy milk in large quantity.

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy more milk in bulk to sell.

Shahida is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more milk in bulk for her husband's milk shop.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Mrs Hà is 35 years old and she is married. 
She has been operating a food stall selling fish for more than 10 years.
Hà lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this region often suffered by natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.
In 2008, Hà joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hà has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
In the future, Hà hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 19-years-old single young man from Rafah city. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low and unstable income. This income is barely cover all the family needs. 

Maher is a student in the university where he studies Business administration. He Maher to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family in part of their expenses. 

Maher took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Maher will be able to do his home works and reports easily. Maher appears in the photo

loans.use: buy a new laptop for his university studies in Business Administration.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is 38 years old, married and has three children. Her spouse is a truck driver. She is managing an eatery as a source of income. She cooks and sells daily meals and snacks to the people in her village. She had been in her business for about five years now. She would like to cook more meals to improve her daily profits.

So, she is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy ingredients, chicken meat and vegetables to cook and sell. She hopes to keep selling delicious meals and gain more profits in the food-selling business. She will save additional revenue for education purposes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, chicken meat and vegetables to cook and sell

loans.name: Mbuki

texts.en:
Mbuki is 47 years old. She is married and has 3 children. 

She sells vegetables,a business she has done for 6 years. 

She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings. This is her 2nd loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of cabbages, tomatoes and onions and a cow to diversify business. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family with her children clearing education.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes,vegetables and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Stellamaris

texts.en:
StellaMaris is a 40 year old second hand cloth dealer at Kilifi Kenya. 

She is a married mother of two whose spouse provides for additional income, for the past three years she has been doing well.

This is her first borrowing to finance her business.

She will use the loan to purchase second hand clothes and the anticipated profit to repay her loan.

loans.use: to purchase second hand clothes

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James 25 years old. He is married and has one child. His business is farming. 

He has been in this business for 3 years. He earns a monthly income of thirteen thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is his first loan from VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and goats for rearing. 

He will use the profits from expanded business to increase his savings. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a financially stable business and to further his education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and goats for rearing.

loans.name: Chanrithy's Group

texts.en: Chanrithy’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chanrithy makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sokha works as seller and she also does extra work as taxi driver to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sok works as seller to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Berawan Salak Permai Group

texts.en:
The Berawan Salak Permai groups had received loans from MUK and has repaid well. Ni Kadek, head of the group, manages her loan wisely. Any repayment of the loan can be done on time under the supervision the head of the group. Ni Kadek sold her piglets after keep them for 2 months at a satisfactory price. Now she can renovate her house.

Ni Kadek is very grateful for the benefits she earned and she said thanks to lenders for their support. For electricity and water, Ni Kadek spend 200,000 IDR per month.

Now, the Berawan Salak Permai group received their new loan. The group expected to increase the amount of loan, but after had an evaluation from MUK’s staff, the group still receive the same loan amount. One member left the group because she must follow her husband to a new place for a new job there.

Ni Kadek is head of the group. She already has 2 sows and she use her portion of the loan to purchase super quality feed and vitamin. She must protect the health of her sows. She hopes the sows can birth safely and the piglets can grow healthy. She sell the piglets for fattening or pig barbeque. She has a plans to save all the profit and use it for business capital later.

In the meeting, 1 of the member can’t attend because of illness.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feed and vitamins for pigs

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustin es un hombre de 37 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 16 años y 2 hijas de 5 y 7 años, y su negocio es la venta de cd´s, mp3 y mp4.
El es buen padre, independiente y muy trabajador. su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘ceja’ caracterizada por el comercio informal en todas las áreas. 
Agustin es de piel morena, cabello corto y baja estatura. Su vida la comparte con su esposa que se dedica a l mismo negocio y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Su negocio es la venta de cds, dvds; el viaja a la frontera con Perú a comprar su mercadería por mayor para comercializarlo en su puesto de venta, “inicié mi negocio con ayuda de un familiar, hace 8 años que trabajo independientemente…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de  mercadería por mayor. Su sueño es ser un proveedor mayorista, el desea comprar cd’s y dvd’s por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que trabaja independientemente.
Es por esos motivos que Agustin solicita un préstamo para comprar cd’s y dvd’s por mayor para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Agustin is a 37 year old man, married with two boys ages 12 and 16 and two girls ages 5 and 7. His business is the sale of cd's, mp3 and mp4.

He is a good father, independent and hard working. He runs his business in the 'Ceja' zone, characterized by the informal commerce in all areas.

Agustin is dark skinned, has short hair and low height. He shares his live with his wife, who is in the same business, and with his children who study at school. They live in their own home, made of brick, that has all of the basic services.

His business is the sale of cds, dvds; he travels to the frontier with Peru to purchase his merchandise at wholesale prices in order to sell it at his point of sale. "I started my business with the help of a family member, I have been working independently for 8 years..." he comments. His business' advantage is that he can count on daily sales, the disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of wholesale merchandise.

His dream is to be a wholesale provider, and so for now he wants to purchase cd's and dvd's at wholesale. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 8 years that he has worked independently. These are the reasons that Agustin is requesting a loan to purchase cd's and dvd's at wholesale in order to stock his business.

loans.use: purchase cd's and dvd's at wholesale in order to stock his business
